animal.breeds_label: American Staffordshire Terrier & Pit Bull Terrier Mix
animal.description:
BACKSTORY:
Blue-eyed Jake and two other dogs landed at an area animal control due to no fault of their own and kept getting overlooked for some reason or another. But not by us, we had been searching for foster families for these dogs for a couple of months. Each time we struck out we’d feel defeated that they’d have to spend another day in a cage. We knew how amazing each of these dogs were and we wanted others to have the opportunity to see it too. Our interaction team took another group of fosters to meet the trio and we were so hopeful that this was the miracle we were wishing for. Guess what? Dreams do come true!
Jake's foster dad says Jake is the life of the party and needs to be included in everything! He says he is smart, eager to please, and responds to positive reinforcement with treats and petting.
EDUCATION:
* Sit
* Stay
* Down
* Come
* House trained
* Crate trained
* Working on the rest of his manners
* Responds well to redirection when needed
ACTIVITIES THIS CUTIE ENJOYS:
* Treats: not picky with treats, enjoys deli meat on special occasions
* Food: Honest Kitchen Turkey flavor, Stella & Chewy Chicken
* Toys: balls, tug ropes, smart toys with peanut butter
* Cuddling, especially on your lap
* Loves to be outside
* Loves attention
* Likes to dig and zoom before he poops!
SKILLS:
* Dogs: friendly
* Kids: overexcited, recommend older kids
* People: overexcited
* Cats: unknown
CHALLENGES:
* Not a big fan of getting his paws cleaned
* Is mouthy, especially when playing. Working on that!
* Has been known to run off with shoes, slippers, towels and bras but he doesn't chew them
* Pulls hard but eases up on the leash

animal.breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler & Pit Bull Terrier Mix
animal.description:
Approx. DOB: 6/1/18 Approx. Weight: 58 Lbs
Adoption Fee: $ 250 (NOW FULLY SPONSORED as a two people have sponsored her fee) includes a 2 week trial to ensure everyone's happiness!
Lucitta or Lucy as we call her is a real beauty! The people that we got her from said she was Australian Shepherd healer Pitbull mix, but I'm her foster mom and I don't see the Pitbull in her. It doesn't matter anyway because they are the most loving dogs around. She loves people!!! It takes her awhile to chill with other dogs and she prefers them to be more medium size..... Not her size. We do meet and greets with new families that have dogs to be sure there is a good match between them. We want everyone to be happy and that is why we also give you a 2 week trial to be sure she fits in well with your family. She would also be perfectly happy being the only dog in the family.
Lucy is housebroken and crate trained. She is really well behaved in the house and listens well. She does know the commands of 'sit', 'down', 'off' and learning to shake. Doing ok on the leash walking. I think if she had more practice she would be perfect at it. Lucy is extremely smart and so loving. Give this beautiful girl a chance to be a part of your family. A home with a fenced yard is preferred.
Children ages 10 and older please.
I have been spayed, vaccinated, heartworm tested negative and microchipped. If you are interested in adopting me, please complete the adoption application located at www.furrykidsrefuge.org/adoptadog and a dedicated volunteer will get back to you as soon as possible.

Furry Kids' Refuge is in need of good quality dog and puppy food with meat as the first ingredient. You can drop off donations at our weekly adoption events at the Lee's Summit Petco (1860 NW Chipman Road, Lee's Summit, MO), Saturdays only from Noon to 4:00 p.m. Donations are tax deductible as allowed by law.
Would you like to foster a Furry Kid? Furry Kids' Refuge will supply the food & vet care while you supply the basic house rules & love.......win-win for all!! Just visit our website http://www.furrykidsrefuge.org/category/fostering/ for more information. Thanks for your support!

animal.description:
Bolt is about 30 pounds he is 3yrs old, he has an old wound around his neck possibly from a snare. He also has a old wound on top of his head. Both are old wounds and he has been medically cleared of either having any future issues with his health. He is also 100% deaf, he understand hand signals. Because of his deafness I am requiring a fenced in yard to keep him safe. He loves playing with the other dogs and plays excellent by himself, loves all the people he has met, he keeps his kennel clean (with dog door) doesn't eat his bed. He is microchipped, neutered and vaccines are up to date. He is a wonderful companion dog who loves to snuggle. 

Applications are accepted now, they are NOT first come first serve..  

ALL adoptions are done FACE TO FACE, we DO NOT ship dogs out. Adopters must travel to Fairbanks if you live outside the area. Potential adopter must have an overnight visit with the puppy/dog and everyone who lives in the home including pets need to be at that visit. (folks out of town need to travel with all in the home, including pets NO EXCEPTION 
Please DO NOT email the rescue asking if this or any dog is available, all our dogs are available for adoption unless their ad states pending next to their name. Inquiries just asking if a dog/puppy is available will just be deleted! If you cannot spend 2 mins reading an ad you have NO business getting a puppy/dog! These ARE NOT Christmas gifts, and inquiries asking if they are will be deleted.

All adoption fees are $400

Due to Covid the rescue is not allowing anyone in to the kennel buildings, rescue office or the puppy barn. No one can visit more then one puppy. All visits will be done outside so dress for the weather. Children must stay in the vehicle. If you want to meet a puppy before placing a deposit on one you can wait until covid is no longer an issue. 

Please review our adoption process before filling out an application. Adopters MUST be at least 21 to adopt, do not contact asking to bend the rules. 
To see more photos and videos of the rescues visit the our facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/ArcticGermanShepherdRescue
Please note that Petfinder's application is not AGSR application and cannot be a substitute as one. To contact the rescue directly email agsrescue@gmail.com with any questions that are not found on the website or in the ad

animal.description: Meet Chile! This fellow was adopted from us as a small puppy a year ago. He came upon some unfortunate events that brought him back to us. Adopted as a cute, little puppy he has now grown into a handsome, black dog. As he grew up he spent more and more time alone in a backyard. Chile gets so excited with people that he can't contain himself. After the initial introduction he will settle down on a leash and give you a sit. He longs for human companionship. Despite his poor start in life, he is full of unconditional love. Chile's best friend and playmate at the shelter is Shadow. Chile likes to chase balls and toys. Chile, when matched with another dog of his energy plays well. He and Shadow are like two peas in pod at playtime. Chile is a Weimaraner terrier mix. Would you like a big chili to keep you warm this winter? He's ready and waiting to spend furever in your home. Please call for an appointment today.

animal.description:
WILKE is a friendly, 2-year-old, 70-pound, American Bulldog mix.

He's a handsome, good-natured and lovable fella!  WILKE is an awesome young dog, a delightful friend, and an outstanding companion!

WHAT'S NEXT?

If you would like to meet, foster or adopt this pet, please fill out our online FOSTER/ADOPTION APPLICATION which can be found in the main menu of our website or at the bottom of this page - simply copy and paste the link into your browser. EASY PEASY!

Once we've reviewed your application, arrangements can be made for you guys to meet! It'll be kind of like a blind date!

***

This pet is spayed or neutered in accordance with our strict policy wherein all animals are altered prior to adoption. This pet is dewormed, current on vaccines, and started on monthly flea/tick and preventatives.

Animal Alliance's policy is that we will adopt dogs younger than 1 year old to families with children under 9 years old. We do not adopt dogs 1 year or older to families with children under 9 years old due to the unknown history of adult dogs. 

BY APPOINTMENT ONLY:  Meetings at our Adoption Center are by appointment only (no walk-ins).  An online adoption application is required and must be approved prior to meeting any animals.  Adoption appointments are set up by email by our Adoption Coordinator (no phone calls, please).  This process ensures our dedicated time to the animals in our care, as well as full attention to adopters at scheduled times.  

Prior to submitting an application, please see the Animal Alliance Adoption Process for adoption details.

To fill out an adoption application, go to:
https://www.animalalliancenj.org/fosteradoption-application/

animal.description:
Please welcome 2 year old Max to our rescue!! Max has been let down terribly by humans, and he has been constantly adopted out and dumped back at Miami Dade Animal Services.

Max has had no stability and he has been returned just weeks after being in a home. Max has had no structure, and he has minor aggression issues that are being worked on in professional training. He used to not like when you put a slip lead leash over his head, but he has now gotten over this issue. He now sits on command and allows you to put the slip lead leash over his head without reacting. He now goes into his crate willingly and he does come out on command. Max does not like his collar to be pulled/tugged and he will warn you by growling. The trainers are currently working on this issue. These issues are  likely due to abuse in his previous homes. Because of this Max CANNOT go to a home with children of any age.

He is being worked with in training daily to overcome his behavioral issues. Max gets along great with other big dogs and he has a more submissive personality with other dogs.

Max LOVES to be with humans and he is always craving human attention. Max needs a strong husky-experienced home who can continue to provide structure. Max needs a home who can be patient with him and understands that he has a bad past. Max has been in training for two months now and he knows all of his basic commands.

He has made great progress and HE IS NOW READY FOR HIS FOREVER HOME. He knows commands like sit, down, leave it. He needs a home who can work with Max’s issues by being patient and building trust . With an understanding patient loving home Max can really be a loyal and loving dog.

animal.description: Gretchen was found as a stray and ended up at the Tracy shelter. The shelter was a horribly scary place for her and Gretchen became rescue only, not available to the public. Over time, Gretchen warmed up to her handlers and started to come out of her shell. We rescued Gretchen from the shelter on August 25. Gretchen will need an experienced, patient adopter who will give her lots of time to decompress in a new home. For this reason we would prefer a calm home with no children, so that Gretchen will get the time she needs. Positive reinforcement training is also a plus. Gretchen is protective and barky with new people/strangers and will need an experienced handler. Gretchen is fixed, chipped and vaccinated. We think she is a year old. If you are interested in meeting her please fill out an application http://ozziespoundpuppies.org/online-application/

animal.description:
This sweet boy is Comanche.  He is a 6 month old Hound mix who weighs 45 lbs but will about 65 lbs full grown.   

Comanche loves to play, is very sweet, loves other dogs and seems to like cats.  He is a pretty shy dog when he is out in new places but he is very loving and kind.  He is going to do best with a dog companion

Comanche would like a home where he has an active family to take him on daily walks and play with him.  He would benefit greatly from having another playful dog in the home and will definitely need a fenced yard with a 6ft fence and plenty of room to run and play.  

Comanche is  crate trained.  He is working on leash, and house training but will need continued assistance in his forever home.  He is doing really well with house training and even alerts you by scratching at the door but will have an accident if you do not hear him.

Comanche does have some allergies. He is on an over-the-counter antihistamine right now that is low cost.  He is also getting medicated baths at the moment.  This may be something that causes more frequent vet visits so please take into account the added cost.  He is worth is though!

Comanche is neutered, microchipped, and current on his vaccines.  His adoption fee is $175.

If you would like to adopt Comanche and make him a part of your family, please contact ForeverYoursOKC@gmail.com.

animal.description: Meet Gigi!  This pretty 1.5 year old, 50-pound girl found herself wandering the streets and about to be taken to the pound.  Thankfully, she befriended a dog out on a walk with his humans and they took her in until she can find her forever home!  Gigi takes a day or two to warm up to new people, but once she does, she will quickly become your best friend!  She’s treat motivated and doing great with training to help with separation issues as now that she knows how nice people can be, she wants to be with them all the time!  She’s housebroken and crate trained, but can be vocal when left alone, so no apartments.  She goes to doggie day care and stays at a kennel when her people are out of town and has been a staff favorite! Gigi loves snuggling with her people, chasing squirrels in the backyard, going on hikes/adventures with her foster family and playing with her 4-legged foster brother (an RRR alum!).  Gigi will do best with someone home all or most of the day who will continue with positive training and has no young children.  Gigi would like to have a dog sibling to play with but it is not a requirement as she bonds with her people and would be fine as an only dog.  With some additional time for her to adjust and continued training, this sweet girl will make someone a great new best friend!

animal.description:
"Remi is an adorable, loving and goofy almost 2-year old, 50 pound black pit bull/lab mix who is missing her left front leg. We call her a “tripod.” She came to MADACC as a stray when she was young with a broken leg and the vet decided to amputate to give her the best quality of life. Nothing slows Remi down and she thinks she is a perfectly normal dog.

Things Remi loves: Remi loves to play fetch, run around in a yard, play with other dogs her same “speed,” and play with her toys. She loves car rides and boat rides, alike. Water is her favorite! Although, she does need a life vest – Tripods missing their front legs need some extra help. When she is tired, she is the ultimate snuggle buddy and loves to sleep with her humans. There is nothing more that Remi wants than to be near her family and snuggle on the couch or bed.

Things Remi does well: Remi is completely potty trained. She waits patiently for her breakfast and dinner and runs straight to her kennel when it’s time for you to leave for work or errands once the sound machine goes on and treats are in hand. When it comes to play, Remi is very smart and brings tug toys to you to play with or chooses a bone out of the toy basket to entertain herself if you’re busy. She also is great at bringing other resident dogs toys to play tug with. Food is her #1 motivator, next to affection, and will do almost anything for treats while working on her manners – she’s a smart cookie and is always ready to learn new things. Remi is also very good at sharing.

Things Remi needs to work on: Her leash manners are the utmost priority. Remi can either pull when on leash and can easily get wound up on walks and chooses to lay down instead. So, a Weiss Walkie leash or Ruff Wear harness is a must (which she will come with for her new family). Remi does much better throwing a ball around in a yard with her humans or playing with a larger, active dog friend instead of walking for exercise, since finding a suitable walking cadence for a “tripod” can be challenging. Jumping up is another manner Remi is working on and her new family will have to continue to reinforce “all 3 on the floor” prior to giving attention. Remi feels safest in her kennel when she has to be left alone, otherwise she can get anxious. She may have been abandoned at a young age and does not like when her people leave, which is why her “safe space” (aka her kennel) is a necessary part of her routine. If you are home, she will want to be near you – a human that works from home or is around more frequently is preferred. In addition, she can be a watchdog and will notify you when she hears something unusual that startles her. While not a “barker” by any means, Remi may bark to get another dogs attention to play but this is infrequent.

What Remi is looking for: A yard is a MUST and fenced-in is highly preferred. Remi will not do well in a condo/apartment environment and is looking for a quieter home environment but one that has room outdoors to explore. An experienced dog parent and children over the age of 10 are necessary due to her typical puppy playfulness, jumpiness and strength of her tail when she’s excited (talk about an adorable wiggle-butt). Remi is looking for a family that will provide her with consistent routine, exercise and continuous training to keep her smart, active mind stimulated, otherwise she can become anxious (this is fully manageable though). She would do best with another playful dog sibling who is active yet secure and respectful – a dog she can look to for confidence. Otherwise, a dog sibling isn’t entirely necessary but is preferred. Remi has shown some dog selectivity on leash with smaller dogs so a dog her size or larger is recommended. She has met only a few cats before and did ok but was highly curious. A home without cats is preferred.

To make her transition as smooth as possible for both Remi and her new family, she will come with all her familiar supplies and guidance to help set everyone up for success. Remi is an incredibly loving, happy-go-lucky dog who only deserves the best home possible. Does this sound like a match? Apply to adopt Remi and meet her in-person! *Local Milwaukee residents or those within reasonable driving distance will be considered due to a necessary staggered transition plan that will include a meet-and-greet with all family members and then a sleepover prior to making any final decisions. Thank you!

animal.description:
Cletus

Located in Sidney NE
 Alapaha Blue Blood Bulldog
1-3 Years old
Dog Friendly with slow intros, he is better with females than males but that will likely improve once he's neutered 
Cat friendliness unknown
Does fine with kids BUT he's a bull in a china shop and will knock kids over 
Working on house training
Working on crate training and knows a couple commands 

Extremely strong 
Fully vetted beyond being neutered
80lbs approx

This is Cletus and Cletus is an XL sized Alapaha Blue Blood Bulldog mix who wandered up to a shop as a stray. Sure that someone must be looking for this adorable meatball a kind woman took him to be checked for a chip (no chip found), then she took him home. The finder did everything she could, she posted him all over, called the shelters, called the vet offices and when there was nothing else she could do, she waited. No one ever called and so the kind woman put out a plea for a rescue or adopter. We agreed to take him and get him out of TX as he needed a fantastic and responsivble home. Getting him out of horrible humidity and hot weather will also help him to feel better. This sweet lug arrives today and we would be THRILLED for him to arrive to his new family. 

If interested in helping Cletus please contact us ASAP!

To Contact Us

Message us through our website http://www.highplainspaw.org

Message the Facebook Page at https://www.facebook.com/HighPlainsPAW

Fill out our Adoption Application at https://www.highplainspaw.org/adoption-application

Fill out our Foster Application at https://www.highplainspaw.org/foster-application

Email us at highplainspaw@gmail.com

Call our voicemail at (402)957-1578

Due to his predominant breed being an Alapaha Blue Blood Bulldog we are seeking an adopter with BRACHYCEPHALIC BREED EXPERIENCE. Further all our brachycephalic dogs MUST vet at an AAHA certified vet, this is because of their extreme vet needs. Brachycephalic dogs are extremely expensive dogs to upkeep so please bare that in mind when applying and make sure you're in a financial place to take it on.

 $400.00 Adoption Fee 
(Which is considered a non refundable donation and being we are a 501c3 organization it is tax deductible. The fee itself is not negotiable, our vets don't negotiate and thus neither do we.) 

WE DO NOT HAVE A FACILITY ALL OUR DOGS ARE LOCATED IN FOSTER HOMES. This means there is no place for you to go in person to view our dogs. We ask that an application be filled out and we will go from there!

animal.description:
**UPDATE 11/06** DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE ANOTHER DOG UNDER 7 OR A FULLY FENCED IN YARD!!

Meet Otto!
Otto and his 3 brothers & sister were surrendered to a kill shelter in a very rural town in the panhandle of TX.
Otto is 7 mos old (12/31), utd on shots, chipped, & housebroken. He will be getting neutered on 01/11. He is very sweet, & craves human interaction, he is playful but not crazy. He is great with other dogs, he was curious of cats when he first got here but since he's had no exposure to them it is not recommended. He is good with older kids but a home with small children is not recommended. This boy is very smart and highly trainable. We are not sure what happened to Otto when he was younger but he is not a fan of the crate at all, as he appears to have some issues with being confined to a small space. We are working with a trainer on reconditioning and he is doing fabulous! We are up to 3 hrs with no issues.
This boy is the absolute sweetest and would do best in a home that has another dog (not a senior or small breed). 
 If you would like to make this super sweet boy part of your family, please complete the online application to begin the process.

**BREED MIX IS DNA CONFIRMED**
33.2% American Pit Bull Terrier
16.8% Siberian Husky
14.6% Australian Shepherd
11.3% Australian Cattle Dog
9.1% Border Collie
5.2% Brittany
9.8% Supermutt 

What’s in that Supermutt? There may be small amounts of DNA from these distant ancestors:

Chinese Shar-Pei
Chow Chow

https://furrytailendingscaninerescue.org/adoption-application/

**DUE TO BREED MIX A FENCED IN YARD IS AT LEAST 5 FT HIGH REQUIRED**

**PLEASE NOTE EMAILS FROM THE SITE EXPRESSING YOUR INTEREST IN ADOPTING WILL NOT BE ANSWERED. IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING, PLEASE COMPLETE THE ONLINE APPLICATION ON OUR WEBSITE TO BEGIN THE PROCESS. ALL INFORMATION KNOWN ON THE DOG/PUPPY IS INCLUDED IN THE PROFILE* YOU MUST RESIDE WITHIN 75 MILES OF STEWARTSVILLE, NJ**

**PLEASE NOTE, WE ARE A FOSTER BASED RESCUE AND DO NOT HAVE A PHYSICAL LOCATION TO VISIT. BECAUSE OF THIS, WE DO NOT ALLOW MEET & GREETS PRIOR TO HAVING A COMPLETED AND APPROVED APPLICATION ON FILE**

animal.description:
Shy is a hippie “love the one you're with” kind of gal and has expressed the need to be in a one human home.  She prefers not to share her human with another human.   She will eventually show her human unlimited love and devotion.  Shy would be fine with another small dog that could teach her the ropes and she would be OK in a home with a cat(s).  

Shy is sweet and playful.  She is a 2-year-old female Rat Terrier-Chihuahua mix who weighs about 10 pounds.  Shy needs a fenced yard as a leash still scares her a bit (although she is learning to walk on a leash and working on other basic commands).  She is very good at doing her business outside when you take her out regularly.  Shy will need to be in a home without small children, and with someone that is mostly home, with the patience to allow her to continue to blossom at her own pace.  What a rewarding experience this will be!

Shy will be your shadow but prefers to make the first move.   She will join you on the couch and bed inviting you to pet her.  Eventually she will make herself at home on your lap.  
At night she likes to snuggle up close to you in bed and if you let her, she will get under the covers, and even give you kisses.

Shy has had her vaccines, is spayed, has had a dental, is microchipped and on flea/heartworm preventative.  To welcome Shy to your heart and home please submit your application at VIPrescue.org.



If you would like to know more about this dog, please complete an adoption application so that our volunteers  may contact you.    To do so, go to our web site:  http://viprescue.org/jobs/apply/?j=772

All of our available dogs for adoption are are on our website at:

animal.description:
Name: Georgie

Age: 16 years

Current Weight: 71.6 lbs

Rescued from: Texas

Health: up to date on required vaccines, neutered

Adoption fee: $300

Georgie was rescued from an area where there is an abundance of homeless dogs, and not a lot of shelter space for them to go while they wait for their forever homes. He will be arriving at SNARR's Adoption Center in Brewster, NY once he has a foster or adopter!

Georgie would do best in a calm household without a lot of stairs for him to navigate. He would also likely do best in a home without other dogs or young kids so that he can relax and adjust to his new surroundings on his own terms! If you're looking to open your home to a happy, chill, lovable dude in his golden years, Georgie is your guy! He loves to lay around, relax, and take in the outdoor air!

To apply to adopt Georgie, fill out an application at www.snarrnortheast.org/applications. 

-------------------------------------------------------
FAQs -- PLEASE READ ALL BEFORE EMAILING

**Please note that SNARR NE is a volunteer-based organization. While our volunteers will try to respond to you as quickly as possible, it is helpful if you review the following information about our adoption process before emailing:**

- LISTED BREED(S) & AGE: We are taking our best guess on age, breed, and size when fully grown, based on the puppy's/dog's physical appearance and what we might have learned about one or both parents depending on the situation. *NOTE* We rarely know a dog's exact age, nor are we able to tell the true or full breed mix of dogs as our information is limited most of the time. Because we often do not have access to medical records at the time that we are posting dogs to Petfinder, so there are sometimes discrepancies between what is posted on Petfinder and what might be listed on a dog's medical records.

- SNARR'S ADOPTION PROCESS: The first step in adopting or meeting a SNARR dog/puppy is to fill out an application at www.snarrnortheast.org/applications. Once we receive your application, one of our adoption application processors will contact you, review our adoption process with you, and answer any additional questions you may have. **We do not go on a first-come-first-serve basis for adoptions, but on best fit for a family and most importantly the puppy or dog.**

- MEETING ADOPTABLE DOGS: Meet and greets will not be scheduled until after your adoption application has been fully processed by one of our adoption processors.

- APPLYING ONLINE: If you fill out an online application, please do so from a computer (not a mobile device), make sure you answer ALL the questions in as much detail as possible, and that you receive a confirmation email. If you do not receive a confirmation email, that means we did NOT receive your application.

- PUPPIES: We do suggest listing a 1st, 2nd and 3rd choice on your application if applying for a puppy with several litter mates.

- ADOPTION FEES:  $495 for puppies / $425 for adults / Adoption Fees for Seniors, Special Needs and Bonded Pairs vary

animal.description:
Hershel came into our rescue a few months ago. As a little puppy he had survived an awful infection that caused his ears, neck and face to swell. He had boils and sores all over his little body as well as hair loss. His family could only afford minimal medication but syringe fed him and got him better. We got him and took him to the vet for medication and treatment. Fast forward three months later and he is a happy, playful guy that would be the life of the party. 
He will make you laugh! He is still a "diamond in the rough" but with time his hair will grow out and he will be BEAUTIFUL!! Let me know if you are interested in meeting him. He's 5 months old and would be the love of your life. Available through Bullywag  Inc.

She had been stabbed, straigh through side to side, when the knife or sword was pulled out it brought her spleen with it. And then she was left to die. She was in need of emergency medical care. Her former rescue was able to get her all fixed up but she did loose her spleen. However it healed up nicely! No cats and probably no small dog's or kiddos bc she is a big goofy girl and may hurt them on accident! She is working on her doggy social skills! Evie needs to be the only pet in the home, and needs proper intros with new people friends. She has been in boarding for awhile now but has made huge progress while there and is ready to be in a home. Once she loves you, she loves you with her whole heart.

Hello, my name is Beauregard! I am a 16 year old Shih Tzu - about 13.8 lbs. 
 My adoption fee of $250 includes my up-to-date vaccinations, microchip, deworming, and I come home spayed/neutered. I even started on my monthly flea and heartworm preventatives - what more could you ask for?

I'm a beautiful black and white Shih Tzu mix seeking someone I can lean on. You may notice my tendency to move in an unusual pattern. The adoption team can actually tell you more about that. I say it's because I can't see so I'm just trying to get my bearings. Leaning against you can help stabilize myself while you pet my lavish fur coat. Please consider letting me circle my way into your heart.

 If you'd like to adopt me, please fill out an application on our website, PawmettoLifeline.org, and an adoption advocate will be with you shortly. Feel free to check out more of my friends or more information on PawmettoLifeline.org. I can't wait to meet you!

animal.description:
PLEASE READ ALL THE INFORMATION IN THE DOG'S PROFILE, AS WELL AS THE INFORMATION ON OUR WEBSITE, niagaradogrescue.com , BEFORE EMAILING US WITH QUESTIONS. OUR VOLUNTEERS USE UP VALUABLE TIME ANSWERING QUESTIONS WHERE THE ANSWERS ARE READILY AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITE.WE ARE FOSTER BASED, THEREFORE WE DO NOT HAVE A FACILITY.  MEETS WILL NOT BE ARRANGED UNTIL ADOPTION APPLICATIONS APPROVED. IT CAN TAKE 10-14 DAYS FOR AN ADOPTION LEAD TO RESPOND TO YOUR APPLICATION. PLEASE BE PATIENT. Thank you!!!
	
Please visit our website @ https://www.niagaradogrescue.com/ or apply for adoption @ https://niagaradogrescue.com/adoption/.  
if the dog is not listed on the NDR website, please put the dog's name down anyway, profile just may have not been uploaded yet
		
Name: Kimzie
Weight: 53 lbs
Age: 4 years (DoB 7/3/16)
Gender: female, spayed
Breed: boxer mix
Colour: brown & white

Good with adults: yes
Good with kids: unknown
Good with other dogs: can be dog reactive, will need behaviour training
Good with cats: no, has a high prey drive
House trained: yes, she will also ask to go out; but has had accidents in the house when left home alone. This is likely related to her anxiety, or an attempt to mark her territory, and not the need to physically go to the bathroom, so she will need someone who can work on this with her.
Crate trained: yes, but does not like being in the crate when left alone and has chewed her way out of a metal crate in order to escape. At night she doesn’t need to be crated, she has slept in dog bed at night peacefully.
Energy level: medium
Can be handled/touched: yes Kimzie is a complete love bug.
Barker: a bit
Flight risk: unknown
Food aggressive: no
Walks on leash: yes
Rides well in car: yes
Destructive: yes when left home alone as she has separation anxiety.
Needs a home with a yard: yes
Needs a home with another dog: no, she needs to be the only dog
Can live in an apartment: no

Kimzie suffers from anxiety when she is left home alone. She will need a home where adopters are home all of the time, including work from home full time (even after pandemic restrictions are lifted) and can work with her to help ease transitions for periods when she must be left alone. She can suffer from anxiety with only being left alone for a couple of hours. A former foster did give her CBD oil and it seemed to provide assistance. An adopter who is willing to work with her on this, and exercise patience with her while she overcomes her fears of being alone is what she desperately need.
animal.name: Kimzie

-NEEDS *MALAMUTE* EXPERIENCE! 
-NO OTHER ANIMALS IN HOME!
-LOCAL WITHIN MICHIGAN TO ADOPT
Hi! My name is Hugo and I’m a very handsome 8 year old boy looking for a new forever home. How did I get my name? Well when I was a puppy someone said “Oh! He’s Huge!” Take the letter O and put it at the end and you get HUGO.
My foster mom says I am stubborn and I want to do things my way. She says I need to go to a home with lots of Malamute experience, and one that will sternly but fairly make me follow the human pack rules. Since I am so large my new home needs to have older kids (12+) so I don’t knock any younger children over when I play.
I love going for walks and car rides and I even got to ride in 4 small airplanes to get from my last home in CO to my foster home here in Gladwin MI. It was quite the adventure and naturally all the pilots loved me. Whenever my foster mom takes me out for walks, I literally stop traffic! Everyone wants to stop and pet me. Who can resist all this handsomeness!
Toys are lots of fun and every so often I get a good case of the zoomies to let out the silly side of my personality. Oh, I’m a cuddler too so I need to be able to lay right next to you on the couch or bed and I am pretty particular about what time I get up in the morning. It took a bit but my foster mom finally figured out what kind of food I like to eat.
I need to be the only pet in the household as I do have a typical malamute prey drive and I’m not good with ANY other dogs BIG or SMALL. In fact I am a country boy at heart and I would do best in a rural area. City life with dogs all around bring out the less than lovable side of me. I do know all the basic obedience commands, but sometimes I drive my foster mom nuts when I take forever to do the command or just plain ignore her unless there is a treat involved.
I hope I find a new home soon. Is your family the one for me?
Please go to our website at www.fewstepsfromhome.com to fill out a meet and greet application or email us at dogrescue0146@gmail.com for more information

animal.description:
"Hi, there, and thanks for stopping by. My name is Winnie the Pooch, which the internet tells me means I'm a good boy! I'm 2 years old, 63 pounds, originally from North Carolina, and looking for a moderately active family where everyone is 8 years old and older. I'd really love to meet everyone in the family at the center on my adoption day! I need to be your only pet, but I promise you won't even miss other dogs or cats.

My photos all make me out to be very serious, but that's just my RSF - Resting Serious Face. I can be a little more reserved when I first meet people. But after I've gotten to know you a bit, I enjoy a good cuddle and giving some kisses. I'm not going to clean your face - you have soap for that - but a few tender kisses every now and then never hurt anyone.

I'm also very curious, and a sometimes silly guy who likes to experience new things. I love sniffing while out on my walks because there is just so much to smell. And if you show me something is OK, like playground slides, I'm 100% willing to give it a go. On a recent walk with some friends, we met our local mail person who let me jump into their truck for a quick sniff around. It was my first time in a mail truck, and it was amazing! 10 out of 10 would recommend! I'd love to go on car rides with you, too. I find the car very relaxing.

I am a foodie, and proud of it. You've got food, I'll eat it! I sometimes try to steal treats from my friends, especially if it's cheese, but I will also work for it. I've tried some agility at PAC, and really like it. I also have friends who are teaching me "touch" and working on my leash walking skills. I really enjoy working for my treats, and would love to keep up my training with my forever family. But I also love playing, so don't make me work too hard, OK? Throw some tennis balls around for me or give me a rope toy to shake and I will be so happy.

 OK, some last minute facts about me. I am neutered, microchipped, and up to date on my vaccinations. Someone also loves me so much that they sponsored my adoption fee! And that means I can join your family today for free! I hope you'll come meet me soon. 

XO Winnie"


If you are interested in meeting Boone in person, please schedule an appointment here: ProvidenceAC.org/AdoptADog

**Some of this pet's photos have been provided by Crissy Everhart Photography (https://www.crissyeverhart.com )& sponsored by Subaru.

-------
During your appointment, you will be able to meet a selection of pets in the Kennels or Cattery that day. New pets are arriving daily!
-------

Providence Animal Center relies on adoption fees and donations to save pets! Adoption fees vary per pet. 

Can’t adopt? Consider fostering or donating! Visit https://providenceac.org/support-us/ for more information on how you can support the lifesaving mission!

animal.description:
Hello friends! My name is Mac and I'm a very SWEET older guy with lots of pep in my step! I'd love a home where I can have my humans to myself and a big yard to play in. I really love getting the zoomies! A few months ago I was living on the streets and I was pretty sick Some super nice people found me and did something called a mass removal on my back end and I feel so much better now! I really need humans that will help me stay healthy and I promise to give all the love and kisses possible! 

Mac is about 7 years old but doesn't act a day over 3 years old! He is vetted, vaccinated, and ready for a home!!! He had a cancerous mass removed, so he will need to stay on a daily medication. He gives the best kisses and can't wait to meet you! 

Email contact@hopeforpetsrescue.com with any questions!

animal.description:
Mimosa
Jack Russell Terrier Mix
Gender: Female
DOB: 04/10/2018
Adoption Fee: $175
Mimosa was brought to our shelter by an amazing lady that saved her and two other dogs. When they came to us they were so fearful of humans. All three were adopted separately, two have done well but Mimosa had some trouble adjusting and is back with us waiting on the right home. Mimosa will need a home with no small children and with an experienced owner that has experience with shy and fearful dogs. She isn't an aggressive dog just fearful of humans at first she greets all of us with playful jumps each morning and is doing very well in her foster home. She loves the company of other dogs they give her confidence and security. A home with a small dog pack is a must for this girl!!! If you would like to give Mimosa her forever home please fill out an adoption application today!!!Please read the animal bios completely before requesting additional information as we do our best to answer the most frequently ask questions in these bios. 

In order to adopt one of our animals an application must be submitted and approved. You can find these applications by going to http://humanemorgan.org/index.php?page=adoption 

ABOUT ADOPTING FROM THE HSMC: 
The shelter address is 1170 Fairground Rd. Madison, GA 30650. For more information on any of our pets, please feel free to email us at INFO@HUMANEMORGAN.ORG give us a call at 706-343-9977. 
All dogs are heartworm negative, current on vaccines/dewormings, and microchipped. 
All cats are FeLv/FIV negative, current on vaccines/dewormings, and microchipped. 
We are open 10am-5pm Monday-Saturday, we schedule our last adoption at 4pm everyday to allow our staff enough time to feed and walk dogs. 
We are an animal shelter and therefore are not able to individually potty train our residents. Many adult dogs do arrive ""house broken"" however due to animal behavior any change in environment will make an emotional impact on the animals and therefore initiate unwanted behaviors during the acclamation period. Please keep this in mind. Puppies do not have the biological maturity to maintain absolute bladder or bowel control and will require a certain degree of potty training and house breaking. Please consider the time and commitment it takes to provide the necessary building blocks for these special babies, prior to submitting your application. 
If you have any questions please email us at info@humanemorgan.org and provide name of the animal you are interested in, in the subject line. 
Thank you, HSMC Staff 

ADOPTION FEES Adoption Fees may change without notice. Always verify the fee when finalizing the adoption. 
~ Cats and Kittens ~ 
* Under 1 Year = $100 
* 1-5 Years = $75 
* Over 5 Years = $50 
** Purebred cats and kittens may be subject to special pricing 

~ Mix Breed Dogs ~ 
* Under 1 Year = $200 
* 1 -3 Years = $175 
* 4-8 Years = $150 
* Over 8 Years = $100

~ Purebred and Designer Breed Dogs ~ 
* Under 1 Year = $375 
* 1-3 Years = $350 
* 4-8 Years = $275 
* Over 8 Years = $150 

~ Medical and Special Needs ~ 
We have rescued dogs and cats which require additional medical care or that have special needs which are not life threatening. In these cases we may require a higher fee to help recoup the costs of their care while at our rescue.

animal.description: Say Hello to Frankfort! He is around 5 months old and was born in Labs and More care to Mama Kentucky, who weighs about 50 lbs. and as sweet as she can be. Frankfort is looking for a family that understands the time, patience, and energy needed to raise a young pup. We require all puppy adopters to provide training that includes: house training, basic training, leash training, and socialization. Additionally, this cutie is going to need proper exercise, mental stimulation, and your attention and love to grow up to be the best companion. We do not allow our dogs or puppies to sleep or live outside; they must be incorporated into your family and be made a priority in your life. In return, you will have the most loving and loyal family member you could ask for. If you think you are ready to add to your family by adopting a puppy, then fill out an adoption application on our website today! This information is as up to date and accurate as possible for the dog in its current environment. All dogs and puppies will need time and training to adjust to their new surroundings and to learn the rules of their new home. If you are interested in meeting one of our dogs, the first step is to complete the Adoption Form on our website at www.labsandmore.org and take some time to review our adoption process. Your adoption includes the spay or neuter, current vaccinations, microchip, and other services provided while in our care. The safety and health of our puppies is priority one, so we only allow approved applicants to meet and handle puppies. Please understand everything we do is for the dogs and conducted by our kind and generous volunteers. We rely solely on donations, and we do not profit from a dog's adoption. Labs and More is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that operates on donations and time dedicated to this cause by volunteers. Your adoption will save the life of future dogs in need. Labs and More makes no guarantees regarding the behavior, breed, or age of the dogs in our care. Although we strive to provide necessary medical care to dogs in our care, we cannot predict future or current medical needs whether they were symptomatic or not at the time of adoption.Thank you for looking to Adopt a Labrador Retriever or other Mixed Breed Dog from California Labradors Retrievers and More Rescue. Please take a moment and go to www.labsandmore.org and click on Adopt to complete our online dog adoption application. If you have any questions email us at doginfo@labsandmore.org or call us at 858-273-5386. Thank you for looking to a rescue group to fulfill your dream of adding a new dog to your life! Dogs + Love = Family

animal.description: Meet Kentucky! She is about 3 years old and is possibly a Pointer mix with Cattle Dog or something equally confident and athletic. Kentucky came to Labs and More pregnant and was a great mom, but now this sweet girl is ready to put parenthood behind her and find a forever home! She is house trained in her foster home and is a quick learner and food motivated. She is learning not to jump up on people to say hello and may knock little children over, but it's only because she's excited to make new friends. She knows "sit" and "down." Kentucky walks well on leash, but is learning to ignore other dogs on walks. She can be choosy with her dog friends - some she likes to play with and some she isn't so sure about. We think she'd be happiest as the only dog in her forever home. She has met dog savvy cats and just turned the other way, but she does like to chase birds and bunnies on walks so may chase a cat that runs. Kentucky is a very active girl. She loves to play fetch and is very agile. She will need a secure fence in her home and supervision in the backyard because she can scale a retaining wall like a mountain climber. She would be an awesome new hiking companion and jogging partner. After expelling her energy, she is always down for a snuggle session with her humans. She bonds closely to her people and is an affectionate girl. She is a good guard dog with a booming bark when strangers come to the front door but once she sees you are a friend, she happily wags her tail. If you think you are ready to add to your family by adopting Kentucky, then fill out an adoption application on our website today! Please note that processing time for applications is currently three to four weeks. We recommend completing the application process and connecting with a adoption coach before looking for a dog or puppy you'd like to adopt. If you're already approved to adopt or if you've adopted from Labs and More before, connect with your adoption coach for next steps. This information is as up to date and accurate as possible for the dog in its current environment. All dogs and puppies will need time and training to adjust to their new surroundings and to learn the rules of their new home. If you are interested in meeting one of our dogs, the first step is to complete the Adoption Form on our website at www.labsandmore.org and take some time to review our adoption process. Your adoption includes the spay or neuter, current vaccinations, microchip, and other services provided while in our care. The safety and health of our puppies is priority one, so we only allow approved applicants to meet and handle puppies. Please understand everything we do is for the dogs and conducted by our kind and generous volunteers. We rely solely on donations, and we do not profit from a dog's adoption. Labs and More is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that operates on donations and time dedicated to this cause by volunteers. Your adoption will save the life of future dogs in need. Labs and More makes no guarantees regarding the behavior, breed, or age of the dogs in our care. Although we strive to provide necessary medical care to dogs in our care, we cannot predict future or current medical needs whether they were symptomatic or not at the time of adoption.Thank you for looking to Adopt a Labrador Retriever or other Mixed Breed Dog from California Labradors Retrievers and More Rescue. animal.description:
***All animals listed on our website are in private foster homes. To arrange a meet and greet with a dog, you MUST fill out the adoption application so that it can be sent to the foster parent for review to determine if your home is a match for the dog. If a dog receives multiple applications, we operate on a best-fit basis, not first come first served.***

Weight 45 lbs

**Single family home needed**Must have a fenced back yard**Must be an experienced dog owner**Prefer a home with a small-med size, low-med energy doggie friend** HIGHLY RECOMMEND foster-to-adopt due to special needs**

Meet Nugget! While not a lot is known about his past, it is clear that there was significant trauma. Nugget is very apprehensive with people and new situations, especially at first. He builds trust slowly through consistency and gentle interactions. He needs an understanding, PATIENT, and loving home with a family that understands he may always be skittish and shy away from human touch.

Nugget is a quirky little dude. He likes to help with a pre-wash on the dishes in the dishwasher, he hoards all the dog toys in his bed and has been known to try to nibble on his people's toe nails. Despite the toe nail nibbling, Nugget is very gentle and good with children. Nugget loves hard chew bones, toys with squeakers and really enjoys a good remote control. Nugget is easily summoned with food and he loves fresh fruit, veggies and cheese. He likes to sit patiently next to the dinner table, just in case someone might offer him a taste.

Nugget can be brought out of his shell with a doggie friend to romp around with indoors. He seems to do best with small to medium sized dogs that have low to medium energy. Nugget likes to wrestle and is vocal during play as well. Nugget isn't playful all day but has several bouts of feistiness. Having a well-trained doggie friend/leader in the home might also speed up the trust and learning process. The more he watches a human pet, play, and talk to other dogs in the home, the more he is interested in getting to know that human. The other dog will also give Nugget a sense of safety.

Nugget isn't a huge fan of being outside. He has learned to overcome his fear of outside enough to potty out there, but he is still working on learning a signal to alert that he needs to go out. He's not crazy about walking through doorways and currently needs to be led outside to the yard by leash but then unleashed once outside. He will follow a family member into the yard, do his business, and then want to go right back inside. Due to his fear, he isn't great walking on a leash and often pulls to the extreme to find a spot he feels safe (crouched in the bushes or under a car). For this reason, a home with a fenced backyard is important.

Nugget's forever home will have an owner who is patient. This means they will have to let him decide things on his own and try not to force him into too many situations too fast. Owning Nugget will not be like owning a regular dog. You won't be able to show him off to all of your family and friends right away and you especially won't be able to cuddle him right away. It can be hard to resist, but Nugget will need a confident owner who puts up boundaries around human interaction until it is clear he is comfortable. Nugget has been in foster care for 8 months (as of Jan 2021) and has made significant progress, but he is still a long way from being a normal house pet. He may NEVER be a normal house pet, but we hope that someone will love him for who he is.

Medication to manage Nugget's anxiety has been key in the process of building trust with him. Before meds, he was too nervous to really interact at all. Nugget's new family will need to be understanding and attentive. They will need to understand his triggers for fear and find new approaches to situations. For example, since he will be scared when you take him home, it will be essential for Nugget to have a crate or safe place identified that is close to the family but not in a high traffic area. He will need gradual exposure to your presence. It would be best if the new owner was someone who spends most of their time at home and is willing to have Nugget within ear shot. The key to earning his trust will be building his confidence that you are going to feed him and give him water daily and take him outside to do his business. Consistency will also help him know early on what is expected so he can start to grow into a dog who has confidence in himself.

Nugget might sound like a lot of work but when he finds his forever home with an owner who works hard to establish trust, it will be a bond unlike any other. Nugget is crate trained, neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations, has been microchipped and dewormed, and is current on monthly heartworm and flea/tick preventatives. His adoption fee is $300. If you think he may be the one, please go ahead and send in an adoption application on our website: www.secondchancenc.org. If you have any questions about Nugget, please contact the Dog Program Manager at laura@secondchancenc.org.

animal.description:
Sadie is a beautiful female Dutch Shepherd around 9 years young. Sadie was confiscated by animal control after being found in a hot vehicle over the summer where she was kept in a dirty crate and was severely overweight. Sadie has clearly had a rough few years but she is looking forward to having a home of her own.

Sadie is a very sweet girl who is friendly with new people although not always super social. She can be aloof at first but once she realizes that someone is offering her attention she tends to melt into them. Sadie has been wonderful for all of the extra attention she needed when she arrived - tolerating medication, extra bathing, and pampering. She is a no-fuss sort of girl though and thinks that it is a bit much. She is happy to just be near you doing her own thing while you do hers. She is starting to warm up to the idea of asking for attention but isn't super affectionate. She has a few tendencies that speak to her past of being confined such as circling when overwhelmed or darting to corners when she isn't sure where she is supposed to go. Sadie has met an 8 year old and done well but we would not currently recommend her for a home with younger children.

Sadie is able to get along with other dogs in her foster home but is not a dog oriented girl herself. She will reprimand dogs that get in her space and don't respect her boundaries. She much prefers to keep herself away from the other dogs but is able to navigate shared space with the other dogs. Sadie would do best as an only dog or in a home with other respectful, senior dogs. Sadie has not met any smaller dogs or cats at this time.

Sadie is heartworm positive and has begun 'slow kill' treatment for her heartworm which will need to continue in the form of monthly Ivermectin in her adoptive home. We would be happy to answer any questions you have about treating heartworm and also encourage contacting your vet to discuss adopting a heartworm positive dog.

Sadie is searching for a patience and loving home that will help her continue to settle into life as a loved family member. If you're the home for Sadie please email Tierhavenrescue@gmail.com for an adoption application or visit Tierhaven.rescuegroups.org for FAQs

animal.description:
Hi, Griffin here - I’m looking for a forever family to call my own! I’m a 10-month old black lab mix and I weigh about 60 pounds. I am mostly black with a smattering of white. My foster tells me all the time (seriously, ALL THE TIME) what a smart guy I am, and there is a special family out there that would be lucky to have me.

I love spending time outdoors smelling all the things, rides in the car, and food! I’m fast, and love to run around outside and activate my turbo switch for zoomies at least once a day. I would be ecstatic if my new family had a fenced-in yard for me to run around in. I am excited about new things, and love to go on adventures; just grab your keys - I’m ready! I am very food-motivated and already know several commands: sit, down, spin, and high-five. I do have wonderful manners, I take treats like a gentleman, and sit for my food bowl to be put down. I don’t have any dogs at my foster home, but I really think I would like to have a furry brother or sister to run around with outside and play the day away. Also, cats and I don’t see eye-to-eye…I guess they really don’t like to be chased so I will need a cat-free home. I think a family without children would be best because I am still young and can be mouthy.  I’m a bit slow to fully trust, so adults with patience to give me time and space would help.  Don’t let that fool you though, I LOVE attention, and I will be all over you if you let me lead.

I don’t care for a crate, but after some adjustment time I’ve become comfortable being loose at home alone for a few hours.  I’d like my new family to have someone who is home most of the day, but if you’re patient with me we can keep working on this.  My foster says it’s best if I don’t have bed and furniture privileges as I have shown resource guarding behavior with them.  I am already potty-trained.  

This dog MUST HAVE:
No cats
No children
Fenced in yard

If you are interested in meeting me, please contact LOLIN for a meet and greet.

If you are interested in adopting, please go to our website at www.lolin.org and click on Adoption Process along the left-hand side.  From there, you can submit an Adoption Application to be considered for this dog.  You MUST be an approved applicant to meet LOLIN dogs.  There is no central location or hours to meet dogs.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
YES we're still accepting applications for Autumn!

**

Autumn will be placed in the Phoenix metro area, for proximity to our rescue (home checks, follow up visits, visit to finalize adoption) and for access to our veterinarian. Sorry, no exceptions.

**

Autumn's adoption begins with a Foster-To-Adopt arrangement that continues until she has completed Basic and Intermediate Obedience training courses; adoption can then be finalized.

**

Autumn is a very active, happy, and funny dog! She runs and plays for the love of moving. SHE IS AS FAST AS A ROCKET. Maybe faster - full of energy! Most of the time she is grinning, but she's a master of many expressions and being silly.

Autumn is a sweetheart and an athlete, needs active guardians who are home most of the time and enjoy running and hiking daily. She would love a happy, very playful dog friend her size to help her burn off energy. Absent another dog-friend, she would enjoy a busy social life with human and dog friends to keep her busy and engaged.

We have not had the opportunity to observe Autumn with a small dog or a cat, so we must err on the side of caution and place her with a dog her size or a bit larger. :)

If you feel you are a potential match for Autumn's needs, please complete an adoption application! Please include information regarding your experience with raising and training a very young dog.

	"Companion animal" means, needs at least one other friendly, playful dog that lives full-time in the same household.
	"Fenced yard" means, a backyard that is adjacent to and connected with your residence. (It does not mean a nearby fenced area/dog park.)
	Gates must have padlocks and thresholds (cement or buried pavers to prevent digging.)
	Yard and patio must be free of debris and have room for dogs to run and play on a lawn and/or a very shaded area. Please don't invite us to your home if you've not yet landscaped your yard!
	We do not place dogs in situations where there are "drained" or empty swimming pools, which are a fall hazard and contribute to the propogation of mosquitos.
	Last and not least, we DO NOT adopt to students as we have found that they often do not know or anticipate where life is taking them next.

Discussion about a dog - including scheduling of a home check or other dialogue - cannot occur until we have received your completed adoption application. NO EXCEPTIONS. Thank you!

animal.description:
Hello world! My name is Shotzy and I am a whole heep of personality just waiting for the right forever family. I am a 2 year old, neutered male, Shepherd mix that weighs about 55 pounds. 

I have a whole lot of puppy left in me and I am still learning my manners with 2 legged and 4 legged friends. I am a silly boy that loves to play and like people big and small but would probably do best with ages 10 and up. I also get along well with cats. I am a high energy boy that will need quite a bit of exercise. I know to go potty outside, I can sit, lay down, wait for my food, and I am getting pretty good on my leash.  I am VERY smart so something to keep my mind challenged would be helpful too.

My forever family should have previous dog experience and some patience to help me continue learning how to behave like the beautiful, smart boy I am.

If you would like to be considered as an adopter for one of our great dogs, please go to our website- www.luckymuttsrescue.org and submit an application. Our process includes landlord approval and vet checks. We try to get applications processed in a timely fashion. Inaccuracies and/or incomplete data will delay and possibly cancel your application from being processed, so please make sure that you include valid information and contact information. You will be contacted via email if there are concerns or questions. Once your application has been processed, you may be contacted by one of our volunteers to set up a home visit interview. After your home visit interview is completed, all of your information is reviewed. If your application is approved, you will be notified. Meet and greets with dogs are only set up with approved applicants, so if you want to meet a dog, it is vital that your home visit is completed and that your application is approved. Adoption fees generally are: 
$400+tax for puppies to 3 years old
$350+tax for ages 4-7
$250+tax for ages 8 and up
The adoption fee covers spay/neuter, up to date vaccinations, microchip, general deworming, heartworm test and prevention (if old enough) and veterinary inspection certificate. Breeds of dogs are best guesses and we don't guarantee any breed. Adopters are chosen by what situation will be best for the dog. Submitting an application for a particular dog does not guarantee that you will be the applicant chosen to adopt that dog. Lucky Mutts strives to match dogs to the best home and will work with your family to find a good match. Please remember that we are an organization that is completely run by volunteers, so please be patient as many of us work full time jobs, have families and also foster dogs. Thanks for wanting to adopt!

animal.description:
David is a stunningly handsome male pittie mix estimated at 1-2 years old. He was found abandoned with another dog and both were taken to Chicago Animal Control and placed into separate foster homes with us. We don’t know David’s past, but we know it can’t have been pleasant. He is slow to trust and initially had only one or two people he would let into his circle. Since being in our care, he has had extensive training and continues working on widening his circle daily and is really making great strides. 

However, because of what was most likely an abusive past, David should go to a home with no other dogs, pets, or children. When it comes to his adults though, he is the best cuddle buddy around! Once you’re in his circle, he loves his people so much and wants to get and give constant attention. He is just the sweetest dog, most affectionate dog, and somehow gets sweeter by the day! He is fully potty trained and does not have accidents in the house. He walks politely on the leash. He is responding well to training and knows basics like “sit,” “wait,” “stay,” and “place.”

When he’s not learning new tricks and how to be a very good boy, David is being an excellent travel buddy! He immediately goes to his place in the backseat and safely sits down. He enjoys having the window down and watching the world go by and is always ready for new adventures. Just be careful when you get those car keys out to go somewhere without him… his beautiful green eyes are hard to say no to! 

David will need continuing training and an adopter experienced with pittie-type dogs. If you think you could give David the life he deserves, please fill out a survey today at www.playersforpits.com/adoptionsurvey!

animal.description:
Hey! I'm Rizzo! I'm an big guy looking for my forever home. I can play a little rough, I would do best in a home without small children and other animals. I enjoy lots of attention and plenty of physical activity. A home with land would be ideal, a fenced yard is required for my adoption. Schedule an Adoption Appointment to come say hello!

Weight: 75 lbs.

Adoption Price: $100

WANT TO TAKE ME HOME TODAY? SCHEDULE AND ADOPTION APPOINTMENT.
To Schedule An Adoption Appointment:
1. Fill out and submit our online Adoption Application.
2. Please only submit ONE Adoption Application. (Our Application is for general pre-approval, not for a specific adoptable animal).
3. Once received, the Allen County SPCA will review your application. Applications are reviewed in the order they are received.
4. We will contact you to let you know your Adoption Status and schedule an Adoption Appointment. Applications may take up to 1-2 days to process. Please give us a call at the shelter at 260-744-0454 if you have not heard back from us within 48 hours.
5. If you haven't found your perfect match at the shelter, that's okay too - pre-approved applications are valid for 6 months!

Come prepared! Please bring proof of a current rabies vaccine for all pets living in the home. If you have another dog, you are welcome to bring him or her with you so that we can safely perform a dog interaction.

Unfortunately, animals cannot be held for you.

A Special Note from the Allen County SPCA:
Remember, pets are a lifelong commitment. We at the Allen County SPCA ask that you take adding a furry family member to your home seriously, and do your research on the different breeds before adopting. We also ask that you are able to keep up on yearly vaccinations, monthly preventatives, a good diet, daily exercise, training, and most of all, LOVE. If you ever have an issue with a pet that you adopted, please contact us right away; we may be able to help, or we can put you in touch with someone who can. All set? Come in and adopt today!

animal.description:
Meet Bowden... This little cutie originally came to us with him mom, dad and 3 siblings from a local overcrowded shelter. He was adopted as a small baby but sadly is being returned. His adopter feels a more active family with a fenced yard would be better for Bowden. Bowden is a Chi/Terrier mix. He’s now 5.5 months old and weighs 6.4 lbs. We don’t expect him to get over 10 lbs. Bowden is very smart. He knows sit. He will also sit at the door and wait until he’s told to go out. He loves his person and wants to be with them. He is an active terrier. He loves toys, to go for walks and to play outdoors. He would benefit from a home with a fenced yard, kids and other animals. Bowden is truly great with everything. He’s utd, dewormed and neutered.

All dogs have a $175 adoption fee which includes vet check, age appropriate shots (atleast 2 sets for puppies), dewormer, heartworm test (if over 6 months), rabies (if atleast 16 weeks) and spay/neuter! Puppies will be altered before adoption. All rescues and shelters practice pediatric spay and neuter. This is essential in our rescue efforts and it is a policy that we will stick by. All dogs over 8 weeks and 2 pounds will be altered before adoption. There are no exceptions to this rule on all healthy and adoptable dogs. 

Puppies/Dogs that are not available for adoption due to vetting not being complete can be reserved with an approved application and a non refundable $50 deposit. This deposit is applied to your adoption fee and the remaining $125 is due at pick up.

Wags and Whiskers is an all-volunteer rescue. We also have full-time jobs and Families. We will try to answer all questions and applications in a timely manner. Please be patient and bear with us . Do not contact Parkway Animal Hospital as they are a vet clinic and can not answer questions on behalf of Wags and Whiskers. All questions and comments must go directly through the rescue. Thank you for your understanding.

ADOPTION APPLICATION

https://form.jotform.us/70898112177159

animal.description:
Ralphie is a wonderful older gentleman with the most adorable underbite and personality for days. He loves to cuddle, is super smart, extremely well trained (thanks to his foster mom, Allison) and is available to go home with you!

Ralphie was found as a stray with several tumors on his underside and scrotum, some raw and some ruptured. Those have been surgically removed and he has fully recovered. After what must have been a painful and uncertain time, he is now looking forward to finding his forever home. 

Ralphie is around eight-years-old, loved every human he meets, and would like to be the only pet in the home. Did we mention his underbite? Can you even handle how cute it is!?

Ralphie was officially diagnosed with Central Diabetes Insipidus (CDI) on December 12th. What this meant was that Ralphie’s body couldn’t regulate fluids because his pituitary gland wasn’t producing enough of the antidiuretic hormone called ADH, and this was what was causing his extreme thirst and excessive urination. Although there’s technically no “cure” for CDI, there is some good news: it can be pretty easily managed with just daily oral medication. Ralphie has been on the meds for a few weeks now and the improvement is drastic! 

To apply to adopt Ralphie go to handsomedansrescue.org

For questions, please email allison.k.rogers@gmail.com 

Thank you!

We’d like to find her a foster home so she can gain confidence and with someone who’d also be interested in adopting her once she progresses. The SPCA trainers will assist the foster to help Opal acclimate and blossom! She’d do best in a quote home and a canine buddy for her to be friends with would be an added bonus!

Due to Covid-19 the SPCA is allowing adoptions by appointment only. If you’d like to discuss an animal and/or set up a meet and greet please email shelter@spca914.org with your competed application and a copy of your driver’s license or a government issued ID. Please allow up to 72 hours for a response! Thank you for your understanding! 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.

animal.description:
BENDI - 5 years old, 51 lbs, Spayed Female, Heeler Mix, Medium Active Home - DOG EXPERIENCE ONY 

"Weird, Wonky and Beautiful" .... as her foster mom put it! She really hit the nail on the head!! Bendi has a head tilt that was due to an old nasty ear infection. She also has wonky hips - she clearly wasn't super well taken care of in her past life. We assume she just lived outdoors. There is something about this large goofball that really just makes you fall in love with her. She is currently being fostered by a professional trainer - that has helped her with her urge to nip (breed related). Bendi is a dog that wasn't trained as a young lady so she had a lot of learning to do when she came to NYC. She is learning her manners well. Bendi really really loves to play whether that be with another young submissive dog or with her toys. Her foster momma has taught her how to play with a "flirt pole"... which tickles our fancy and seems very appropriate for Bendi. Bendi needs to be in an adults only home. NO cats. She is good with other submissive dogs - but does have an urge to hump them at first. Bendi would also do best out of the city - city noises spook her.Interested in adopting? Please go to www.socialteesnyc.org 

Her Foster Mom Says: "Bendi is a sweet girl who loves attention and play. She is always hanging out nearby or resting at our feet. She enjoys wrestling, belly rubs, chewing her toys, bird watching and is a keen student. She's a lot of fun and introduced us to a game of paw slapping and she really enjoys short sessions with a flirt pole. She does best with a good amount of exercise, but nothing too intense. She currently gets an 1hr walk in the morning and at lunch time plus toilet breaks in the evening. She gets spooked by noisy traffic and would do best in a quiet neighborhood. She has a few quirks that present themselves when she's anxious, so she needs a home that is committed to continuing reward based training to help show her the world isn't a scary place. She can be mouthy during play, but she isn't hurting us and she's learning that play stops when she nips people. Instead she is learning to bring her toys to us for play time. She's doing well with hand targeting and making progress with sit and down. She sleeps well during the night on her bed in our bedroom. We've left her at home alone on a couple of occasions for 2-3hrs and she's been happy to work away at her Kong then have a nap. She's weird, wonky and wonderful."

PLEASE NOTE: This animal is not at the Social Tees office all of our dogs and cats are in foster homes while they wait to find their forever families. :) If youd like to apply to adopt this pet, please complete an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org. Because we are a small team and receive hundreds of applications each week, we are unable to respond to every application and every inquiry email, but we do our best. Please have patience! If your application is approved, you will for sure hear from us. If you have questions, please take a look at the Adoption and Fostering FAQs etc. on our website as all common questions are answered there. Thank you for your understanding and flexibility as we work to save these innocent lives!! 

LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org; Instagram via @socialteesnyc; Facebook.com/socialteesanimalrescue

animal.description:
Hi! I'm Jake, I'm 6 years old, weigh 89lbs and I'm so ready to find my new home. There have been a lot of changes in my life recently but I'm adjusting. I lost my owner and my sister through no one's fault so I get anxious about being alone. I love to play with my foster fur brothers. In my new home, I must have another fur sibling! I spend my days hanging out wherever my foster mom is and take a nap. Sometimes I know she needs a break so I come and ask for some pets. Occasionally, I get lonely and I let you know by howling or softly whining but if you just talk to me or give me a hug it helps. I can't wait to find my new home!

Thank you for your interest in adopting from Lab Rescue OK!

The FIRST STEP in the adoption process is to fill out a Adoption Application at www.labrescue.net.

Processing of a application usually takes 5-7 days. 

*** Labs are not placed on a first come, first approved basis. Placement is at the discretion of Lab Rescue OK, Inc ***

If you are interested in adopting, please apply directly with bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.

Available for adoption in WA, OR, NJ and TX.

Meet Jake! This handsome boy sure knows that he is very good-looking. He is an AmStaff/Boxer mix who is all sleek muscle and fur. He is much beloved by his caregivers who can't wait to find him a wonderful family to call his very own ?

Jake is a very strong boy and will do best in a home that is well-versed in large dog handling.

He loves wrestling with other dogs and would enjoy the company of a playmate in his new home.

Our adoption fee includes age appropriate vaccinations, deworming, microchipping and transport expenses. Adoption fee is $450 to help offset travel and medical expenses.

All children at home should be at least age 5 to be approved for adoption!

Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt
