animal.description:
Scroll down to learn more about this pet:

***
Bichon and Little Buddies is open only

by appointment with a completed application.
Dogs in foster homes require an appointment and approved application to meet. The application is online at http://www.bichonrescues.com/pre-adoption-form-dog If a dog is listed as available, then we are still taking applications - no need to email or call to ask about the status. Note: The forms that Petfinder or Adopt-a-pet has to inquire about the dog is not our application application. Our form must be filled out to be approved to adopt a pet.***

Covid-19 Precautions:

Until further notice, Bichon & Little Buddies will be doing all meets and adoptions by appointment only. To be able to control the number of people at the shelter at one time, we will be suspending our open hours on Thursdays. If interested in adopting, please fill out the pre-adoption application and we will set up a time for you to come meet the dogs you are interested in.

About this Dog:

Name: Daisy Marie

Breed: Cattle Dog/Heeler (or mix)

Approximate Age: 8 months - 1 yr

Gender: Female

Weight: around 40 lb

Adoption Fee: $400

Why in Rescue: Texas Transfer

General Profile: Please fill out the adoption application at http://www.bichonrescues.com/pre-adoption-form-dog if you are interested in meeting one of our dogs.

Daisy Marie came to us from Texas hoping she can find the perfect home. She is a sweet gal, right now she is a little shy but friendly. She is all ready to be adopted and find out how great life can be as a loved family pet. Her foster home in Texas helped her learn to walk on a leash and to trust people. Even though she is scared right now, she still wants to be petted and loved. If interested in Daisy Marie, please fill out the pre-adoption application. We don't have a background on her, so don't know if she lived with other pets or children or if she was housetrained (many dogs from Texas have lived outside the majority of their lives).

We do our best to evaluate the dogs while they are with us, but they sometimes act different in the shelter environment than they do in a home. If you are interested in any of our dogs, please fill out the pre-adoption application and we will set up a time for you to come and meet them.

Adoption Procedures:

1. Completely fill out the pre-adoption application at http://www.bichonrescues.com/pre-adoption-form-dog. We will be checking with your vet if you have had pets, calling your landlord (if any) and checking a personal reference, before we contact you about visiting the adoptables. Any missing information may have us moving onto another application.

2. If you application is approved, we will contact you to come meet the adoptables that you are interested in.

3. If it is a match, you will complete the adoption contract and pay the adoption fee. Please be prepared to take your adopted pet home when you come meet him/her. In most cases, you will be able to take the pet home the same day. If all the vetting hasn't been done yet, we will hold the pet for you until the vet work is completed.

4. If you have filled out an application and we haven't contacted you within a week, we may have missed your application, the pet may have been adopted by another applicant, or you may have been missing information on your application. You may contact us to find out the status of your application at this time. Please give us a week to process your application before contacting us!

The adoption fee through Bichon and Little Buddies Rescue is $200 - $475 depending on the age of the dog, which includes Wi State Sales Tax. Included in this fee is your new companion who will be spayed/neutered, have a current Certificate of Veterinary Inspection (as required by state law), current on age appropriate vaccinations, heartworm tested and started on preventative, microchipped, and dewormed. Other medical needs will also have been taken care of, such as dentals and treating ear infections.

To assist you and your new pet in adjusting to life together, you will also receive an 8 week age appropriate obedience training course at For Pet's Sake Dog Training for $50 (up to $200 value). You may opt to take Puppy Kindergarten, Adult Beginners, Small Dogs Big Hearts, or Shy & Reactive Dog Class. You must start the class within 90 days of adoption for the reduced fee. For more information on the classes visit www.forpetssake.cc

All dogs are seen BY APPOINTMENT ONLY. Many are in various foster homes getting extra one on one attention getting them ready for their new homes. The first step in adoption is filling out the pre-adoption application. Bichon and Little Buddies is run by volunteers who have full time jobs in addition to the hours they spend with the rescue dogs. Having an application on file assures us that the potential adopter is really interested in adopting a dog. It also assists us in placing dogs in homes where both the dog and new owners are happy. The application puts you under no obligation to adopt a dog from Bichon and Little Buddies.

The Dog Pre-Adoption Application can be found at http://www.bichonrescues.com/pre-adoption-form-dog

Thanks for thinking about adopting your new pet!More important information:

***We are a Wisconsin based rescue and do not ship our pets. If you are considering adoption you must be willing to drive to meet and adopt the pet, as well as bring the pet back to us if the adoption doesn't work. We adopt primarily in WI and IL, but will consider applicants in MN, IA, and MI.***

***Please do not set up an appointment to meet the animals until you are ready to take your pet home. If the meeting results in a match, you can often take the dog/cat home the same day or within a couple days if the medical care hasn't been completed. We are not able to hold pets for adopters beyond this time. Thanks for understanding.***

***While we hope all of our adoptions lead to permanent homes for the animals we place, sometimes things just don't work out. We do have a 30 day trial period. For the first 30 days, if you or Bichon and Little Buddies decide that the adoption isn't a good match for either the humans or the pet, the adoption fee will be refunded minus $50 within 30 days of the return of the dog. Bichon and Little Buddies also requires adopters to return the pet to us at any time that they are unable or unwilling to care for the animal anymore.***

***We do not show dogs/cats without an appointment. The first step in adoption is filling out the pre-adoption application at http://www.bichonrescues.com/pre-adoption-form-dog Please do not call/email until AFTER you have filled out an application.***

Bichon and Little Buddies is a State Licensed Rescue # 268555-DS
2/2/21 6:06 PM

animal.description: Hi there! My name is Watson! I was transferred in from another shelter as a stray. I am a little bit shy at first but I will warm up to you quickly. I am one bubbly happy-go-lucky boy once I am comfortable! I tested positive for tick borne diseases and I may require treatment in the future. I get along with some other dogs and I would do well with children that play nice with me! I would need to have supervision with any cats that may be in my new home to make sure that I want to be friends with them! I am your typical husky and I do like to talk and howl! I would like to have a nice bed and some toys that I can call my very own! I walk nice on a leash so it would be so much fun to get out and see all of the sights and sounds! I have energy to burn and I am looking for a family that is as busy as me to move in with! I am sure that once you meet me you will make me the newest furry member of the family!

animal.description:
We do not adopt dogs from phone calls or emails.  Please do not fill in adoption forms anywhere else, but on OUR web site.  Thanks for that.

To start our adoption process, please fill out our form on our web site at: www.spokanewienerdogs.org and see the Adopt a Dog/Fee page with more details on how we adopt our dogs. There are a lot of questions answered on our web site and personality details below about each dog BELOW so please READ BEFORE getting in touch. We already answer 500+ emails a day.  We do answer questions on dogs once our adoption paperwork is filled in so we can match to the right homes.    

Please indicate which dog you are interested in on our adoption form.  If their name says "pending home" then they are not available and are on a test drive with a new family.  We do remove our dogs when our adoptions are final so please do not ask us if dogs are available if you see their ads.

There is an adoption fee of $300 for this dog.

Sweets is a very sweet, shy dog who is cautious meeting new people but it only took her a few days to warm up to us.  She is in rescue through no fault of her own.

She would apprciate a home with no kids and adults only who have patience to work with her and bribe her some.  If you have another small dog in the home would be ideal.  Her daughters have been doing all the thinking for her and it is time she grew up and was placed in a home without them.  She was crated a lot in her last home so she is learning all sorts of new things with us.

This very affectinate dog will be spayed soon and we will update her shots then when we get a vet appointment.   She is a bit overweight right now but on a diet and should finsih around 8 pounds.

For right now we are keeping her in a smaller yard and dragging a leash so easily caught but wil graduate to a larger yard soon.

She is so tiny we suspect there is probably some chihuahua in her background but she has a docked tail and ears so we are goong with the breed we were told.  Either way she is a very, sweet dog no matter what is in her woodpile.

We have already wormed her and started socializing her right away as well as started the weaning process from daughters too so she will be more than ready for adoption soon.  They need to be in different homes and not placed together.

If you have tiny kids under age 8 in your home then they would be way too much for her, no other small dogs and no fence as well as no patience to retrain a scared new dog then this girl is not for you.

home_environment_attributes.other_animals: Larger dogs above 20 pounds or anything she can hunt.

animal.description:
Mayetta is new to Beauties and has only been with her foster a short time. She is sweet and playful. very loyal and loving but also a little too possessive of her person and her "things. She was initially cool with the other dogs in her foster home, but then started getting growly and snappy toward them. She corrects very easily, laying right down and exposing her belly. Mayetta is very playful like a puppy and needs to learn manners. She does not seem to understand that she can't jump up on people. She tolerates being kenneled but doesn't like it. She loves to be close to her human, and is most comfortable lying near them with w a paw on them for security. She needs a lot of reassurance. She wants to play with the cats but way too rough and they don't want anything to do with her. However she does ignore the chickens in ehr foster home. She does fine on the leash. Mayetta looks exactly like a chocolate lab, but is the shape of a dachshund. Her paperwork says she is around 35 lbs. She is a solid 35 lbs. 

Mayetta's foster says that despite her guarding behavior, with the right leadership and home she is going to make a great companion for someone!!

animal.description:
Landry is an easygoing guy with a winning smile and an independent spirit.  Before he was rescued, Landry spent most of his life outdoors on a chain, often going hungry when his mealtime was forgotten, and spending many lonely hours all alone.

Since his rescue, Landry has adapted great to indoor living, and has developed great house manners.  He is loving with his foster peeps, but tends to be aloof with strangers.

Landry does well with other dogs, but he will vociferously warn them away from his resources.  This is easily managed in his foster home, but Landry might be most content as an only dog.

Landry enjoys walks, but tends to be strong and random on a leash.  He would probably do best with a fenced yard.

Landry is 4.5 yo and weighs about 50 lbs.  He is neutered, microchipped, up to date on vaccines, and screened for parasites.  He recently completed heartworm treatment and convalescence.  His adoption fee is $300 cash and he is eligible for foster foster-to-adopt within the Chicago metro area.

For more information and an adoption application, please email UnderdogRailway@yahoo.com

***we take. Covid-19 safety seriously.   All meets will be held outdoors weather permitting, following appropriate masking and distancing prorocols**

animal.description:
Sweet and tiny Mr Rogers was found emaciated, unable to stand on his own legs and with diabetic blindness due to untreated diabetes. We cared for him as he fought for his life, gave him back his sight thanks to cataract surgery, and Mr Rogers is now healthy, happy, energetic and ready for his second miracle: finding his forever home.
Yes he needs an insulin injection and some pills with each meal, but don't let that scare you. Mr Rogers is so much more than that. He is so strong and a true symbol of hope. He loves going on walks and to the dog park, gets along great with other dogs, loves car rides, doesn't bark and he is 100% potty trained! Doesn't he sound perfect?? We didn't give up on this little angel so he could have a shot at life, a chance at happiness. We've done our part. Now it's your turn to show this angel that he is so worthy of love! DOB 2/20/2010

 Adoption fee is $250 and includes DHPP; rabies vaccinations, heartworm testing, deworming, wellness vet visit one month of pet insurance and microchip. All animals are examined by a veterinarian. Please fill out our application; https://gkarma.wufoo.com/forms/good-karma-pet-rescue-dog-adoption-screening/ if you would like to adopt or meet this dog and we will be in touch right away!

animal.description:
Rowan is a stunning, 3 year old Catahoula Leopard Dog and is a carbon copy of her WORKING BREED characteristics.

Rowan is looking for an ACTIVE Family! If you like to Hike, Swim, Play, and want an adventurer who loves to be by your side for all of it, Rowan is your girl!

Although Rowan is crate trained, she is not suited for the city or apartment life. She needs a family and partner who loves adventures and doesn't mind her tagging her along. Rowan is extremely intelligent and will thrive with a mix of both mental and physical stimulation. If you are not the type of person who enjoys walking, hiking, and a high activity lifestyle, she is not the dog for you

Rowan is a balance of 50% Belly Rubs & 50% Bounce!

Rowan loves children and everyone she meets. She will do just about anything for a good cuddle & snack. Girl after our own hearts! So if you'd like to add a little bit of adventure to your life, with a side of snuggle. She is the dog for you!

Rowan is Deaf (but unless we told you that, youd never know!). She makes a great thunderstorm companion, and will sit beside you for an outdoor firework show instead of hiding from them.

WORKING BREED EXPERIENCE PREFERRED.

You can fill out an application at www.anarchyanimalrescue.org. Rowan is completely healthy, spayed, vaccinated, and microchipped and currently being fostered in Long Island, New York.

***PLEASE NOTE: ALL ADOPTERS MUST BE LOCATED WITHIN 120 MILE RADIUS & MUST HAVE A FULLY FENCED YARD FOR ANY DEAF DOG, IF THE DOG WILL HAVE YARD ACCESS. There are NO exceptions to this, as recall is a huge concern should the dog ever mistakenly get loose.*** 11/10/20 2:58 PM

animal.description: Meet Frontier! He is a 2-year-old Schnauzer/terrier mix. He is currently in foster and is loving life. Here is a summary from his foster mom: ""Frontier is affectionate, cuddly, and incredibly loving! He is very high energy. He will require training for leash reactivity as he does pull and bark and gets dog-obsessive when he sees them on walks. But he's super smart, so with some structure he should be fine :) He can be dominant and intrusive with other dogs, though he did live with other dogs before, and he is such an angel indoors. He is very attached to his people. Ideally I can see him in a house with kids, a backyard to get his energy out throughout the day, and people that will be able to exercise him. His positive attributes like cuddliness and calmness inside are bonus points after you can handle the hard stuff. He is not leash trained and doesn't know most basic commands. But the good news is, he is housebroken and successfully learned how to sit within a few days! He wants to be a sidekick and be everywhere you are."" Frontier is a nice compact size. Though he's currently 23 pounds, his foster family is working on getting him closer to 28 for his ideal weight. With some basic training, Frontier is primed to be some lucky family's BFF for life!To initiate the adoption process for this dog, please complete our online application by clicking below. Your adoption coordinator will respod to you via email once they receive your application: www.thebarkinglot.net/adopt

He loves chewing on his stuffed squeaky toys and is becoming such a good fetcher. And he's a smart pup who's responding very well to his training, working on his leash skills. animal.description:
My name is Scarlett and here is my story!

I turned 2 years old in February of 2020.  Shortly thereafter, I made my way to the United States from Qatar!  Yes!  Qatar!  I was born there and abandoned as a puppy.  I was living in a crowded shelter as a dog whose breed is basically illegal there.

I was rescued, received my vaccinations, and even have my very own passport!

As a result of my negligent upbringing and life in the shelter, I was always scared there.  Scared of what would happen to me and scared because I never received much attention and never felt love.  I sure do love my foster Mom though!  I've learned to trust her and now she tells me it's time for me to trust others and find my forever home.

I know it's probably going to be a long process, but I also know that I am VERY willing to try and I DEFINITELY want my very own forever home.  So - if you promise to take it slow with me, I promise to try really hard to make any meeting a potential match.

I am a VERY sweet girl ever but I just need to gain some self confidence  I've been around other dogs and interacted well with them.  

I won't be adopted out into an environment with children under the age of 16.  I am not used to the activity levels of children and will not do well with a lot of noise and quick movements.

I've been spayed, am heartworm negative and am up to date with vaccinations.  My adoption fee is $250. 
 
To request an adoption application, please visit https://www.udranch.org/contact.  Please allow 24-48 hours for a response!

animal.description:
Female - 3 years - 67 lbs - Microchipped - Spayed - MAHello-I'm Jenny! I am a 3 year old, 67 lb spayed female. I am already housebroken and crate-trained. I am currently crated when left home alone at my foster home.
I am a social girl who loves men and women! I haven't been around small children. I will actively seek attention and love being pet. I love to cuddle with my humans. I will happily welcome visitors into our home!
I do not get along with other dogs and need to be the only dog in my home. I like my toys and have been practicing playing fetch with large toys! I would benefit from a fenced yard where I can explore safely off-leash. I cannot go to a home with cats.
I have learned how to walk well on the leash and am not reactive to other dogs walking by us. I am a smart girl who has learned the verbal commands for sit, up, down, and come. I am an active, high energy girl who would love a family who will take me out for long walks, hikes, or swims-I like swimming around my foster family's pool! I ride well in the car.
I have a degenerative eye disease called pannus, so my eyesight is compromised. I can see well enough to get around on my own most of the time but will occasional bump into the things and struggle with depth perception. I receive eye drops to help prevent progression of my vision loss which will need continued for life. Dogs with pannus can also be sensitive to UV lighting and I may benefit from goggles during long outdoor outings. My vision doesn't slow me down at all and I still love to run and play!
I am a happy, loving girl who'd love to find my perfect family where I can be the center of attention are you my family?
Follow me on Facebook: #EchoDogJenny
For more information, please contact adoptions@echodogs.org.

Echo Dogs fosters dogs in many states. Visit www.echodogs.org/available-dogs to see more of our dogs. Transportation for the adopted dog IS available. Remember, we are an all-volunteer foster rescue organization - we DO NOT have a physical shelter to visit. Our minimum adoption donation is $300. All dogs are spayed/neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations and micro-chipped. Puppies under 6 months old may not be spayed/neutered. This would be the responsibility of the adopter at their own expense. Proof of spay/neuter will be required!
To review our adoption procedure and submit an online application, visit: www.echodogs.org/procedure 2/2/21 9:46 AM

animal.description:
Marley and Bullet have been at their foster home for just over a month now, and have successfully completed their heartworm treatment!  They are enjoying each other’s company and have discovered how much fun it is to play with toys!  They act like typical Boxers, although Bullet (7 yrs old) is Blind.  He leans on Marley (5 yrs old) for guidance and support and they are definitely a bonded pair.  They play, eat, and sleep together.  

They are both housebroken and they are fed in their crates, and spend some time in their crates with bully sticks or Kongs, although they definitely prefer to be with their humans.  They enjoy a comfortable couch, fluffy blankets and pillows! At this time, it would be recommended to crate them (separately) if leaving the house for a longer period of time.

Bullet (male, blind) can see lights and shadows, and is very good at following your voice.  Bullet had a consultation with an eye doctor, and unfortunately, he is not a candidate for surgery to regain his vision.

Marley is protective of Bullet and she is a vocal gal!  They are both jealous if one is getting attention and not the other. Their foster mom says they enjoy romping around, going outside, and then relaxing on the couch, and they LOVE treats, they are definitely food motivated.  They are not a fan of going out in the rain!

If you are interested in Bullet and Marley, connect Barbara to learn more about me. BarbaraABoxer@gmail.com

Bullet - Age: 7 - Special Needs Blind
Marley - Age: 5 
Dogs: No
Cats: No
Kids: 15+ - Just because he is special Needs and he hasn't been with kids

animal.description:
Meet Joy, a gorgeous Alaskan Malamute mix who weighs about 63 lbs. She is considered a med-high energy dog and she knows the 'sit' command. She can be a bit mouthy and stubborn at times and will need a patient family to work on training with her. Northern breeds can be quite vocal, so apartment living may not be the best fit for her. She would make a great exercise partner! No cats or young kids please!!

You can also watch for stories, pictures and videos about Joy on our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/groups/40103261297/ Ask to meet me today!!
 
Adoption fee: $475.00
 
Adoption fees for all dogs/puppies include a $50 refundable training deposit. Complete your basic training program and provide a copy of the certificate within 4 months (120 days) of adoption and we will refund $50 of the original adoption fee.
 
All dogs/puppies have been fully vetted including spay/neuter, micro-chipping, worming, heartworm testing and preventative treatment, flea/tick preventative, and all required age appropriate vaccinations. As required by Wisconsin Act 90, all dogs will have received a veterinarian exam (CVI) within the past 30 days.
 
Our adoption process requires the submission of an application. Applications and Adoption Rules can be found on our website, on the "HOW TO ADOPT" tab at JRsPupsNStuff.org. Upon receipt of the completed application, we will process the application including: contact with your veterinarian and completion of a home visit. Please be sure to include the contact information for your vet as we will call. If your vet requires an information release, please be sure to contact them as soon as you submit your application. We are a group of volunteers with families and jobs, so please be patient and allow a few days for our response.
 
JR's Pups-N-Stuff Dog Sellers License 270089-DS

THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING. ADR is not responsible for the health, temperament, behavior or placement of this dog. Listings are done at the request of the dog's owner and as an outreach and community service in hopes of finding these dogs a loving, stable forever home. Placement decisions are made solely at the discretion of the owner and not Austin Dog Rescue. Owners are required to ask for an adoption fee from adopters.

This is the information that we received from Mama's current foster:

We found a dog on 9/14. She is very sweet. We have posted her on several sites trying to find the owners, but with no luck. She is not micro-chipped or spayed. Our vet said she is between 1 1/2 - 2 years old. She had a litter around 4-6 months ago, and just finished a heat cycle. She is heartworm- negative, but has hook worms. We got her the medicine to treat it. We will try to get her spayed and vaccinated while she is with us and when we get the funds. She seems housetrained, loves to play fetch and is good with dogs and people. She's not the best with little kids as she may accidentally knock them down. She needs more time and activity than we can give her, but I only want her to go to a loving and safe home. Please help us find someone to adopt her. We can try to foster until this happens. I don't want to drop her at a shelter. Thank you!

If you are interested in meeting this sweet lady, please contact Shana at: shanlee71@yahoo.com

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Please contact Christine (ChristineOFP@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.Trooper's adoption donation is $350 and he is being fostered in Central Ohio. He has been neutered, microchipped, received his rabies, distemper/parvo, bivalent canine influenza, and bordetella vaccines, tested negative for heartworms, started on prevention as well as flea prevention and had a dental.

Trooper came into rescue originally as a puppy, was adopted, and then returned due to unforseen circumstances in his adoptive home. He is one of our special needs dogs as he was born blind. While he has known nothing different when it comes to sight and manages very well in his normal world, he will have some requirements in his forever home. He does well on housetraining if kept on a schedule and gets along with the foster dogs in his foster home. Due to his blindness, he is more sensitive to sound and is sometimes reactive if startled so it will be important to make him aware when approaching him. He can also be protective of his person at times so a new home that is skilled in these behaviors will be important. We have found that he prefers women over men so will give preference to a female only home and no children. Trooper is a little shy when meeting new people but once he has gained your trust, he will be your doting companion. While he can tend to get get under foot often, he is a loving cuddler.

Trooper does like to play and will engage with other dogs but at times can be a bit bossy. Due to his blindness, he would do better with dogs similar size to him to avoid unintended injury. Trooper does NOT do well with cats. Trooper really enjoys going on walks but also really likes to check out smells. Trooper does engage in a frequent spinning behavior, whether he is happy, nervous, hungry, wants to go outside, etc. He has done this since he was a puppy. He gets nervous in thunderstorms but a thunder shirt and cuddling helps him feel better. Trooper has seasonal allergies and at times requires Benadyl and medication for his eyes due to irritation.

Trooper's ideal home will be a quieter home with adults and either no dogs or similar sized dogs. The home should be a ranch or willing to consistently use gates at the stairs. We will also require his forever home to have a strong veterinary history and dog behavior experience.
PLEASE NOTE: If you are viewing this biography on a website other than the Ohio Fuzzy Pawz website, not all information transfers to partner websites in some instances. If you go to the individual webpage of our dogs, you will be able to get more information each dog.

Visual breed identification in dogs can be unreliable so, in many cases, we are only guessing at the predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each dog as an individual and will do our best to describe each of our dogs based on personality, not by breed label.

Our Adoption Process

The adoption process has several steps involved.

Please review prior to submitting an application.
Our adoption process is detailed here:

http://www.ohiofuzzypawz.com/info/adoption

Our volunteers work very diligently to process each application and we try to ensure that we are making the best match possible for each dog. We do not schedule meetings with dogs until an application has been approved. It can take up to a few weeks to process an application or as little time as a few days, from the time you submit an application, please be prepared to adopt as we cannot hold dogs.

Special Requirements

Some dogs may have special requirements (for example, medications, a fence) -- if you apply for a dog, please be sure to read over the biography completely to see if there are any special needs and if you're home would be suitable. If we indicate on the dog's biography that a fence is required, this means your home must have a physical fence. Other dogs may require a "strong vet reference" which indicates that we are looking for a home that has a documented history of veterinary care with previous pets.

The first step in our process is to submit an online adoption application at www.ohiofuzzypawz.com/forms. The application MUST include the personal references and veterinary, grooming, and landlord references (if applicable) and their respective contact information. If you do not include the references and the contact information, your application will be delayed as it CANNOT be processed. Once the references have been successfully completed, a home visit is then scheduled when a rescue representative can meet all members of the family or residents of the home.
No application is approved prior to the home visit being done.
At that point, the Directors will discuss any and all applications on a foster dog and make a selection--in many cases, there are multiple applications for each dog, so please be understanding that our only priority is the successful placement of each of our foster dogs.

Out of State Adoptions

We do adopt out of state to outstanding applicants, however, our process requires a home visit, so out of state adoptions can take longer.
We do not ship our dogs, adopters should be prepared to pick up the dog in Central Ohio.

2/1/21 8:03 PM

Brandy is a sweet little lady, 15 years young. She is very quiet and laid back, and enjoys following you around the house observing everything you are doing. She loves to be held in your arms but is not big on sitting on your lap, however, she does like to sit next to you. She loves to have her head and ears petted. She is crate trained, and for the most part potty trained. She is not one to tell you when she has to potty so as long as you take her out on a regular basis, she will not have any accidents in the house. When in her crate, she has never had an accident (she is crated while we are at work and at night to sleep). She loves being outside and her favorite activity is trying to catch lizards. She is great with other dogs, particularly those that are up in age without much energy (her and our 8 year old chi mix get along great). She is fascinated with our cats and runs to look for them. She is big on getting treats, especially cheese. She is an absolute doll for anyone looking for a loving, quiet, laid back companion.

animal.description: Jackson aka Jax #6800 is a handsome 1.5-year-old male Pointer mix. He is a sweet and loving young man who loves all people. He will happily jump up and give you kisses if you’d like! Jackson is house and crate trained. He knows the commands: sit and stay. He walks well on leash. He does fine meeting other dogs out on walks, but will need a slow introduction to any future roommates. He has very high energy and would love a home with a fenced-in backyard, or dedicated daily exercise. Jackson walks great on a leash. He would do best in an all adult family or older teenage children.  He weighs 60 pounds and is full grown. This pup is microchipped. We are working on crate training and socialization. Just like any puppy, this pup will need a loving home with an adopter that has the time to commit to continued puppy training to assist with house, leash and obedience training. This pup should be on heartworm preventative; an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure! If you are interested in adopting this dog, and are already approved to adopt through our organization, please contact dogs@lastchanceanimalrescue.org with the pup’s name and ID number in the subject line. OTHERWISE, please submit an adoption application online: http://www.lastchanceanimalrescue.org/adoptus.html E-mail dogs@lastchanceanimalrescue.org with questions. Stay tuned to our Facebook page for updates: www.facebook.com/LCARMD #adoptlove #PicMe #petsmartcharities

ADOPTION REQUIREMENTS
A fenced yard


My name is Marley. My family had to move and weren't able to take me with them. I am 11 years old and weigh appx 75lbs. Yep I am a big boy!! I pretty much love everyone and I still like to play as you can see in one of my pictures. I didn't spend much time inside at my former home so I am still not sure about the whole pottying outside vs inside thing. I am pretty good most of the time but do still have accidents sometimes. I am also not neutered and the vet feels that at 11 years old it's ok if I'm not. If my new family prefers to have that done then that can be discussed at the time of adoption, I am good with other dogs and with kids. I have not been around cats as far as my rescue knows but I might be ok, We would have to test that and see. I am a big sweet boy with a lot of life left in me so don't let my age deter you. 
If you would like to meet me send an email to theloveofk9s@yahoo.com and we will respond as soon as we are able to.

Adoption donation pays for all vetting...a heart worm test, all vaccinations, deworming, flea prevention and a wellness exam. Neuter as well if that becomes necessary

animal.description:
*** In Foster/ Available To Adopt ***

Great dog for a first-time dog owner

Luella is 7 years old

She came to us a stray from a local shelter, it was believed she was run over by a car. She had to have surgery to have a hernia repaired and is recovering well in her fosters home. 

Luella enjoys car rides and sleeping on the bed.

Luella begs for food by leaning back on her hind legs but leaves a bit of her food for later as a snack.

She really is perfect, super loving, sweet, kind, friendly, playful and very silly. 

She is a little shy at first but only needs a minute to warm up to you.

Luella, loves to go out for long walks, she loves nothing more than to play on the grass, she really is a goof ball. 

When Luella likes you, she loves to show her affection with lots of licks. 

She is great with other dogs, however, will do well in a home with or without another dog. 

She is a fussy eater and expects only the finest human grade food.

She has been given a clean bill of health and is ready to find her forever home.

animal.description:
Lost Ball Canine Rescue is a volunteer based rescue, we work very hard to help as many adoptable dogs as possible. Most of our dogs come from high kill shelters across the country or are strays, so sadly, we do not normally have any background information on them.....but we work very hard to get to know each and every dog brought into our program. We do not take animals with aggression problems (some may not like other dogs, cats, or may require older kids as opposed to younger children, but we will let you know everything that we know) most of these beautiful dogs have been faithful and loving family pets for their entire lives, yet still have lost their homes and families through no fault of their own. If you are interested in opening your heart and home to one of these amazing dogs please fill out our adoption application at https://www.lostballcaninerescue.org/adoption-application and we will be in touch after we get it processed. If you don't hear from us in 3 days, please send us a gentle reminder and one of us will get right on it. Please indicate the dog you are interested in meeting, where it says preference on the application! You may also email lbcradoptions@gmail.com , we are always happy to answer any questions you may have.

If you give them your heart, they will give you theirs

animal.description:
This precious, sweet soul was found walking down the middle of the road near Odessa, Missouri late at night on the 4th of July.  Her savior took her to a temporary foster home that night and soon thereafter was welcomed in her permanent foster home.  There she has a Foster Mom, three Furry siblings (2 large dogs and a 19 year old Kitty) whom she had warmed up to quite nicely.  
 
Liberty was taken to the vet who thought she might be 10ish years old.  She has vision issues as well as some hearing loss.  Comfortable in her foster home, Liberty has been catching up on her rest and loves to have the fan blowing on her.  Naps, car rides and leisurely strolls are favorite past times for this gentle girl.

animal.description:
COCO
"I'M NOT GIVING UP ON FINDING A HOME"?????
My Foster Mommy wrote this about me:
"Hi, my name is COCO, otherwise known as "GORGEOUS!"  
My Foster mom has learned a lot about me:
-I am appropriately 9 yrs old
-I currently weigh about 55 lbs
-I love to lay out in the sun to get nice and warm.
-I'm the most loving and gentle senior
-I love my Tennis balls
-I mind pretty darn good
-I do not bolt thru your front door when -open
-I Sit nicely when asked
-Know it's strange, but, I turn around when asked - sometimes- seems silly to me though 
-I know how to Stay when asked
-I also come when called
-I almost have the "Shake Paw" thing down
-I take my treats gently
-I've been told that I'm a very Smart girl!
-I love People
-Not sure about other dogs or cats yet
-I like to be spoken to with kind words
-I walk nice on Leash.
-I love going on walks and car rides
So as you can see-- I'm a great catch for someone who needs that perfect companion!
The Awesome—All For Love Animal Rescue Team, "AFLAR"— helped to save my life by pulling me out of a shelter in LA.
I would not be here today if it weren't for them.  I'm currently living with my Foster mom until some nice person adopts me into their loving family."
If you'd like to meet COCO,  contact AFLAR~
Info@allforloveanimalrescue.org
(805) 445-3535

animal.description:
Meet handsome Flynn! At 6.5 years old and 40 lbs, this guy is looking for a very special home to live out his golden years. He has been through professional training due to past experiences; however, he requires a women only, no children, and no other animal household. He is crate trained, house trained, and knows several commands. He needs an experienced dog owner who will continue working with him. Although he is absolutely adorable, he needs an owner who won’t give in to his looks and puppy eyes. He needs to continue using the commands he has learned, and would enjoy being taught even more tricks. 

He has lots of love to give and enjoys going on walks as well as playing with his ball. Flynn's adoption fee is $250.

animal.description:
My name is Poppins, named after Mary Poppins because I’m a spoonful of sweetness!

I love to cuddle and I think that car rides are totally awesome!  I’m a lover and I’ll spend hours with my head in your lap. I'm a 2 year old Pointer mix and weigh about 55 pounds.

I am completely house broken and do well in my crate, sleeping through the night. I am food motivated, and I learn new commands quickly. I have an amazing nose, and I can get distracted with a lot of new smells. Because of this, I need to work on my leash training as I am strong and I can pull hard. The ideal leash training would start in a fenced in yard that I know well, and would expand my walks as I learn not to pull. Speaking of yards- I love to romp and will even throw my toys to myself, showing off some impressive coordination!

 I really like people, but young children can overwhelm me so families with children 8 years or older please.   

.Like many rescue dogs, I'm heartworm positive.  But I'm not showing any symptoms and I'm so young that my heartworm load should be fairly light. I’ve been on treatment since December and have finished my antibiotics.

Underdog Ranch uses the slow-kill method of heartworm treatment which includes a round of antibiotics, a few months of double doses of a specific heartworm preventative, and then monthly administration of yet a different specific heartworm preventative.  In 9-12 months, I should test negative.  To find out more about this - just ask my foster Moms!

I've been spayed and am up to date with vaccinations.  My adoption fee is $125 and all medication for the slow-kill method of treatment will be provided.

To request an adoption application, please visit https://www.udranch.org/contact.  Please allow 24-48 hours for a response!

animal.description:
YES - I:M BEING REPOSTED AGAIN! I've had quite a few people interested in adopting me, but I do come with some challenges that have been discovered in my foster home.  Even though there is one major challenge with me, I love people and am very loving.

Do you happen to be searching for a couch potato?  Look no further - I'M IT!!

My name is Penny and I'm a 3 year old Dalmatian mix girl who was rescued from a county shelter!  I weigh about 70 pounds and am a pretty chill gal.

I LOVE kids, but over the age of 5 please - simply because of my size.  

I will do best in a household where I am the only dog.  I do ok with small dogs, but medium sized and up I can be reactive.  I'm also not the type to go to the dog park or on walks where I may meet other dogs for the same reason.  If you have experience with dogs that need slow introductions to others, that would be great  I'm definitely not one for a first time dog owner!

I love going for walks and as I mentioned above- I'm perfectly happy just chillin' on the couch!

I've been spayed, am heartworm negative, and am up to date with vaccinations.  My adoption fee is $250.  

To request an adoption application, please visit https://www.udranch.org/contact.  Please allow 24-48 hours for a response!

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Online Adoption Application 
Oh where to start with my sweet sweet ELLE This gentle old soul came into my home heartworm positive, pretty thin, and fur so badly matted that her skin was cut and bruised. Elle has horrible eyesight, only peripheral vision but trust me, she can see a treat from a mile away and will do ANYTHING for it!!! We got ELLE shaved and bathed and have taught her so many things she had never known of. She truly lived her life as a prisoner. The day she slept on the dog bed instead of the floor... melted my heart. The day she climbed on the couch to sleep.... I ACTUALLY CRIED!!! EL has something going on with her hips. They give out on her occasionally. BUT I'm here to tell you, she is thriving in the loving environment we've given her! She LOVES to follow me! She actually wagged her tail at the sight of a baby I'm looking for a chilled out, patient home where someone is home most of the time. Elles older but deserves to live the rest of her time in pure love and happiness Give this sweet girl a chance! I know my family and I are so glad she came into our lives!! You will never go another without a big hug Elle style
animal.name: Eleanor ( Elle)

animal.description:
Rocky is a handsome 4-year-old treeing walker coonhound. He enjoys riding in cars looking at the scenery and walking in the woods sniffing the fallen leaves and other wonderful scents. In your neighborhood, this gentle boy will trot along nicely on a harness, glancing at the people and other dogs along the way. 

He recently lost his home of three years, so he needs stability, patience, love, and a calm environment to get back to his old self. And toys! hell need lots of toys: puzzle toys, Kongs, chew toys! Rocky will do anything for treats. He loves ear massages. When you scratch his neck under his jaw, he points his nose straight up to the sky and closes his eyes. Ah, bliss! Rocky leans into you and clearly longs for affection.

Rocky is house trained. In your home he will either stand at the door or bark to let you know he needs to go outside. He knows how to sit and lie down, and hes learning leave it and place. He sits and waits patiently for meals. He prefers the company of adult humans. He needs time to get used to new environments. We dont know how he is with cats. 

PAW places animals in the Washington DC Metropolitan area only.

She enjoys nothing more than being with the humans she cares about, whether out for a jog, playing in the yard, or cuddling up on the couch.  Except bubbles, this girl loves to chase bubbles!!!! animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Personality:

None of our foster dogs are tested with cats because we have no way of testing them with cats. Siberians are notorious for their high prey drive and typically kill cats, rabbits, chickens, birds, squirrels, opossums, etc., so we we don't have much success adopting them out to homes with cats. Most of our foster dogs are with us for killing cats, chickens and goats to begin with so our assumption is they are not good with cats and other small things that move.

Siberians are typically good with children of all ages and the only reason we would not list them as not good with kids is because they may be too energetic and bouncy and knock over a toddler.

Southern Siberian Rescue is a volunteer based 501(c)3 organization based out of Raleigh, NC, so we do not have a physical facility with operating hours that you can visit to meet our dogs. All of our foster dogs are in our personal homes. You need to fill out our adoption application (http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption) and get approved to adopt and then we will set a time for you to meet our foster dogs. As a volunteer based group, we all have jobs, family, personal dogs and other commitments but we try to acknowledge and process applications as quickly as we can. That being said, we try to keep our available foster dogs as current as we can also but it is time consuming to get pics and information on new dogs so not all of our dogs are listed at all times. Please fill out our application and then we can discuss dogs that will work for you and your situation. We average 40-45 Siberians in our program so we are certain we have one that will work for you. Please know that we are not obligated to answer inquiries on dogs as we will focus on approved applicants. Again, there is ample time to discuss all of our foster dogs AFTER we have an approved application on file. We do adopt out of state as long as we can get a home check done. We ask that you, your family and existing pets make the trip to NC to meet and adopt our foster dogs.

SSR can not and will not hold dogs for anyone. If we do, that means another Siberian will die in a shelter because a shelter dogs time is very limited, as is our foster space. We do our best to process applications in the order received and first application gets first interest in our foster dog(s). We understand that there will be scheduling conflicts with home checks and meet and greets but we will try to accommodate for that if a potential adopter has interest in a particular foster dog in our program.

All Southern Siberian Rescue foster dogs are microchipped, up to date on shots, spay/neutered, on monthly heartworm preventative and flea and tick preventative. For additional information on Southern Siberian Rescue and Siberian Huskies, please visit www.SouthernSiberian.com. To fill out an application, please visit

http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption
.

She is being fostered in an apartment and doing well. She loves to go for her walks with the other two dogs in the home.  Rosa weighs 100 pounds which is a bit much for her frame.  We expect daily exercise will help her lose weight and improve her overall well-being. Her fosters report that she has already won their hearts after just a few days!

Texas Great Pyrenees Rescue, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to Great Pyrenees. We have the best selection of Pyrs in Texas and we do home checks and vet checks before placement. We start with adoption applications (no cost/obligation) and we make placements on a first submitted-first approved basis. He's nervous with new people but working on that with his foster. An apartment is not ideal for capricorn but a fenced yard is. Full of energy he requires alot of busy time/running,ball chasing outside play.

Capricorn loves to play fetch and tug of war. No small children as he will jump up on them knocking them down. Young and full of energy a very active and fast moving family is best. He knows sit, lay down, paw, beg and takes treats. This guy grew up without manners. Not socialized as a pup he will require slow introductions with new dogs.Capricorn is a work in progress that will need continuing work to control the triggers he has. He really needs someone experienced with dogs that were grossly neglected as a puppy.

progress. With patience and consistency he will be a great dog.

nterested in adopting me, please fill out an online adoption application at

animal.description: Hello all let me introduce myself.......I'm Eddie, a handsome, 1 year old pitty mix. I came into the shelter as a stray about 8 months ago and I was so scared. There were so many unfamiliar faces, loud noises and other dogs; I didn't know what to do. Nobody had ever trained me before or taught me how to behave. That all started to change with my shelter hooman. She spent time with me every day and we worked together to give me the skills and structure to help me deal with the stresses of shelter life. I know to go to place when it's time to go out for my walk and when I come back and to lie down, I know to sit and wait for permission with doorways and thresholds, I know good leash manners when we walk, and I am even housebroken. She tells me I give the best eyes because I look at her to make sure I'm doing what I should or if I'm not sure what to do. I do best with consistency and structure because that helps me know what is expected. I still have trouble making these decisions on my own but with this guidance I am getting better all the time. Sometimes I get excited and forget the rules but I am smart and can quickly refocus with a gentle reminder. I am working to be more patient to increase the amount of time I can stay in one position. I am sweet and spunky and have been told my expressions are priceless. I love to be outside among people being active or just relaxing and enjoying the sunshine. I notice the other animals around but they don't seem to upset me. I love the pool, peanut butter sandwiches and car rides. I have started to trust people and know what is expected which has allowed my sparkling personality to come shining through. I would do best in an adult only home, especially with experienced owners that can continue to provide me with the love and structure I need. If you think you might be my person then email dogs@hitor.org so we can start our life together.
animal.name: Eddie

animal.description:
I am Gorgonzola! I'm a 1 year old, neutered male Shepherd mix. I'm a medium sized dog who weighs 50 pounds. I am a fun loving, extremely energetic, young pup. My favorite things are running zoomies, playing with toys, and going for walks or runs. I would love a yard to run around in, or a family that will take me out for lots of exercise! I'm still getting comfortable around other animals so I will need to be the only pet for now, while I work on my social skills. I am a very smart boy who thrives from training and mental stimulation. I will need some time to adjust to life in a home, but I love training so much, I think I can learn the house rules pretty quickly. My ideal family is one who has recent experience with energetic dogs like me and can help me acclimate to my new surroundings and loves training dogs!
If you are interested in meeting with me, please submit your fully completed Adoption Profile Form to adoptinquire@peninsulahumanesociety.org and an adoption counselor will call you to conduct a phone interview before making an appointment to meet in person. You must be 18 or older to submit an application. Please make sure to include in the application that you are interested in meeting me, Gorgonzola ID# A883573.
Application: https://phs-spca.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/AdoptionProfiles_dog.pdf
Unless otherwise indicated, adoptable animals are located at our Lantos Center for Compassion at 1450 Rollins Road, Burlingame, CA 94010. Please note at this time we are doing adoptions by appointments only. Please call us at 650-340-7022 to schedule an appointment.Our hours are weekdays from 11am-6pm and weekends from 11am-5pm (closed major holidays). Interested adopters must arrive at least 1 hour before close. We do our best to update our listings regularly, but we can't guarantee every animal you see is still available. It's also typical for us to have animals who haven't had their photos taken yet, so you are welcome to visit our adoption center and have a look around!
To check on an animal's adoption status, please call 650-340-7022 during normal business hours to speak with an adoption counselor. Emails will be returned as soon as possible, but please allow up to 48 hours during busy adoption periods like weekends.

animal.description:
Meet Corky! Corky came to us when his dad died & the family couldn't keep him. Corky lived his whole 12 years with his dad who was an older quiet gentleman. His days consisted of long naps in a sunny spot, lots of treats & spoiling!
Corky is a shepherd mix & he is a senior & with that comes arthritis & knee & hip issues. His ACL is torn but due to the instability of his back end it's not advisable to fix it at his age! Corky gets pain meds every day & is able to get around fairly well. He stays close but does enjoy a very short walk to sniff & check out the neighborhood.
Corky will need his pain meds for the rest of his years.
His adoption fee is $50!
Corky would prefer a quiet home where he can binge watch Netflix & chill on a soft bed!!
All of our dogs are spayed or neutered, up to date on age appropriate vaccinations, microchipped and if over 6 months of age, heartworm tested and on heartworm preventative in their foster home.

We require an approved application to meet any of our dogs. We do not have a shelter location and will not arrange a meeting without an approved application.

We strive to make sure the bios provided for our dogs are complete and accurate; we do understand that mistakes happen, however, so if you absolutely cannot find the answer to your question in the dog's bio, you can contact us for more information.

We require a home visit for each dog we adopt out, so we adopt within a 2 hour radius of Dayton, OH. If you are outside of this radius, we encourage you to contact your local rescue or shelter.

animal.description:
MANNY NEEDS A FOSTER OR LOVING FOREVER HOME!!!
Fosters make it possible for Dogs XL to save and care for homeless and abandoned dogs! To learn about fostering dogs like Manny, please contact us at http://www.dogsxlrescue.org/volunteer/foster

Name: Manny

Breed: Mastiff/Boxer mix

Approximate Age: 1 year

Approximate Weight: 80 lbs

Currently Living at: Local foster home

 

Meet Manny! Manny is a happy, bouncy, 1 year old mastiff/boxer mix looking for his forever home! Manny was found wandering the streets as a stray and when no one came to claim him from the shelter, Manny became a man on the market! Manny is a big softy under it all, but he can come on a little strong and he could use some work on his manners training. Manny LOVES being around people (although he prefers to approach them on their own terms and he doesn't love it when strangers get all up in his face) and he's great with other big dogs (but sometimes needs a little redirection because he likes to try to hump them...) and would love to have a big doggy partner in crime in his forever home, but he's not always a big fan of little dogs, so he's not a great match for a family with smaller dogs.  Manny can be a little shy and skittish around loud city noises, so he would love a quiet neighborhood and a home with a fenced in yard where he can zoom around, play with his toys and relax and enjoy the calm. Manny has enjoyed some outings with his foster and is sure to make a great companion! 
 
Because of his size, age and energy, Manny is looking for an adults only home without young children. Manny's forever family should be prepared to take him to training to help him learn how to be a good citizen, and he would benefit from some muzzle training for vet visits because he doesn't appreciate being poked and prodded by the vet.   
 
Manny needs a foster or a loving forever home to lavish love and attention on him. Please open your heart and home to Manny!


The adoption fee for this dog is $300, which includes the cost of heartworm treatment and routine vetting, including vaccinations and spay/neuter.

 

If you are interested in adopting, please fill out the application online at http://www.dogsxlrescue.org/adopt/adoption-questionnaire

 

Thank you for considering adoption and helping to save a life!
 

Please visit us online at www.DogsXLRescue.org

animal.description:
Floofy and Houdini are looking for a home together. 
We are looking for a securely fenced yard for this pair.
Because of Houdini's shyness, we are looking for an adult home for this pair.
Houdini didn't have much confidence until he met Floofy. Houdini has been much happier and is soaking up the companionship of his fluffy Floofy. And Floofy was separated from a dog she had bonded with. Houdini and Floofy live in the same foster home and have really hit it off with each other and hope they can be adopted together.

Our normal adoption fee is $300 for a dog. They would have a reduced adoption fee of $500.00 for both dogs.

Floofy, Bichon Mix, 4 yrs , 10lbs, rescued from a home that didn't take good care of her, great with dogs, full of energy, ideal home would include a four-legged playmate named Houdini, fenced yard so I can run and play, when worn out from playing, favorite place to sleep is on your lap

Houdini - Chihuahua Mix, 2yrs, 11lbs,
Houdini, when you're not looking, I might run off with your socks or a dryer sheet, a timid little guy but once he gets to know you, your constant companion. loves giving kisses, and being right beside you whether you are sitting on the sofa or cooking in the kitchen, loves snuggling under a blanket and chasing bugs in the yard or squirrels on the fence, love treats, loud noises and lots of activity can sometimes be scary, housebroken and working on leash training, best with fenced yard, adopted with Floory, a diamond in the "ruff", but if you can be patient, he will work his magic on your heart

Adoptions to Columbus area homes only.  614-471-9000
All dogs and cats in the home must be spayed/neutered. 
$300 for dog adoptions        $200 for dogs 7 yrs/older 
all pets are spayed/neutered, up to date on vaccinations and micro-chipped
-we have an almost paperless adoption process, we do not have an application
-adoptions are completely pet-parent driven
-you take the first step by calling about our pets or coming to Mingle With Our Mutts to meet the pooch you are interested in
-once you meet, we then bring them for a home visit so you can ask questions and see the dog/cat can interact w/ your dogs/cats & family members
-we will take them back home so your family can talk about the pet to ensure he/she is a good fit for your home
-that's what it's all about - what is best for the dog/cat and you! 

All dogs are in foster care.  No dogs are kept at our organizations office
Meet our dogs at Mingle With Our Mutts, first and third Sundays of the month from 12-2  at the 
Franklin Co Dog Shelter, on Morse Rd, behind Menards. 
Please email us to confirm the dog you are interested in will be there. Not all foster dogs/families can make it to every Mingle.  There will be 15 other rescues and the shelters dogs for you to visit with.
 
Please understand the dogs in our care live in our homes.  We become attached  and want to see them adopted to a family where we can visit to ensure the success of the adoption.  We appreciate your interest but can only adopt our dogs in Central Ohio.

animal.description:
Gypsy is a 10 month old Huksy mix that has had quite a difficult journey in her short life. Gypsy came into the rescue as a scared, malnourished 5 month old baby. 

Her anxiety resulted in compulsive chewing on her foot/ toes.  For months her foster mom provided around the clock care, bandage changes, antibiotics, cones, heart ache and struggle but she finally healed, only losing one toe. 

While her first five months of life are a mystery we do know that Gypsy developed a severe fear of men. She just graduated from Scotch Pines obedience training to help her gain confidence and manners.  This is also gives her more exposure to men in a safe environment.  While she is incredibly smart and excelling in obedience, her fear/reactivity towards men is still there. 

While Gypsy is still a diamond in the rough she is ready to find her forever home that will continue to help her heal physically and mentally in an environment fits her special needs. 

While Gypsy has been living with both big and small dogs, a cat, and she LOVES kids. (She's even been around chickens!) she would do best in home with no other animals or a single well adjusted dog her size that can teach her how to be a dog. 

Due to Gypsy’s issues with men she would do best in home that does not include an adult male.  Gypsy’s reactivity specifically escalates towards men with a darker complexion, facial hair, or large muscular body types.  

Gypsy needs a patient home, someone who understands she had a hard life and this is the result. Someone who will love her and continue taking her to training classes. She is amazingly smart and bonded so well to her foster mom and her children (yet even after 5 months has not became comfortable with the foster dad). We all know her potential, she just needs someone willing to continue building on the foundation her foster has laid down.

Now for the wonderful side of Gypsy!

Shes funny!  She groans, and huffs when you annoy her. She loves hikes, swimming, going running. When she finds a dog she clicks with, she's very affectionate and playful. Shes needy. And always has to have a paw on or near her foster mom.  I can cradle her like a baby. My kids can lay on her. Shes SO good with puppies. She loves them and is incredibly gentle.

Please send a message to Paws Rescue if interested.
animal.name: Gypsy

animal.description:
He is handsome, flirty, playful, smart, entertaining.... he is a Playboy!
Meet Playboy, a 7 year old terrier mix who has recently arrived from the beautiful island of St Thomas, USVI. Playboy was originally a stray on the island, was adopted from the Humane Society of St Thomas and then returned when his owner left island. Playboy was in a foster home on the island that had other pets.
Why was Playboy not adopted in St Thomas? Playboy is deaf, but knows some hand signals; he is also heartworm positive (he has started his treatment and full treatment is covered by Pet Search when adopted). We had him flown here to give him the chance for a great family... a chance he probably would not get on the island because of his age, his handicap and heartworm.
You will fall in love with this boy when you meet him... his forever home was not in paradise but we know it is somewhere in western PA.
Applications are available at petsearchpa.org

animal.description: Sugar and Dusty were adopted from a shelter in Texas after they were found roaming around together as strays. They were adopted by someone in Texas who hoped to train them as livestock guardians but the girls decided that they liked living indoors rather than outdoors. Sugar and Dusty made their way to New Jersey and were adopted, however Sugar never adjusted to "city living" she is a country girl through and through. Sugar is back in Texas and still looking for that perfect home. Her ideal home would be a farm environment without a lot of visitors. She is looking for a place where she can lounge outdoors during the day while keeping an eye on the property, then hang with her people indoors at night. Sugar is around 1.5 to 2 years old and weighs 75 pounds. She is crate trained and house trained. Sugar does well walking on a leash and does well in a vehicle. We would be willing to transport her to NJ, but it really has to be the perfect home for her. She cannot be in a home with children or even young adults. If you are a looking for a mellow independent dog please apply now and be sure to mention "Sugar".

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Personality:

None of our foster dogs are tested with cats because we have no way of testing them with cats. Siberians are notorious for their high prey drive and typically kill cats, rabbits, chickens, birds, squirrels, opossums, etc., so we we don't have much success adopting them out to homes with cats. Most of our foster dogs are with us for killing cats, chickens and goats to begin with so our assumption is they are not good with cats and other small things that move.

Siberians are typically good with children of all ages and the only reason we would not list them as not good with kids is because they may be too energetic and bouncy and knock over a toddler.

Southern Siberian Rescue is a volunteer based 501(c)3 organization based out of Raleigh, NC, so we do not have a physical facility with operating hours that you can visit to meet our dogs. All of our foster dogs are in our personal homes. You need to fill out our adoption application (http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption) and get approved to adopt and then we will set a time for you to meet our foster dogs. As a volunteer based group, we all have jobs, family, personal dogs and other commitments but we try to acknowledge and process applications as quickly as we can. That being said, we try to keep our available foster dogs as current as we can also but it is time consuming to get pics and information on new dogs so not all of our dogs are listed at all times. Please fill out our application and then we can discuss dogs that will work for you and your situation. We average 40-45 Siberians in our program so we are certain we have one that will work for you. Please know that we are not obligated to answer inquiries on dogs as we will focus on approved applicants. Again, there is ample time to discuss all of our foster dogs AFTER we have an approved application on file. We do adopt out of state as long as we can get a home check done. We ask that you, your family and existing pets make the trip to NC to meet and adopt our foster dogs.

SSR can not and will not hold dogs for anyone. If we do, that means another Siberian will die in a shelter because a shelter dogs time is very limited, as is our foster space. We do our best to process applications in the order received and first application gets first interest in our foster dog(s). We understand that there will be scheduling conflicts with home checks and meet and greets but we will try to accommodate for that if a potential adopter has interest in a particular foster dog in our program.

All Southern Siberian Rescue foster dogs are microchipped, up to date on shots, spay/neutered, on monthly heartworm preventative and flea and tick preventative. For additional information on Southern Siberian Rescue and Siberian Huskies, please visit www.SouthernSiberian.com. To fill out an application, please visit

http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption
.

animal.description:
Meet Red Hippo!

***$150 of Red Hippo's adoption fee was donated by Diana Lee in honor of Tomisa and Steven Collins.***

Red Hippo is a super-friendly girl who just loves people. She's an 8 year old female lab/pit mix, and weighs about 80 pounds. She's very affectionate and loves to give doggie kisses. Red knows "SIT, STAY, COME, and FETCH" and she is calm and obedient in the absence of distractions. She is heartworm negative and has been spayed. Red would love to be an only pet, and she is very low maintenance. She does well with older children, but is a bit too clumsy for smaller kids that she may knock over. Her idea of fun is to go outside a couple of times a day to play fetch, or to take a moderate walk. Otherwise, she is happy to be a couch potato. Red prefers an area larger than a crate if she needs to be confined, such as a small room, where she will be calm and well-behaved. Red would love to meet you and become your very devoted life partner!

Albert's Dog Lounge is a transporting dog rescue, meaning that we rescue many of our dogs from high kill shelters in areas of dog overpopulation. We are a specialty rescue focusing primarily on senior and special needs dogs.  The vast majority of our dogs come from the Houston, TX area where we have an entire team of volunteers, coordinators, and fosters. We do also work with local shelters, rescues, and owners.  If you apply for a dog that is currently in our local Houston program, we will work to get your dog transported to WI as quickly as possible. We ask that you have patience during this time of uncertainty and unprecedented dog adoptions nationwide. 

Learn more about Albert's Dog Lounge, our mission, and adoption policies by visiting Albertsdoglounge.org. 

Our process includes an approved application, reference checks, a homevisit, and then a meet and greet with the dog. Adoption fee is $125.

Begin your application process by copying this link into your web browser: https://www.albertsdoglounge.org/apply

WI Dept. Of Agriculture License Number: 474085-DS

animal.description:
Beautiful Fluffernutter was found as a stray wandering alone on the street just missing get hit by cars. He has limited vision due to cataracts and must have been so frightened.

We brought him to the vet where he was on fluids, intravenous antibiotics, and under treatment for a terrible mouth infection. His nails were overgrown and his coat was full of matting. He is now safe in our care and in a foster home.

Fluffernutter is an adorable 10 year old Poodle mix who loves giving and receiving kisses! A good belly rub is one of his favorite activities! He will do best as an only pup in his new home simply because he gets startled if other animals bump into him. He so deserves a wonderful home where he'll be treated like the little prince he truly is!

This sweet senior is heart worm negative, microchipped, up to date on his vaccines, neutered and takes daily medication for blood pressure regulation. He gets sub-q fluids due to kidney disease issues. He recently had a dental during which a number of his teeth were removed. Please download our adoption application and email the completed form to adopt@bobbicares.org if you would like to meet this sweet boy. Kindly keep in mind that our adoptions are local only (Long Island, Queens, Brooklyn, Manhattan).

? JAZZIE ?

PLEASE SHARE! 

Jazzie is 10 months old! She was found tied up in Memphis. When her owner was found she stated she didn’t want her so she tied her out. 

She is mostly crate trained, although she does still have some accidents. They are rare but she’s still just a baby! She walks great on a leash and harness. Jazzie has been cat tested and doesn’t seemed to bothered by them. 

Jazzie prefers women to men. She gets upset at the sight of strange men but she can warm up to them if you give her time. She clearly has had some trauma at the hands of a man. She just needs one to show her they mean well. 

She would do best in an only dog home with older children. 

She is the sweetest cuddle bug and will do anything for a treat! She loves to play with balls and frisbees! She’s very loyal to her people. She is very eager to please!

animal.description:
Lucy gives off happy vibes wherever she goes and just wants to give love to everyone she meets.  This teeny little girl is only about 35  pounds and 9 months old.  She loves playing with other dogs and is good with older children.  This “energizer bunny” is a big fan of a tennis ball. It’s her favorite thing other than snuggling on the couch.  A family for Lucy should include a four legged friend who is young and can match her energy level.  If you’re looking for a buddy to take walks or watch the sunrise, she will happily keep you company.

Placing Lucy in an adoptive home has been challenging because she has Addison’s disease and will need to take medicine for the rest of her life that will cost between $120-$150 per month.   Therefore, she needs an owner who can provide for her medical needs without it being a hardship.  Please share so we can find this girl a special forever home.  Message us for more info.

animal.description:
1. PLEASE NOTE: Breed mix info is the best guess of Bark Bark Wag and our vets. There is no way to know for certain what any dog's breed mix is without a DNA test, so we have no way to know whether or not this dog is "hypoallergenic". Since he/she is a mixed breed, and could have as many as 4-5 breeds in his/her mix, it is safest to assume this dog is NOT hypoallergenic.

2. MUST READ --THE FIRST STEP: Go to www.barkbarkwag.org and click on "Let's Get Started!" to learn about our easy 3-step adoption process & apply to adopt! ANSWERS TO MOST QUESTIONS CAN BE FOUND HERE! We are all volunteers with limited time to respond to emails; if your question involves something NOT addressed at "Let's Get Started!", we will respond ASAP!

*WE NEED AN ADOPTION APPLICATION TO START THE PROCESS*

10/20 UPDATE:  This adorable, squirmy cutie is Polly Noggin; a happy, feisty little girl who lets us know (loudly) when she's hungry or wants a snuggle!  She came to us in early August from Detroit Animal Care & Control with her Mom, Dad, and 3 siblings (all adopted). Polly has been a bit wobbly on her feet recently, and started having head tremors... After an ultrasound, Polly was just diagnosed with hydrocephalus ("water on the brain"). This neurological disorder happens when excess fluid leaks inside the skull, leading to pressure & brain swelling. It is generally a serious, often life-threatening condition which cannot be cured, only managed (if it's a milder case and/or caught early). Polly's prognosis depends on how severe her case is... We're hopeful she can be helped with medication, but expensive shunt surgery may be in her future (if she's even a candidate).  Polly has a neurological consult this month (October), but we won't know the extent of her issues/possible treatment options until we get the specialist's final report.  Bark Bark Wag is committed to giving Polly every possible chance at a normal life--this spunky girl is ready to fight, and we'll be with her every step of the way!

(Polly is an adorable mix of Maltese, Brussels Griffon, Pug and fuzzy Terrier mix (best guess), and we think she will be 12-26# when full-grown. She is learning about toys, exploring the grassy outdoors, and starting to work on potty training.)

11/1/20 UPDATE:  Polly Noggin had her neurology consult, along with an MRI, and sadly, the diagnosis was "severe hydrocephalus".  The specialist vet feels Polly is a candidate for expensive shunt surgery, and wants to recheck her progress in 2 months. This info is from the specialist's report:
"The degree of hydrocephalus is severe enough to warrant considering treatment with a ventriculoperitoneal shunt. However, it would be ideal to have Polly Noggin's skull more mature prior to placement of the shunt.  Therefore, the plan is to continue to manage her with steroids and omeprazole for the next 2 months. If she declines in the interim we may need to consider performing surgery sooner."  Polly will remain in foster care indefinitely, and she is not available for adoption for the foreseeable future. We are still in need of donation assistance to help with Polly's upcoming surgery -- no amount is too small!  Please see below for details--thank you! 

12/11/20 UPDATE:
Polly has been quietly growing up and getting stronger, and at 16 wks. old she's up to 7#! ? We are soooo fortunate that Polly's wonderful foster mom is also her vet. She and her loving human/fur family, as well as the awesome Healthy Paws vet clinic family, are providing Polly with lots of TLC, good nutrition & ongoing care, and she's thriving! Her hydrocephalus is currently well-managed on two medications, which are keeping the brain swelling at bay and allowing her skull to strengthen. Since Polly is stable and her symptoms are minimal at this time, our vet is hoping it may be possible to delay her needed surgery a bit longer, to give her body more time to grow/mature... This will give Polly the best chance of survival, since the surgery is very invasive and the younger/smaller the dog, the higher the risk. We'll learn more once our vet connects again with the neurologist at awesome Dogwood Vet Hospital soon with an update on Polly's progress, and we'll keep everyone posted!  In the meantime, Polly is doing allllll the puppy things... snuggling, playing, napping & even making a little mischief with her doggie/kitty friends!  

1/10/21 UPDATE:  Little Polly is up to 9 lbs. and stable!  One of her medications has been discontinued, since she's doing so well... We are giving her all the love she can handle, watching her grow, and awaiting her surgery date once she's a little bigger/stronger!  Bark Bark Wag deeply appreciates everyone's love and generous donations toward this little fighter's care so far!  

TO MAKE A DONATION:  Won't you please help Polly? It takes a community to make a difference; donations in any amount can help save her life! Donations can be made here on FB; at barkbarkwag.org, click on "contact/donate"; or to the vet clinic directly (pls. email us for info). Some dogs go on to live pretty normal lives with the families who love them, and that is Bark Bark Wag's hope for Polly... please help us give her that chance!
