animal.description:
JJ is 9 years old and came to CRT in terrible shape.  He weighed 32 pounds and had nails so long that they were imbedded into the pads of his feet.  He was so obese that after we got his nails trimmed, he still could hardly walk.

CRT immediately took him to the vet and tests revealed that JJ had Cushings disease, a condition that will cause a dog to gain weight, have an overwhelming thirst and as a consequence urinate frequently.  CRT went into immediate action beginning in Mid-July and JJ began a regiment of medication, a special dietary food and lots of walking.

JJ now weighs 22 pounds and has his Cushings Disease under control with the proper medication and his regular routine of diet and exercise.  He loves his walks and when you ask him if he wants to go for a walk, he runs to the door anxious for a new adventure.

JJ is a very sweet Chihuahua Mix and is nearing his ideal weight of between 18 to 20 pounds.  He needs a home that has a fenced yard as he loves to go outside exploring and an owner who will be diligent about his exercise and diet.  He gets along well with the other dogs in his foster home although he is a bit toy and food aggressive, due to his past in a hoarding situation, but a correction for his foster Mom stops the aggressive reactions. JJ loves getting pets, sitting in your lap and sleeping at your feet.  His forever owner will need to have him checked every 6 months to make sure his dosage of medicine is correct and know that he will be on his medication for the rest of his life.

If you want a buddy to walk with and someone who loves having his ears scratched, JJ is your man.

JJ’s adoption fee is $250 and he is worth every penny of that because of sweet companionship he provides.

If you are interested in the above dog, please do not email us and tell us that you are interested, but submit an adoption application.  The link for the application is below. 

To submit an application go here……chihuahua-rescue.com/adoption-application/ 

An application must be submitted and approved before a meet-n-greet can be scheduled. 

Your current dogs/cats must be spayed or neutered unless a veterinarian has determined that your current pet(s) should not be fixed due to medical reasons.  They must also be up-to-date on shots and on HW preventative. 

Reference checks and a home visit are required so SE dogs can only be adopted in NC/SC, VA MD and GA.

animal.description:
Bruno is a sweet older boy who LOVES to role in the grass!  In fact, he loves it so much that he will stop the role and lay with his legs in the air!  Bruno has some mild arthritis but has been doing well on Daququin and Carprofen as needed on colder days. Bruno loves the ladies (female dogs) - does not like his foster mom's male dog- but seemed okay with other male dogs in the past.  Cats are an unknown.  Bruno enjoys playing with his toys and occasionally will hide them!  Older children should be fine for Bruno.  We would love to see Bruno with a retired person or couple who enjoy leisurely strolls.  He does not get on the furniture but does appreciate his dog bed. Bruno knows basic commands and walks like a gentleman on a leash.   Neutered and up-to-date on vaccinations.  Heart-worm negative.  Crate trained.  Bruno is approx 8-9 years old and weighs about 98#.
ADOPTION DETAILS: All RHR available dogs live in foster homes. Each dog is spayed, neutered, (unless medically on hold) up to date on shots, dewormed, and microchipped. At this time, due to the size of our rescue, adoptions are limited to NORTH CAROLINA, SOUTH CAROLINA, VIRGINIA and +/-6 hours from Raleigh, NC. ADOPTION FEE: Our total adoption fee is $250, including a non-refundable $25 application fee. Fee can be paid using the "DONATE" button on our website (www.RottweilerHeartsRescue.org) - please indicate in the notes that it is for an application fee, and the intended dog. If you have any questions, please email our adoption coordinator at RHR.Adoption@gmail.com!

He is extremely sweet and loving, and forgets he is a Frenchie because he listens very well!  He LOVES the kids in his foster home, and does well with other dogs, even other male dogs. animal.description:
Meet Harlee.   She is a young (almost 2 year old) Border Collie who is a petite little girl.

Harlee is shy when meeting new people.   She will take some time to feel secure with her new family.  Her potential knew home needs to understand she will take time to warm up.   She absolutely adores the younger children in her current living situation.   She seems drawn to "little people" :)   She lives with other dogs large and small, and also a cat.   She tends to bark at and chase the stray cats that visit her yard, but does so/so with the indoor cat.  She hasnt tried to hurt him, but she does annoy and chase him at times.  She knows how to use a doggie door and is crate trained perfectly.   She can be bossy with the other Border Collie she is living with. 

Harlee is not a "hyper" dog as some tend to think regarding Border Collies.  She is a low key girl who enjoys cuddling up with her people.   She is not the type of dog you can trust off leash, so she would not be a good competition Border Collie.   We would be afraid she would run.    She does listen very well when in the home, but outside where she has free run (in a fenced in acre) she sometimes takes a minute to come back inside.    

She is being spayed, microchipped and vaccinated prior to her adoption.  Her adoption fee is $400.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Personality:

None of our foster dogs are tested with cats because we have no way of testing them with cats. Siberians are notorious for their high prey drive and typically kill cats, rabbits, chickens, birds, squirrels, opossums, etc., so we we don't have much success adopting them out to homes with cats. Most of our foster dogs are with us for killing cats, chickens and goats to begin with so our assumption is they are not good with cats and other small things that move.

Siberians are typically good with children of all ages and the only reason we would not list them as not good with kids is because they may be too energetic and bouncy and knock over a toddler.

Southern Siberian Rescue is a volunteer based 501(c)3 organization based out of Raleigh, NC, so we do not have a physical facility with operating hours that you can visit to meet our dogs. All of our foster dogs are in our personal homes. You need to fill out our adoption application (http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption) and get approved to adopt and then we will set a time for you to meet our foster dogs. As a volunteer based group, we all have jobs, family, personal dogs and other commitments but we try to acknowledge and process applications as quickly as we can. That being said, we try to keep our available foster dogs as current as we can also but it is time consuming to get pics and information on new dogs so not all of our dogs are listed at all times. Please fill out our application and then we can discuss dogs that will work for you and your situation. We average 40-45 Siberians in our program so we are certain we have one that will work for you. Please know that we are not obligated to answer inquiries on dogs as we will focus on approved applicants. Again, there is ample time to discuss all of our foster dogs AFTER we have an approved application on file. We do adopt out of state as long as we can get a home check done. We ask that you, your family and existing pets make the trip to NC to meet and adopt our foster dogs.

SSR can not and will not hold dogs for anyone. If we do, that means another Siberian will die in a shelter because a shelter dogs time is very limited, as is our foster space. We do our best to process applications in the order received and first application gets first interest in our foster dog(s). We understand that there will be scheduling conflicts with home checks and meet and greets but we will try to accommodate for that if a potential adopter has interest in a particular foster dog in our program.

All Southern Siberian Rescue foster dogs are microchipped, up to date on shots, spay/neutered, on monthly heartworm preventative and flea and tick preventative. For additional information on Southern Siberian Rescue and Siberian Huskies, please visit www.SouthernSiberian.com. To fill out an application, please visit

http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption
.

animal.description:
Penelope is an experienced (if unsuccessful) squirrel hunter. She will keep those little guys in line - and in the trees.  She loves a good romp in the yard and naps in the sun. 

Cuddles on the couch are equally important. She's a great companion a NetFlix binge or an HGTV marathon.  Penelope also enjoys chewing on bones, snoozing under the desk and generally hanging with her human.

Penelope has lovely house manners and is an easy dog to have around. She's playful, silly and full of joy.  Her birthday is in November of 2012, so she's a lovely calm lady, but still lively and loving.

Penelope is heartworm negative, spayed, up-to-date on her vaccinations and ready for her forever family.

Penelope's approx. DOB is 11/1/2012.

Our adoption fee is a $250.00 donation to Pup Squad Animal Rescue. Our adopted dogs are all spayed/neutered, vaccinated and micro-chipped. If you are interested in adoption, please go to www.pupsquad.org/adopt to read more about our policies and find our application. Applications should be submitted via the online form http://pupsquad.org/adopt/adoption-application.html.

During COVID 19 - We may not be able to help coordinate transport out of state due to limited resources on our end and limited transport options to get the dogs to destinations outside of Texas.

Thank you for choosing to rescue an animal in need!
www.pupsquad.org

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Personality:

None of our foster dogs are tested with cats because we have no way of testing them with cats. Siberians are notorious for their high prey drive and typically kill cats, rabbits, chickens, birds, squirrels, opossums, etc., so we we don't have much success adopting them out to homes with cats. Most of our foster dogs are with us for killing cats, chickens and goats to begin with so our assumption is they are not good with cats and other small things that move.

Siberians are typically good with children of all ages and the only reason we would not list them as not good with kids is because they may be too energetic and bouncy and knock over a toddler.

Southern Siberian Rescue is a volunteer based 501(c)3 organization based out of Raleigh, NC, so we do not have a physical facility with operating hours that you can visit to meet our dogs. All of our foster dogs are in our personal homes. You need to fill out our adoption application (http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption) and get approved to adopt and then we will set a time for you to meet our foster dogs. As a volunteer based group, we all have jobs, family, personal dogs and other commitments but we try to acknowledge and process applications as quickly as we can. That being said, we try to keep our available foster dogs as current as we can also but it is time consuming to get pics and information on new dogs so not all of our dogs are listed at all times. Please fill out our application and then we can discuss dogs that will work for you and your situation. We average 40-45 Siberians in our program so we are certain we have one that will work for you. Please know that we are not obligated to answer inquiries on dogs as we will focus on approved applicants. Again, there is ample time to discuss all of our foster dogs AFTER we have an approved application on file. We do adopt out of state as long as we can get a home check done. We ask that you, your family and existing pets make the trip to NC to meet and adopt our foster dogs.

SSR can not and will not hold dogs for anyone. If we do, that means another Siberian will die in a shelter because a shelter dogs time is very limited, as is our foster space. We do our best to process applications in the order received and first application gets first interest in our foster dog(s). We understand that there will be scheduling conflicts with home checks and meet and greets but we will try to accommodate for that if a potential adopter has interest in a particular foster dog in our program.

All Southern Siberian Rescue foster dogs are microchipped, up to date on shots, spay/neutered, on monthly heartworm preventative and flea and tick preventative. For additional information on Southern Siberian Rescue and Siberian Huskies, please visit www.SouthernSiberian.com. To fill out an application, please visit

http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption
.

animal.description:
Angel Sue is a true champion girl that has overcome some of mankind's most neglectful abuse there is in life. She was found as a terribly emaciated stray with a deeply embedded chain wrapped around her neck from apparent years of never being loosened. After months of healing, she will have a permanent scar on her body but apparently not on her spirit. This happy and always smiling dog is just 4 years old and looks to be mostly a Lab mix that now weighs a healthy 65 lbs. She is a very playful girl that delights in your attention and the company of humans and toys.lots of toys that she can play with. Walking Angel Sue does require a harness only due to the old injury on her neck. We are requiring a fenced yard so she has the freedom to exercise and stretch her energetic legs. Angel Sue would be best as the only pet. Angel Sue deserves a second chance to have a wonderful life. Can you give her that life?

ADOPTION FEE REQUIRED. Contact ccrtennessee@gmail.com.

animal.description:
************Available For Adoption Soon*************************

*** Available to Foster & Adopt ***

Approx 6 years old

We rescued Roo AKA Mr. Knuckles from euthanasia at a local shelter. He was most likely dumped at shelter because he has rheumatoid arthritis. He would of most likely been euthanized if we had not have saved him. 

With regards to his arthritis, he is not a candidate for surgery and requires medical management, which consists of inexpensive pain medication, a healthy diet, and joint supplements. His arthritis does not slow him down. When he gets tired, we recommend either a dog carrier or stroller so that he does not miss out. He loves the Hussle and bustle of life and does not like to miss out on a thing. 

Roo is extremely sweet, loving, and gentle.

 Loves other dogs and loves people. Very laid back and well behaved. 

Loves to follow you around the house and snuggle. Loves to always be right next to you, he does have a little bit of separation anxiety but nothing major. Once settled into a routine he will most likely settle down. 

He is potty trained but on occasion he will mark, he responds to corrective behavior once he’s neutered the marking in the house should stop (we pay for the neuter)

He Loves to go places and run errands with you. Would be good in a home where he gets a lot of attention and people are always around. Would also be very good in a family home with kids (kids that well behaved with dogs) and he would probably prefer to be in a home with other dogs, but would still be fine without other dogs as long as people are always around.

He is not a candidate to be left alone for long periods of time unless he has a buddy.


Apply to adopt at: https://www.animalhopeandwellness.org/adoptionandfosterapplication

Apply to foster at: 

We are by appointment only. You must submit and have an approved application before meeting AHWF animals.

animal.description:
KEIRA

Please meet Keira, a 6mo lab/heeler with a natural bobbed tail.  She gets along with other dogs and will be available for adoption by Oct. 18.  She has no leash training, so we will work on that.  No experience with cats or kids.  No small children as she will be a good sized dog.
She is a RESCUE and will be spayed, chipped wormed & UTD on shots.
No other history available.

Filling out an application is the first step in the adoption process. If you have questions, the best way to contact us is to email azdesertrottis@aol.com.

We don't always bring all animals to our adoption events so check ahead of time to make sure the animal you are interested in is still available. Some animals listed may already be promised.

Arizona Desert Rotti & Pals Rescue is a NO KILL rescue serving Tucson and the surrounding area. 

We do adopt out of area under the right circumstances. If you are willing to travel to Tucson to meet us, and to personally transport your adopted pet home, we may be willing to work with you. 

A home visit is usually required for the safety of our animals. We check the yard to make sure this little pup cannot escape, no predator can get in, and also look for hazardous plants. 

We do not adopt our dogs out unless you have a secured, fenced yard, it’s a requirement for the safety of the dog. At the end of the application, please include the type of fencing and the height of the fence you have around your yard. 

If you're interested in Keira or any of our dogs, please fill out a pre application at: http://www.azdesertrotti.com/html/to_adopt.htm
Once you have filled out the pre-adoption application, someone will contact you about the dog to answer your questions and tell you where our Sunday adoption event is held.

Our dogs are bathed, dewormed, vet checked, given their required shots, spayed or neutered, and microchipped. 

Our rescues are homed with foster parents. They are fostered in homes so that we can tell you a little bit about their personalities, feeding schedule, habits, behavior, whether they get along with other dogs. We can tell you if they are crate trained, if they are leash trained and house trained. Most dogs need a refresher course on potty training when they go to a new home. They need to learn your routine, and it will be up to you to teach them. 

Even the most abused animals can be wonderful pets. It takes patience, love and good food, along with fun and commitment to the animal. Fosters work with these animals. They are a part of our families, while we are lucky enough to have them.

Brayden is a beautiful brindle boy that will need some leash training. He's a little uncertain about new things right now but he seems to relax pretty quickly. He just needs some stability, patience and a couple of treats to get leashed up. . He is very easy to walk and doesn't pull. He was a little timid at our playground at first, but after a few minutes those zoomies came out and he loved chasing tennis balls. He seems like a very chill dog but he was a little skittish if something touched him that he wasn’t prepared for. He’s a very sweet boy.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.American Bulldog/Pit Bull Mix | 3 years old | 75 pounds | Adoption Fee $225

Champ is a handsome 75-pound Doberman Pinscher/ Staffordshire Terrier and sweet Ladies Man looking for a gal to call his own.

Champ ensures he stays in shape on the regular. His long legs make him a solid runner, who enjoys trail runs, especially bounding through the winter snow. Other times, he shows off by playing fetch by himself (throwing the toy then retrieving it). He is even a great muscle building partner, engaging his gal in a flirtatious game of tug of war.

After a suitable exercise session, Champ will engage in good dental hygiene by enjoying a chew toy by the fire or a well-deserved Kong cocktail of peanut butter and milkbone. He takes some time to approach new people on his own terms, but once comfortable is very loving. Champ adores bedtime snuggles with his lady (he enjoys being the big spoon) to warm the other side of the bed.

Champ would do best in a home without shared walls (such as an apartment or townhome), as he takes it upon himself to be your protector, and will bark at passers by. Champ has no problem with other dogs, but swipes left on cats or other small creatures. He has not yet been around young children, but due to his size, he may knock over small children in his playful exuberance, so older children (middle school or above) would be a better fit.

In terms of adults, Champ will need to be surrounded solely by adult women, in a home with limited interaction from men. He doesn't like the competition for affection, and likely came from a situation of prior abuse by a male. This boy would also benefit from a home with previous bully-breed experience, and confident, strong guiding leadership.

Not only is Champ tall, muscular and handsome, but also is no slouch when it comes to smarts. Champ has learned "sit", "shake" and "drop" during his time in foster care, and would love to learn more from his special lady. Champ also has impeccable manners that you'd be glad to take out on the town, his leash in your arm.

Champ is a sweet and playful gentleman looking for the perfect lady to be his exercise partner, snuggle bug, and evening date. If you are the one to fit the bill, send an application to his foster, and they will set up a first date.

The most complete information regarding this animal, and all of our adoptable pets, please ensure you are visiting our website directly at www.RescueCrew.org. You can also access the necessary online adoption application here as well. Thank you. 2/2/21 5:51 PM

animal.description:
*** Available to Foster & Adopt ***
Updated 11/8.200

1.5 years, 48lbs

Experienced Dog Owner

Barney came to us from Iran, he was horrifically tortured he had his ears cut off and leg chewed of by other dogs after being thrown into ditch with other dogs that were starving and dying. He them came to us where he was put on bed rest for months so he could heal. This meant he missed out on crucial socialization skills puppies gain during the first few months of their life, he started showing signs of fearful insecure behavior. 

Just recently Barney has been through extensive training and is growing into  confident, calm dog. He loves nothing more than to play with his dog friends in the yard. 

What we have learned about Barney is that he is  looking for a strong confident leader in his life. If Barney does not have structure and discipline and leadership he thinks that it is his job to guard and protect. It will be his new owners job to make sure that Barney knows this is not his role and to correct his behaviour. 

Barney is extremely intelligent and knows that his cuteness will get him out of doing training exercises and has proven stubborn. However he will do just about anything for a piece of chicken.  As he cannot go on long walks he will need a lot of mental stimulation which will include fun nose/sniffing activities to wear him out.

What we have also learned since Barney's training is that he is extremely sensitive to change and moving him into a new home straight away causes him great anxieties which causes him to bark out of fear and uncertainity. 


 We are looking for from his new potential adopter is to come and meet Barney and build a relationship with him before moving him into his new home. We will look to set up several meet and greets at his trainer’s facility, then a couple of day dates and visits to your home and once we feel like he is ready we can move him in officially.

As mentioned he loves other dogs
Will do best in a home with or without another dog
Potty trained
Barney is a couch potato - great apartment dog- He tires easily which means he can only go on short walks anywhere between 10-20minutes, he lets you know when he is tired and will lie down.
Very independent- enjoys his alone time
Crate trained- Loves his crate
Walks great on a leash- trained with a prong collar- 
Super sweet, gentle, cuddle bug, 
soft and gentle
Loves to snuggle on the couch and nipple your nails and nose to show his love. 
He loves to sniff everything
Loves to meet to new people and dogs
Barney knows basic commands- Sit, Down, Leave It, Place


Barney is looking for an experienced owner who can continue and maintain all his training. 


Barney is a healthy pup. 
With regards to his leg, there are no long-term issues, it is however important to maintain a healthy weight. We highly recommend looking into joint and bone supplements and a healthy diet to keep his bones healthy and strong.


Apply to foster at:
https://www.animalhopeandwellness.org/fosterprocessandapplication

Apply to adopt at: https://www.animalhopeandwellness.org/adoptionandfosterapplication

We are by appointment only. You must submit and have an approved application before meeting AHWF animals.

For General Adopt/Foster Inquiries: adopt@animalhopeandwellness.org

animal.description:
Meet Nerf. 

Nerf is a local stray, that was never claimed. He's a 3 year old, terrier mix. 
Nerf is a bundle of energy that oozes into a snuggle buddy at the end of the day. 
Fetch is his game of choice. Nerf can play and play and play. While his bark sounds a bit scary, he's just very enthusiastic. We've been using two balls to keep him occupied and he is learning to drop' quite nicely. 
Nerf runs well with other dogs outside, but may be best as an only dog. 
Nerf deserves a home with fenced yard so he can run freely and a family with older kids who can play with him and help teach him basic commands.

animal.description:
When we first rescued Joy she was borderline feral, fearful, and closed off to human interaction and contact. After being with an incredibly patient and loving foster family who worked hard to bring her around, Joy is now ready to find the perfect forever family.

Joy is still very shy when first meeting new people, but after a bit of time you will see her amazing ability to trust come shining through. Joy enjoys running and will alternate between leaping around like a gazelle and running with her butt tucked under for maximum speed! She gets along great with other dogs and kitties and seems to bond with them quickly. Joy needs a playmate who is equally energetic and loves to play. She is very smart and *mostly* understands that inside is cuddle, nap, or quiet play time and outside is run around with the zoomies time! She also LOVES, LOVES, LOVES soft toys and will gather them all in her crate or in a corner for safe keeping...soft toys seem to be a comfort for her.

Joy is mostly crate trained and housebroken and does her best when on a scheduled potty routine to prevent any accidents. Joy responds well to positive reinforcement and blossoms quickly in new environments with those methods. We don't recommend she go to a home with small children (because they can be scary) but we believe she will do great with older, considerate kids/teens.

Joy is a 2-3 year old 50 pound Shep mix. She is up to date on vaccinations, dewormed, spayed, microchipped and on monthly heartworm prevention.

If you're interested in giving this special girl a loving home, please complete our application below and one of our volunteers will be in touch!

tinyurl.com/thirdcoastapplication

The day Joy was rescued...so you can see just how far she has come.
https://www.facebook.com/thirdcoastanimalrescue/videos/2319938618092015/

Mobile, Alabama

animal.description:
Meet Hazel. She’s a 7 year old, 70 lb lap dog.  She is finicky about other dogs. Some dogs she loves, but other dogs no. So she would be best as an only dog. We first came across Hazel when she was set to be euthanized at the shelter in 2016. We got her out and found her a wonderful home and she was the perfect babysitter for the children. Fast forward to September 2020. Her owners returned her because she got into a fight with one of their dogs. So now Hazel is in a foster home and longs for her own home. She would be a perfect companion for an elderly person, couple or a family, as she is very calm, friendly, loyal and affectionate. Also, she has one blue eye and one brown eye. 

If you’re interested in learning more about Hazel and would like to meet her, please text us at 713-562-5059. Thank you

animal.description:
Well, hello, Hazel! This silly goofball is about four years old and weighs around 50 pounds. She's house- and crate-trained and has Miss Manners-level behavior in the home.

Hazel loooooves adult humans, but the little humans overwhelm her. They can be kinda noisy, you know? She also enjoys meeting new dog friends, but hasn't lived with other pups. Hazel is not a fan of cats, so would like a feline-free home.

Call or text The Pet Connection at 913-671-7387 for more info on this stunning girl. She's spayed, up to date on vaccines, microchipped, and ready to hit the road with you! Hazel is eligible for a no-cost adoption with an encouraged donation to The Pet Connection.

INTERESTED IN ADOPTING THIS PET? Fill out an Adoption Application now! Appointments can also be made to meet a pet by calling us at 913-671-PETS (913-671-7387).  

ADOPTION INFORMATION:
Prior to adoption, our animals are: 
**Tested for diseases 
**Vaccinated 
**Spayed/neutered 
**Microchipped 

NO COST adoptions with an encouraged donation are accepted. 

The Pet Connection also offers adopters a FREE veterinary examination and a medical care support plan for 60 days after adoption, as well as lifetime behavioral training, safe sanctuary for pets returned in emergency situations, extensive assistance with lost and found pets, and other expert pet services in a variety of areas, including pet selection, behavioral issues, general training, nutrition, and transition to adoptive homes.

Please visit our website at www.thepetconnection.org for more information about The Pet Connection and for a full listing of our available pets, 

Call or text The Pet Connection at 913-671-7387 if you can foster, adopt, or sponsor a special needs dog or cat! 

The Pet Connection is a membership organization operating a no-kill adoption center in Shawnee, Kansas.

animal.description:
Due to the current situation with the COVID-19 (Corona) virus, in-person home visits are not possible at this time. Since this is a very important part of finding the best home for our dogs, we are not accepting any applications from first-time pet owners, applicants who have not had a pet in the past 3 years, or applicants who cannot furnish vet records. We hope you understand and that you will consider applying to adopt once restrictions have been lifted. Hello, my name is Faith Hill. I’m a very cute 10 year old, chocolate & white Cocker Spaniel. I love to be on the couch next to you but don’t walk away and leave me on any furniture because I may fall off. I LOVE belly rubs and brushing. I MUST be supervised around pools. I don’t like baths, but that’s because I had a bad experience in the water. I walk very slowly on a leash because I’m cautious. I’m a GREAT car rider! I may whine when I think I might be alone but I’ve never barked. I would do best with a family where someone is home a lot. I will require eye drops and allergy meds for the remainder of my life to keep my eyes healthy and control my allergies. I LOVE ice in my water! You may find a puddle here and there. I’m sorry. I drink a lot of water, so I need to go potty a lot and I have no idea where the door is. Plus, I’ve been outside most of my life and never really been properly potty trained, but I always go potty when I’m taken outside. I may squat, walk and poop l at the same time so there’s always a trail. I’m OK with other dogs or cats. I don’t mind young children but I may feel better in a home without loud sudden noises and toys to run into. Because my vision is impaired, please don’t rearrange the furniture or forget to push in your dining room/desk chair. I sleep in the kitchen at night for my own safety. I LOVE a fluffy dog bed but will lay on tile or laminate if I’m hot. I can be left to wander in the house while you’re away, I’m not a troublemaker. Faith is such a sweet girl and makes an excellent companion and lap dog, which is all she wants in life. If you would like to meet Faith Hill, please complete our adoption application and put her name at the top. http://dfwcockerrescue.org/ under Adoptions, Adoption Information.

For more pictures and information about this and all the cockers available at DFW Cocker Spaniel Rescue please visit our website at www.dfwcockerrescue.org

animal.description:
Name: Dumas Walker (Male)
Breed: Coonhound
Adoptable in: MA, RI, NH, CT, and VT

Good with dogs: Yes
Good with cats: Yes
Good with kids: Yes, older kids 13+
Crate trained: Mostly
House trained: Mostly

Dumas loves to cuddle and sniff around, but will not hunt like most Coonhounds. He loves long walks and being with his people.

Dumas has a typical Coonhound voice, so would probably do best in a house where the noise won't be an issue for the neighbors! He loves to wrestle and play with other dogs, especially puppies, but he sometimes does not like to share so feeding should be supervised. He does not like a plastic crate, but will go into a wired one easily. He takes a few minutes to settle down, particularly if he can still see people, but he quiets and does not have accidents inside it. He is doing well with house training but may still have the odd accident.

Please Note: All dogs currently available for adoption are posted on our website. If you cannot find a particular dog on our website, he/she may be on a temporary foster hold. All dogs are otherwise posted until they are officially adopted. This dog may have other interested adopters in line. If you are interested in adopting, please fill out an application.

animal.description:
Bruce!  Where do we begin?  Bruce was found slipping in and out of consciousness in 115 degree heat.  He had a gash that needed immediate care on the top of his head, his ears were blooded and ripped apart, his nose was raw with open wounds and his body had signs of horror throughout.  When Bruce was rushed to the Humane Society, his savior was told he would be put to sleep if they did not commit to taking him.  At that time, Poverty's Pets heard about Bruce's dire situation and we committed to his medical care and his recovery.  Obviously we had no idea how Bruce was towards humans and other animals but over time, as he slowly began to trust the kind hands and as his body healed, his beautiful, loving soul emerged. Bruce is a survivor and a lover.  We have been so moved by his recovery and to see him feel happiness and joy.  Bruce does tolerate other dogs but he is most happy being an only animal.  He just craves human contact and does get upset having to share his people with other pets.  Bruce needs a simple life.  You see, x-rays confirmed his constant limp when he walks as severe
arthritis and elbow dysplasia. His walks need not be long but they are good for him.  He will do best surrounded by tennis balls, a big cushy bed and people.  Bruce is about 6 years old, is wonderful on walks, loves car rides and is the best couch potato in town.   Bruce will make a wonderful companion and if you feel as though you can provide him a wonderful life, please take a moment to fill out an application:  https://www.povertyspets.org/adoption-form.  There is a $200 donation.  Please allow up to 72 hours for response.  Thank you for considering Bruce.
animal.name: Bruce

animal.description:
Bo is a distinguished senior Chihuahua/Terrier mix who is about 14 years old and weighs 14 lbs. Bo came up on a transport from North Carolina in mid-August with his two siblings after his prior owner passed away. Being a senior with skinny little terrier legs, Bo is having some difficulty with balance and mobility likely due to arthritis. He has been started on a daily supplement which may help to improve his abilities. He currently has some difficulty navigating stairs unassisted, so he would do best in a home with few stairs as he will likely need to be carried up and down. Bo does require a companion animal (preferably a dog) in the home.

He is in a foster home with other dogs and has no trouble holding his own although he might do best in a home with small to medium-sized dogs or other seniors. He has shown some food aggression, so it would be best to feed him separately to avoid snarling and cussing.

He likes everyone he meets and lives with an 11-year-old girl in his foster home, but is untested around younger children. Bo tends to fall asleep and snore on any available lap. He eats and drinks well and is very regular for an old man! He does seem to have some environmental allergies so he has been getting daily eye drops to help.

Bo's adoption fee is $150 (senior dog rate) which includes spay/neuter, age-appropriate vaccines/tests, and microchip.

If you would like to meet Bo, please complete an online application that can be found at: http://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.org/forms/196/dog-application

Meet Todd!!! Todd has been with us a short time but I can tell you he is going to an awesome dog with a little patience and training! Todd was found as a stray, he was positive for heartworm & Lyme he has been treated for both and is awaiting his appointment to be neutered.. Todd is very much all puppy even tho he’s about 2 years old.. He loves to play he thinks anything can be a toy, he would be happy to play with a water bottle all day if that’s all he had.. He is a sweet boy, he does well with other dogs. He is very playful so he would need someone to match his energy level.. No cats, no small children..

Please fill out an application and review our adoption procedures on our website at www.wwk9rescue.com Todd is currently being fostered in a private foster home in Colebrook, CT. animal.description:
If you are interested in adopting this dog, please download and complete an Adoption Questionnaire from our website and email Michelle at mhunt@k-9lifesavers.org
You can learn about the adoption process and find a Word, PDF and ONLINE version of the questionnaire by visiting: http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/howtoadopt/.
Dog's Name: Shelby
Estimated Breed : Husky Mix
Approximate Age: 2 years
Approximate Weight: approx. 45 lbs
Currently Living at: foster
Adoption Fee: $300
DOG'S DESCRIPTION
Shelby is crate trained, happy, playful, energetic and affectionate, what more can you ask for...
OH! and let's not forget her beautiful eyes!! She loves her people and can get excited when she plays so probably won't do well with young/small children.
Are you a runner/jogger?.... Shelby loves to run with her foster mom & dad and is the best running partner around town! Shelby runs several few miles a day and would make any runner proud!
So if you are have an active lifestyle and are looking for an amazing pup... Shelby just might be the one!
Your new pet will require a refresher in house-training. K-9 Lifesavers strongly recommends all new adopters enroll their new pet into obedience training. This provides for an easier transition into a new home, ensures the dog remains well socialized, and helps form a bond between the dog and the new family.
Adoption fees cover basic vetting, spay/neuter surgery (for dogs over 6 months old), rabies, distemper/parvo vaccinations, treatment for worms, heartworm testing, monthly heartworm prevention and monthly flea/tick prevention (while the animal is in our care), and transport costs from high-kill shelter. Please note that on average, K-9 Lifesavers spend significantly more on each dog than their adoption fee. Adoption fee for HW positive dog also covers heartworm treatment at our partner vets.
Foster Program: Foster homes provide for the temporary care of a rescue until the dog is placed into a loving, forever home. For more information on becoming a foster parent, and our Foster Program, visit http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/foster/ or email our Foster Coordinator at foster@k-9lifesavers.org
Sponsor Me! Make a tax-deductible donation today by visiting us at http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/donate/ . Donations help us offset boarding costs and additional medical treatment for those dogs who need it. K-9 Lifesavers receives NO federal funding and survive with your generous support!
For more information on K-9 Lifesavers, or to view a complete listing of all our Adoptable Dogs, visit our website at www.k-9lifesavers.org.
Please "like" our Facebook Page for the most current events and new dogs.
Thank you for considering a rescue dog!
animal.name: Shelby

animal.description:
Hi there my name is Hugo and I’m a very LARGE and handsome 8 year old boy looking for a new forever home. 

I love meeting new people and going new places, in fact I got to ride on 4 different small airplanes to get from CO to Gladwin MI! What an adventure that was. Everyone I meet falls in love with my handsome face and friendly personality.  Here's a little more bio info from my foster human:

 -I don’t play well with other animals, so I should be an only pet
- I’m a HUGE lover and love my people 
- once I attach myself to someone I’m theirs for life
- I live for walks, I get super excited for them! I would be an EXCELLENT hiking buddy
- I love all people and would do best with kids that are around 6 years old and older 
- I do snip at faces at times not to hurt people however. I nibble on people’s chins sometimes. That seems to be a sign on dominance. This goes away once pack order is established. I’ve NEVER done this to a child that we know of. Seems to be geared towards adults. 
- needs EXERCISE!!! I’m not a couch potato! I’m a working dog! I need a job to do even a few good long walks at the exact same time every day with a backpack is a GREAT job for me! Otherwise I will act out! I’m a malamute after all that’s common! 
- loves car rides
- does excellent at the vet
- house trained
- neutered, chipped updated on vaccines and heartworm negative 
- can be demanding 
- highly food motivated!!!
- can be playful but not overly 
- non aggressive with food and toys
- walks well on the leash with minor pulling 
-MUST have a tall,  secured fenced in yard 

If you would like to know even MORE about me you can email Dogrescue0146@gmail.com 
Or you may go ahead and fill out the MEET AND GREET APPLICATION at www.fewstepsfromhome.com 
-- 

Note from the humans: Hugo is being fostered at Few Steps from Home Animal Rescue. If you are interested in Hugo please visit their website at
 http://www.fewstepsfromhome.com/ or email them at dogrescue0146@gmail.com. They will be handling the adoption of Hugo.

animal.description:
This is NOT a Warm Fuzzies foster. The owner has asked us to SHARE this as the dog , Remy, needs a home. He is turning four years old , neutered and utd on shots. Here is the write up. Please message us if interested and we will put you in touch!
It is with great sadness that I am looking to rehome Remy. He hasn’t been the easiest dog, but he is a great dog with a lot of character and love to give. He's always been afraid of new people, but at a year and a half old he became aggressive and would want to bite. I sent him to a 2 month board and train (not at Liberty K9). He’s really obedient now, but unfortunately they did not address his behavior problems. About a year ago he developed dog aggression when he used to be fine with dogs. Despite this, I have still tried to give him the best life I possibly could and we have had many fun adventures together. Remy loves hiking (especially in winter), running with the wheeler, water, and really anything outside. He is a very high energy dog that needs a lot of exercise and mental stimulation. 
Remy needs somebody who is experienced with dogs that have behavior problems and someone who is willing to give him the “extra” that needs. He will need to go to a home without kids and could possibly fit in a home that already has a dog, but that would need to be evaluated. 
-He will be 4 on October 10th. 
-He is a husky/shepherd mix (LK9 swears he has some Great Pyrenees in there). 
-He is 75 pounds of fluff. 
-He is off leash trained and knows the commands sit, down, stay, come, leave it, drop it, and shake. 
-I will ensure he is up to date on his shots.
******************************************

animal.description:
This handsome blue boy is Thor, a 5 year old sweetheart.  Very tall and sometimes Thor forgets just how big he is.  Like most dobies he loves his people and wants to be with them all the time.  A long walk will be a great way to start the day with this dobie boy.

Thor is crate trained and it's a good tool for him since he can get bored and get into stuff he shouldn't.
Thor's favorite game is fetch, will play for hours if you are up for it.  

Obedience training is a must for Thor.  He knows a few commands, especially if you have a yummy treat for incentive. Thor really wants to please his people.

Thor lives around kitties that are very dog savvy so they do not give him a reason to chase.  A younger cat that isn't so used to dogs may prove to be a fun game for Thor.

Thor loves people so much he would prefer to be an only dog or to live with a female that isn't going to pay him much attention.  No home with a male dog or a dominant female will be considered for adoption of Thor.


All of our dogs are in foster homes and are available to meet by appointment only and only after an application has been completed.  To complete an application, please visit our website at www.bluegrassdobermanrescue.org

animal.description:
How we just love this shy boy! Buster is a couple years old, about 14 lbs  and came out of a hoarding situation. He was passed over by several rescues because he seemed aggressive. This little guy cuddles against the back of my legs every night as close as he can to me. He is always up for snuggling close in the covers. He LOVES other dogs and definitely needs to be in the company of at least one other FRIENDLY CONFIDENT dog. My friendly pack has taught him a lot and he is modeling their friendly behavior. I have two children and while he doesn’t seek their attention, he is getting better about receiving it when they reach to pet him. He follows them and is curious. He has the absolute CUTEST RUN and he flies down my stairs so fast he almost tumbles. He’s quite the quirky little dude. He is still very shy when you just reach for him but he will run up to me and jump on my legs for lots of pets. I still don’t just reach to pick him up as he is too
Insecure still. All of us have gotten attached to Buster or Butters as we affectionately call him. This little boy will blossom with more time and attention. He is getting really reliable about using the doggie door and pottying in our fenced yard. 400

All UnderDogs are spayed/neutered, heartworm checked, microchipped, up to date on vaccines and heartworm/flea/tick preventatives.  For consideration for one or more dogs, we require that an on-line application is filled out.  

TO ADOPT THIS DOG PLEASE FILL OUT AN APPLICATION AT https://underdogrescueofflorida.com/. 

Sorry, we do not adopt outside of Florida.  Applicants are subject to a home visit, and veterinary references will be checked. Please include a vet reference (including phone number) when applying online.

Our application process:
FIRST, an application must be approved for adoption from our rescue.
SECOND, we determine whether the dog that has been applied for is a "good match" for the household that wants to adopt him/her.  We take into consideration the dog's activity level, compatibility with other members of the household (human and other pets), etc.
If your application has been approved, but the dog you applied for is no longer available, please take the time and look over our adoptable dogs again.  We will make every effort to find the right dog for an approved applicant.

We hope you agree and understand that our goal to find the best forever home is our #1 priority! Please fill out an Adoption Application at https://underdogrescueofflorida.com/

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Zoe was found as a stray in Missouri and put into a city pound. There was no shelter in that area to take Zoe in, so when her time was up in the pound she was transferred to Safe Haven. While the vet in Missouri had guessed Zoe to be a Great Pyrenees - commonly used as a 'Livestock Guardian Dog' or LGD. Once Zoe was at Safe Haven, it was actually discovered that her unique appearance (docked ears and tail) is exactly what a rare breed of LGD dog known as 'Central Asian Shepherd Dog' or 'CASD' looks like. Zoe looks and acts identical to this breed standard pictures and descriptions. Central Asian Shepherds are a pretty rare type of Livestock Guardian Dog here in the United States yet - and was not even a choice on our website as a breed, so she was listed just as a Pyrenees and Shepherd. The Central Asian Shepherd was first developed in Russia several thousands of years ago. This breed is commonly bred to be a Livestock Guardian Dog, similiar to the Great Pyrenees, and would guard the livestock flocks from large predators, such as bears and wolves. The Central Asian Shepherd Dogs have their ears and tails docked when young, because they often fight off wolves while protecting their livestock - so having their ears and tails docked, protect these dogs from having a predator attack and bite their ears and tail. Central Asain Shepherd Dogs are known to be large, powerful, intense and fearless - and therefore are not suitable for first-time dog owners. They are an intelligent and independent breed, which can prove difficult to train. Possible owners should be experienced and firm, and Zoe's forever home should also be prepared for her to potentially be highly protective. Zoe will do best with a large fenced in yard so she can safely get exercise, or perhaps even a farm home where she may enjoy a chance at guarding livestock. The vet estimates Zoe to be 4 & 1/2 years old and she tips the scale at 106 pounds. We think she likely has some stories to tell as to how she became a stray, but all we know for sure is that she has some better days ahead! Zoe will need to be the only pet in her home as she has shown aggression towards other dogs she has met, and appears to have a pretty high prey drive. Zoe was briefly adopted by a loving couple, and she bonded very quickly with the male in the home. This bond did cause a problem as Zoe's protective tendencies came out toward his wife, including two minor bite incidents - and even though they both loved Zoe, they did decide it was best to return her to Safe Haven before anything serious happened. Since returning to Safe Haven we have noticed Zoe does not like to have humans down in her face or standing over her - she does seem to feel threatened in those situations - so any possible adopter must be aware and understand how important it is to avoid placing Zoe in these situations. This big girl is a very unique rescue dog, that we hope can find a home suited to keep her safe and happy - and a home that has experience with Livestock Guardian Dogs would likely be best suited for Zoe. Interested in adopting Zoe? If you are viewing this description on our website, please click the (adoption info) link above. And then click on the 'Online Application' link at the bottom of that page. If you are viewing this description on an adoption network, please go to our website www.wesavepets.com and follow the path just described. You will also find more details about Zoe there.

Click below to learn more about why to adopt your next pet from an animal shelter.
Adopting from An Animal Shelter

animal.description:
Layla was an owner surrender. Her former owner said she kept jumping their fence and running away. (we have not seen anything resembling that behavior since she got to her foster home)

Layla's paperwork is confusing. She is listed as 6 years on some of the paperwork, and 8 on others. Her energy level/teeth/eyes indicate closer to 6 years old.

Layla was treated for intestinal worms and heartworms since she came in to our rescue. She is done with the treatments, and appears healthy and happy!

Layla  plays with the dogs here, and she has done fine with the ones who don't want to play. Her former owner indicated she has some resource issues, with her food, and she is fed separately from the other dogs. Layla talks a lot===and much of that sounds like growling/grumbling.

This little one is not a snuggler (so far!). Her new owners will have to simply give her the space and time to settle and unwind---a week or two. She is obviously confused about her world being turned upside down, and is taking her time to settle and warm up to people. 
She will bring a toy over to play, and bark to go out.  She loves playing with balls, although simply runs around with them and never returns them.

Layla sits and is learning to walk on a leash. When everyone is called in from the yard, she is the first one in to get her treat! Layla is very responsive to positive training and treats and rewards.

She seems housebroken.  She barks at the door when she wants to go out.

Layla asks for very little. She is content to sleep in a corner or a spot with sunlight. She waits patiently for her breakfast and dinner. She did well when given a bath, and seems to enjoy being brushed.

Layla has not been tested with cats or children.

Layla is in Sparta NJ. We ask that people complete an application prior to meeting her. A home check/visit is also necessary.  Her adoption fee is $300.   Thank you for looking at rescued dogs!

animal.description:
Coral was one in litter of 5. Mom was a small wire haired terrier looking Gal and Dad is believed to have some min pin or chi. Whatever they are, they were all just beyond darling with adorable personalities. Her cute little underbite goes famously with her cute little sass. Microchipped, spayed and up to date on vaccines, Coral is spunky, playful, and affectionate. She has done so well in foster care and is an absolute gem, but she is going to need a patient person(s) to help her transition. Coral can be a "runner" when she is scared an unfamiliar. It took about 2 weeks in her foster home for her to understand she was safe but until then she bolted out of her crate and would bolt out of a door if given the opportunity. So she needs someone who will understand her, help her feel comfortable and be very cautious until she settles in to her new home. She definitely needs a fenced yard to run, she has the longest legs and loves to do her zoomies to get her energy out. Because she can be jumpy when she gets excited, we recommend no small children. We would require more than one meet and greet so that Coral gets a feel for her new people prior to adoption and are looking for a local adopter so that we can help Coral transition.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws

Available: SOON

Hey I’m Rocky, how you doin? 

I’m a lover not a fighter though. 

I got saved by a nice shelter from a bad situation where I wasn’t getting enough to eat and stayed chained up all the time. I only weighed 38.5 lbs when they saved me. Whew! I was almost a goner! 
They contacted a nice rescue where I got to go and be in a great foster home. There I got to meet a lot of dogs and was nice to them except when it was time to eat. I am learning how to share too. Who knew if you were a good boy that you got to get on the couch and roam around the house and play with the other dogs. I didn’t even know it was ok to go in the house until I got there. 
Oh the FOOD! I am learning that I get plenty to eat even though I still don’t want to share. 

My foster mom says I will get a new home once I get neutered and get my heart worms treated, whatever that means. So I’ll be here just hanging with them for awhile. If you want me to be your guy then just hit me up – I’m Rocky!!

This dog is being fostered near Jacksonville, AL.   You must be willing to drive part if not all of the way to pick up this dog for adoption unless transportation to another state has been arranged.  Please contact us with any questions. 

Please visit Rockin' P Rescue, Inc. to submit an online adoption application.  www.rockinprescue.org


Adoption contributions are as follows: 
* $300.00 for a dog 6 months and under
* $250.00 for a dog aged 7 months to 1 year 
* $225.00 for a dog over one year

animal.description:
AT PEPPERMINT PIG ANIMAL RESCUE, WE UPDATE ALL OF OUR PETS ON A REGULAR BASIS. 

IF YOU SEE ME HERE, I AM AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION. PLEASE READ MY BIO BELOW TO LEARN MORE ABOUT ME AND HOW TO APPLY TO ADOPT :)

Meet the Z puppies:: 8 months old, 10 pounds, Neutered Male Chihuahua/Dachshund/MinPin mix.

Available for Adoption!

Zoom is a playful and energetic pup and loves the companionship of anther dog in the home. He would love to be adopted into a home who has another dog to play with.

These boys are lucky to be alive after they were found thrown in a dumpster! They are now safe and loved in their foster home and will never have to worry about being tossed out again! Zippity and Zoom are sweet and outgoing boys who love to play and love to be held. They are doing fantastic with potty training in their foster home and are ready to find their forever families! 

$195 Adoption Fee. 

A $10.00 non-refundable application fee is required to submit your adoption application and will be deducted from your adoption fee if you adopt.

All Peppermint Pig Animal Rescue dogs are spayed/neutered, current on vaccinations, current on heartworm and flea prevention, and microchipped.

Along with other criteria evaluated in the adoption application, a Fenced Yard is required to adopt.

Please see our Fenced Yard Requirements tab on our website for more information, here:
https://peppermintpiganimalrescue.org/fenced-yard-requirements/

Adoption radius is within 2 hours of Peppermint Pig Animal Rescue. 

Please see our Adoption Radius tab on our website for more info, here:
https://peppermintpiganimalrescue.org/adoption-radius/

TO CHECK AVAILABILITY of any of our adoptable animals, please go to our available pets tab, here: https://peppermintpiganimalrescue.org/available-pets-for-adoption/

All pets listed here are updated regularly to reflect their availability.

ADOPTION APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS FOR PEPPERMINT PIG ANIMAL RESCUE:

Before completing the application, please read our ADOPTION PROCESS tab on our website, here:
https://peppermintpiganimalrescue.org/how-our-adoptions-work/

To complete our easy online adoption application, please visit our website at PeppermintPigAnimalRescue.org.

All adoption information and applications can be found under the ADOPTION CENTER tab.

Adoption events are held every Saturday in our thrift store from 1:00pm to 4:00pm. Please complete your adoption application in advance so our volunteers have time to screen and contact potential adopters.

IMPORTANT: All applications are reviewed in the order they are received and qualifications are based on best fit for each individual pet. A volunteer will contact you if you are selected for a meet with adoptable pet. Final approval is always made in person.

Peppermint Pig Animal Rescue is a no-kill rescue. Please consider sponsoring a pet or donating to our cause. Click the DONATE tab on our website to learn more about how you can help. THANK YOU !

For questions or inquiries on our adoptable pets, please feel free to contact our volunteer rescue team directly by submitting a Contact Form from our website, here: https://peppermintpiganimalrescue.org/contact-us/

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Straight outta Oakland - please welcome Skylar!

This petite 44 pounder (she needs to gain some weight) with amazing eyes is very athletic and built like a marathoner. Her favorite shelter activity was scaling the chain link fences so good, non-chain link fencing is a must.

Skylar needs slow introductions to new dog friends but once that's done she loves to play. I'm told she likes to be the boss in play groups so if you love dog parks, Skylar may not be your dog.

Skylar is not "a starter Husky" and would definitely benefit from living in an experienced foster home. She was very stressed at the shelter (who wouldn't be!) so we're looking forward to seeing how she blossoms now that she's out.

Skylar needs to be spayed and vetted as soon as we can get an appointment so she will be available soon!

animal.description:
boxer mix; O/S- can no longer care for her. 41lbs; HW-; 3 yrs old; 9/16. Came in with Antoinette (now safe). Her given name is Celia. Seems to ignore cats.

Got Toys?  Well, we could be really amazing friends!   While enjoying the sunny day and running through the play yard, I found one amazing toy after the other.  It's hard to say if one was always just better than the previous one but what I know for sure is that I had a grand time activating them, throwing them in the air, gnawing on them and then repeating!   My name is Celia and folks are guaranteed to have a fun time with me by their side.   With some energy and love to spare,  more active, sturdy folks are a perfect match for me.  I'm always up for meeting new dogs and people and wish to welcome them into my happy, wondrous world.   Going and doing is always a good choice for me as I have no inhibitions and love exploring, learning and broadening my horizons.    A stunning, young at heart bully,  I'm smart (will nicely sit), alert and aim to please.  Ask for me Celia, today won't you?

animal.description:
Meet Maxie!
He's a 3 year old Lab/Hound mix looking for his forever home! Maxie was a transfer from PAWS so not much is known about him. However, we do know he is a very smart and playful boy. Maxie would greatly benefit from an active family that can give him a lot of structure. He is very toy and treat motivated and would likely pick up commands fast! Due to his size and energy level, we'd recommend a home with older dog savvy children. Maxie previously had a kennel mate but had to be separated from him as kennel frustration caused him to act out towards him. He would likely be best as an only dog or with a submissive female after a slow introduction. Maxie would not do well with kitties or any other small animals. He will need a 6ft privacy fence and a secure yard.

He is neutered, up to date on vaccinations and on heartworm and flea preventative. Stop by and meet him, 9-1, Mon thru Sat!

animal.description:
Oh Hank - you stole our hearts the minute we saw you!

This beautiful young hound mix is gentle, loving and very smart. He's done well with every dog we've introduced him to and really just wants to play and explore. He has some separation anxiety right now which he expresses by barking - a lot - so he will need a home where he's not alone often and that is willing to help him gain confidence and trust. This guy cannot be a city dog - he is far to noisy. He needs a safe, country home.

Hank has some issues with resource guarding and is still quite mouthy, so he needs a home with no children. He would appreciate a young doggy companion or two, but no cats or other small animals. He will need plenty of exercise and training, and will bond strongly with his family. Can you give this boy his forever home?


Most of our dogs require a fully fenced yard, this does depend on the individual dogs needs and safety requirements.  

Our dogs are fed a nutrient rich dog food named NutriSource.  Our experience is a high quality dog food keeps vet bills down and well-being high.

If you have any questions please email: claudiaatwag@gmail.com

Visit our website to fill out an Adoption Application  http://www.wagsequimwa.com

Adoption donation fee $350  (Please understand this adoption donation goes towards helping all the dogs we rescue)

Hi, my name is Eclipse and I am approximately 8 months old. My people think I may be a Staffordshire terrier/Labrador Retriever mix. I am a super cute energetic girl. I walk well on a leash and love to explore my surroundings. I am
a total ball dog. Who can turn down a good game of fetch?!  My foster mom says I am super sweet.  I am crate trained and house trained. I get along with other dog but only if you properly introduce me to them plus I need to be reminded constantly that I need to mind my manners when meeting new dogs because my excitement makes them nervous and I can get in trouble but I really mean well. Also, you must know, I have never been cat tested. I get pretty excited on walks when I see cats and squirrels so my people are going to say no to a home with a furry feline. They think I might want to give chase and they are probably correct.  

I am spayed, health certified, up to date on vaccines and microchipped.

animal.description:
*Due to state laws regarding out of state adoptions, we cannot adopt to families in Massachusetts or Rhode Island.*

Piper is a sweet 5 - 6 year old mixed breed dog. She was taken into her foster home when she was pregnant and raised a litter of precious pups. She was a great mama to them and is now ready for someone to take care of her.

She loves to play, is great with other dogs, and is a great snuggle buddy at bedtime.

Listed breed is an educated guess made by our veterinarian and is NOT a guarantee - this also means we have no way of knowing what a puppy's adult size will be.

This dog is currently being fostered in Mississippi and will be transported via Barton's Barkers transport services upon adoption. Their adoption fee is $450 and includes spay/neuter, age appropriate vaccinations, a nose to tail vet check, microchip and transport costs. Second Chances lists dogs as being available in White River Junction, VT because we transport our dogs to the area every 3rd week after they have been adopted. All of our local shelters have a high euthanasia rate due to overpopulation so we created our rescue group to primarily adopt to the northern states to help keep as many dogs as we can from entering our kill shelters.

animal.description:
This is a courtesy post and Chichi is not in the care of Paws Crossed. If you are interested please contact the owner directly.

Chichi is a 2 year-old pit mix that will light up your days! Chichi is the light of the party. She's very high energy, loves to give kisses and to snuggle with you. 

Chichi was adopted from ACC in June of this year and has been a work in progress in terms of training. She arrived at home not wanting people to touch her much, so it was very hard to even put the harness on her. Right now Chichi is the sweetest dog at home! She loves pets, cuddles and she lets you put her harness on before a walk like a champ. 

She has been living with my cat without any trouble. It was hard at the beginning but after a while she stopped chasing her completely, and now even when my cat runs around like crazy Chichi doesn't care about it. She likes to be a couch potato and when she wakes up, tug-of-war is her favorite game, along with me chasing her to get her toy.

Chichi knows sit, stay, down, up, look at me and touch. She's really a fast learner! 

Because Chichi is reactive to other dogs and can get too excited with some strangers in specific settings, her ideal adopter would have previous experience with big dogs and live in a calm area.

If you are interested in meeting Chichi contact Diana Guerra at: dianaguerra14@gmail.com

animal.description: Hi! My name is Wilma but my foster mommy and daddy call me pea because I love anything that starts with the letter p (peanut butter, pepperoni, provolone)...yum! You may remember me from the Flinstone liter! All of my puppies have gone to their forever homes, and now its my turn! I love my foster brother and look to him for confidence and guidance, so Id love a home with a male dog. I can be nervous since I lived on the streets for so many years so I prefer a quiet home with no young children. I currently live with a cat and I dont really bother with him much, in fact most of the time I pretend like hes not even there! I love to follow my foster mommy around and cuddle up with her on the couch. It takes me longer to get used to men but with patience and time I know I can do it! I am crate trained...I view my crate as my safe place. I am also house trained and know when its time to go outside to go to the bathroom. I need a person who is patient and will take the time to get to know who I am. Is that you? I promise in return endless love and lots of licks. Wilma needs a 6ft solid fence for her yard and you must own your home. Please apply at charliescrusaders.org

animal.description:
Looks like: Terrier
Female, 14 years old, 10 pounds
Carmella is a sweet, independent girl. She seems grateful for attention but doesn't beg for it either. She gets along smoothly with other dogs and will find a nice little bed to lay in with no issues. She has an accepting personality and her ears flop as she trots along to say hi to you! She's very cute. 

Carmella was diagnosed with diabetes after coming into our care. She will need insulin injections twice a day for life and we are looking for a very special, compassionate person to be her family. Thankfully she is very tolerant of her injections so far. 

She is fine for short distanced walks and will ignores other dogs on them. She is mostly low energy and has no problem being left alone. She does not get treats due to her diabetes. Carmella does not give kisses but loves to be petted. Her ideal home is one with low activity and able to administer her care. 

Carmella came to us from San Jose Animal Care and Services.

animal.description:
Follow us on Facebook for updated photos and more information on our adoptable pets!


Meet Asher!
Asher is about 7 months old. He is a purebred German Shepherd. Asher was diagnosed with Juvenile Cataracts in both eyes. He has seen multiple vets and specialists. All agree he may need surgery in the future to correct his vision issues, but they are not severe enough that he should have surgery now. He needs to be evaluated about every 6 months to see if they are progressing. There is a decent chance he may never need surgery. He can see well enough that his vision does not affect his daily life. 

Asher is a TYPICAL SHEPHERD. He is very smart, and needs to be worked with. He is young, has lots of puppy energy, and needs clear rules and boundaries with an owner who is very consistent. Asher needs a home with no children, because he needs an owner capable of handling training and continued socialization. 

Asher would be a very easy addition to a German Shepherd savvy family. 

An approved adopter for Asher would be someone who has Shepherd experience, time to dedicate to training, and WILL SIGN A TRAINING AGREEMENT. As well as provide proof that he is registered for classes.

Asher is an absolutely amazing puppy, and these things will ensure that he is very successful in his forever home.
Asher is vaccinated for rabies, distemper, and bordatella. Asher is neutered and is microchipped. Asher's adoption fee is $400 plus WI state tax. 

If you are interested in meeting Asher, please fill out an application at luckypawsmidwest.org. Once your application is approved, we can set up a time for you to meet Asher!

Lucky Paws Midwest is licensed and inspected by the State of Wisconsin: 402655-DS

animal.description:
Ina is looking for a wonderful home or fosterhome!  She would love a home with a yard she can hang out in,  She is good in a crate and would enjoy a 30-45min walk a day.  She would do best in a home with no kids (teenagers might be ok).  Her ideal home would be GSD/large dog experienced.  She currently is in a boarding environment around other dogs and does fine, but has not interacted with them beyond through fencing.  Ina has not been cat tested.

Here is what we know about this beautiful girl:

The Fabulous Miss Ina G

Ina is a beautiful red and brown, 8 year old German Shepherd, about 100lbs, but is ready to shed a few!  The meaning of her name stems from ‘mother’, ‘queen’, ‘pure’, and to illuminate - so fitting for this girl. Ina is currently in need of a foster/adopter. 

Ina loves to go for car rides and loads and unloads easily and she has become a champ at the ramp.  She is okay on leash (pulls) but is  easily redirected and is ever so happy to nose around and walk in the grass at the park. She is crate trained as well as house trained and very food motivated.  

Ina is friendly with other dogs though the fence but she hasn’t been dog tested nor has she been tested with cats.  She hears and sees well and is German Shepherd smart and very adaptable to new routines.  She doesn’t bark or fuss unless barked at first and even then it’s with a playful sounding response. 

Ina’s hips are tired but they don’t slow her down and it would appear that she has had more than one litter of puppies.  She currently is on a twice daily dose of gabapentin, an adrenal support supplement, milk thistle and turmeric golden paste.


Please email right away if you would like to learn more about this dog......and visit our website www.siarescuers.org to learn more about our rescue group.   Adoption fees range from $150-$350 for dogs.  THE DOGS SHOWN ON THE SITE ARE IN FOSTERCARE - WE DO NOT HAVE A SHELTER TO VISIT.  EMAIL is the best way to reach us.We are a volunteer run, very small organization - so please be patient when waiting for a response, but feel free to check back in if you haven't heard from us in a day or so - thank you so much for considering a rescued pooch!

animal.description:
Born 02-24-2017 and weight about 49#.  
Off to a bit of a poor start, I was one puppy in a batch due to accidental breeding.  My sister was found out on a prairie and brought to the shelter, instigating an investigation for other pups.  Traced to Augusta, we were offered new digs at the facility.  We were quite the barnbusters, then split up when adopted to various new homes.  I was in mine for several years, then got this great idea that it was okay and fun to chase and kill chickens that also lived there.  Then, oh my goodness, there were the deer to chase.  I had a grand time and was not about to give either up, so here I am.  I am kind, patient, not good with other pooches (that will be worked on when we have other ones here).  I am very camera shy but you probably already guessed that.  I adore people and submissive with humans.  Tolerate cats nicely.  I have another job assigned to me, and that is to learn how to play.  These people keep waving squeekers in from of me, and throw those goofy round things across the field.  They just get that pathetic  look from me as I shake my head at how they entertain themselves.  Anyway, come and visit me.  I will charm you.
*Mae went on trial for a couple of days and was returned because of her shy manner, interest in laying on the sofa,  and lack of attention to toys.  But, that is Mae and she continues to be very dedicated to the people around her. Super sweet, but if you are looking for a rambunctious dog, she is not for you.

animal.description:
Hello there, it’s me Dixie. I have quite a long story so sit back. I was found with another dog that my foster mom thinks was my daughter on April 8, 2020 by Sugar Land Animal Services. I was estimated to be three years old when I was found and my companion was about 18 months old. They named me Dixie and her Daisy. Both of us were pregnant and due about the same time. We both went to fosters with Pup Squad to have pups and get adopted.

I had 10 beautiful babies. When they were about 3 weeks old my foster mom saw me have a seizure. My pups went to other fosters to be cared for since I had this condition and need to be cared for. I started down a long road of trying different medications. It’s November and it seems, knock on wood, my seizures are under control.

Well I’m not just known only by my condition. I have a personality that just doesn't stop! I love to play fetch, but I have not quite figured out the drop it and tug-of-war is always fun. Sometimes I just just lay and chew on a bone. My most favorite is meal time. I do help myself to coffee that has been left on the table unattended (hehehe).

I am the most nosey dog that has ever lived in this house from what I hear. If my foster mom is looking at something down low I will get right in between her and what she is trying to look at. I’ve been told I have a big body but that just doesn’t compute so I just walk under small tables and things go flying. My foster brother always sits in the same chair. When I walk between his chair, with him in it, and the couch his chair gets scooted around :)

I am a sweet, loving gal who happens to have some seizures. Don’t let that scare you away because the medicine does help and I am such an awesome dog! I will make someone very happy!

Dixie's approx. DOB is 4/1/2017.

Our adoption fee is a $250.00 donation to Pup Squad Animal Rescue. Our adopted dogs are all spayed/neutered, vaccinated and micro-chipped. If you are interested in adoption, please go to www.pupsquad.org/adopt to read more about our policies and find our application. Applications should be submitted via the online form http://pupsquad.org/adopt/adoption-application.html.

During COVID 19 - We may not be able to help coordinate transport out of state due to limited resources on our end and limited transport options to get the dogs to destinations outside of Texas.

Thank you for choosing to rescue an animal in need!
www.pupsquad.org

animal.description:
IN VERMONT / IN NEED OF LOCAL FOSTER OR ADOPTER/ AVAILABLE FOR FOSTER TO ADOPT FOR LOCAL ADOPTERS

Meet Eddie! Here is his video in NC:

https://youtu.be/q8Q3p8oCngc

Eddie is 7 years old (approx. DOB 8-14-13), male, 70 lbs., vetted, is or will be neutered, and micro-chipped. Eddie is a very sweet and handsome boy, good with other dogs and wants to play, has medium energy. a mix of lots of breeds. There's some shepherd in there, maybe some hound (inherent prey drive so no cats please), maybe some lab, maybe a small terrier like a Jack Russell (those ears!)............but he's a big beefy guy! He is full of energy and sits politely for a treat. He loves going for walks outside with his humans! From his VT Foster: Eddie is working on positive reinforcement and knows his basic commands such as Sit, Stay, Down and Paw.....still working on come. He loves people attention and is very comfortable with new people. He loves, walks, peanut butter bones and rubber toys. Eddie is free to roam when left alone and he does best in smaller spaces. He is really food motivated and has made so much progress!! The ideal home would be a fenced in yard where he could run around. He would do best without children or cats but a home that would provide him the training and exercise he needs is most important! Stay tuned for more information as Eddie is a new rescue!

If you are interested in fostering or adopting Eddie please fill out an Application at

www.Passion-4-Paws.org

(please make sure you have the Vermont site not CT) - thanks!

Please note Fosters have 1st option of Adoption.

Check out his Facebook page (please "Like" us while you are there)!

Disclosure:

Breed labels are often incorrect: we rarely know the genetic lineage of the dogs we rescue. Many shelters and rescues specify breeds based on appearance; however, research has shown that less than 2% of a dog's DNA determines appearance!

Passion 4 Paws does not practice the use of labels pertaining to compatibility with others or dog breed. Labels such as "dog friendly" and "child friendly" should be used with caution as they often over-simplify the personalities and behavior of dogs.
