animal.description:
Carmen is a Chihuahua, born in March, 2012. When she was about 3-years old, Carmen lost partial sight in both eyes. In spite of that, she loves playing fetch and tug, and she loves going for walks. Due to barking when left alone, she would not do well in an apartment. Unfortunately, Carmen's timidness along with unwelcomed touch of a toddler caused her to snap (but not bite). For this reason, there should be no young children in her new home. Carmen needs a home with an owner who can be patient with her as she adjusts to her lack of eyesight. Experience with blind dogs is preferred.

Carmen also does great with both gentle dogs and cats! She loves to snuggle with her dog friends and is often found playing with the kitties!

The suggested adoption donation for Carmen is $200. We are a 501c3 organization which means that your donation may be TAX DEDUCTIBLE. Your donation goes toward the high cost of veterinary care for our animals in rescue, as well as providing supportive services to animals in homes.

Information about the adoption process: All adoptions require a completed ADOPTION APPLICATION. Once your application is approved, we will put you in touch with the dogs foster to see if you and the pet are a good match. If so, we will arrange a meeting for you and the pet. The adoptions for all of our animals will take place in the Omaha, NE area and must be done by the adoptive family in person. We do not ship or deliver.

Please Note: We are a RESCUE, which is different from a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We always select the right applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. If you and the dog are not a good match, we will help you select another dog, or we will keep your approved application on file for 6 months.

To learn about Muddy Paws Second Chance Rescue or donate to our animals, please visit our website at MuddyPawsSecondChanceRescue.com or our Facebook Page.

animal.description:
Happy puppy
Hanna is a 7 months old black lab/blue heeler mix puppy girl.

Hanna's story is sadly pretty typical for a rescue puppy. She was found on the streets of Dallas on her own. Animal control picked her up and sent out a call for rescue. She arrived at our rescue with terrible mange and malnourished
, just a puppy at 3 months of age. Her face was crusted with skin infection and missing fur. Despite all these things, she was a sweet, playful and happy puppy. Her story will have a happy ending though. She currently lives in a foster home with other dogs and one cat. She is too playful for cats, so not recommended unless a cat has dog management experience. Hanna has a playful and loyal personality. She is up for anything as long as it's with her "pack". Her retriever genes show through fetching, she can fetch forever :) She likes to go for car rides that take her to Home Depot, Petsmart, a dog park or a park for a walk - part of her socialization routine. Hanna has started going to Camp Bow Wow doggie daycare, and she loves her new friends. Hanna is looking for her furever home with active family and hopefully a doggie sibling.

Hanna has a soft black fur with white trim on her chest and paws. Hanna is potty trained and crate trained. Hanna is fully vetted. She will grow to be a large size dog.

*REQUIRES A YARD* *Children 10 y/o +*

At this age a puppy requires patience, supervision and training to become the best pup she can be. We are requesting a donation of $275 for her adoption which includes spaying, three round of puppy vaccines, a rabies vaccine, and microchip with registration, dewormer and a single dose of heartworm/flea prevention. If you're interested in meeting or adopting her, please complete an application on our website and someone will reach out to you within 48 hours. https://legacyhumanesociety.org/adoptfoster/adoption-application/

AGE: 7 months WEIGHT: 50 lbs (current), 60-80 lbs (full grown)

We do not have a facility to house the dogs in our program. They are all kept in foster homes until they are adopted. Therefore, if you are interested in adopting from LHS, please complete an online application at http://legacyhumanesociety.org/adoptfoster/adoption-application/ and we will contact you asap about the status of your application.

THE AAC IS OPEN BY APPOINTMENT ONLY!
To set up a meet and greet, please fill out a dog adoption application ASAP or if you have already submitted one with us, call/email to put your name in line. We will form a line like usual based on who has an active and approved application in. We will go through our line to set up a private meet and greet for potential adopters to foster.
307-739-1881
adopt@animaladoptioncenter.org

https://form.jotform.com/42994530730154

KitKat - 3 year old, male, Mixed breed, 38 lbs, 

KitKat is medium, mixed breed dog that is learning how to dog! He came from an overcrowded shelter in Texas and he has been getting spoiled with his fosters here in Jackson. KitKat is working on a few things. He thrives when he has consistency and he prefers to have proper meet and greets to other dogs. Once properly introduced, KitKat will play ALL DAY LONG! As soon as he can trust another dog they are best friends. He needs an active home where he can get proper, daily exercise and where he can be in a controlled environment. Unfortunately, no cats! We are working on his training as he gets a little too excited when he starts to play! He will make a great companion for someone as long as they continue on his training plan!

Please note, Animal Adoption Center cannot guarantee the breed, composition or ages of our dogs as we usually have no history prior to them entering the rescue. We make every effort to ensure the dogs are healthy.

Please know that our intention is to insure long lasting committed homes for the animals at the AAC. If we feel that an animal and a potential owner are not a good fit we reserve the right to refuse adoption.

animal.description:
About Leo:  Leo was pulled from a backyard where he was tied. There were kids in the family, But, we are thinking he's been abused so NO CHILDREN are recommended. He is very fearful and mistrusting at this point so only cocker savy adopters will be considered. When Leo arrived he was fairly good with most of the vet staff if they went slow and didn't "ask anything" of him. Exam was tenuous and very limited so the full exam was done while under for his neuter. He seems to like other dogs although we've not had him off leash yet. Only cocker savy adopters will be considered - a fenced yard is required.Leo is selective in who he likes - seems to be mostly men. Again, ONLY EXPERIENCED adopters will be considered !!!!!! 

Our cockers are NOT in a shelter, but in private foster homes, in and around the Columbus OH area.

Information on our dogs (personality, age, weight, etc.), details on our adoption process, adoption fees and the online application can be found on the homepage of our website at www.columbuscockerrescue.org. The frequently asked questions (faq) area should answer questions you have about the adoption process.
 
If you have questions after looking at our website, please click on the lavender box to send an email to us about this particular cocker. Or, email us directly at adoption@columbuscockerrescue.org.

animal.description:
Jacques is new to Beauties and is looking for a foster or forever home. He ended up in the shelter and originally passed evaluations but became reactive while there and was put on the euthanasia list. He has been in the care of our amazing staff for a few weeks decompressing and is now relaxed and doing well. We would love to see him in a home where he can trust and be loved. We will update this information as we learn more about this handsome boy.

Jacques recently went on a field trip with one of our volunteers and this is what she said: 

This guy is one of the best!

This is what I know. He is super sweet, loves to cuddle, rides well in the car and was kind with the people we met. He is strong but doesn't pull too much. He doesn't know a lot of commands but gentle and easy. He was friendly and well adjusted with the vet tech. She only had praise for him. This is a great dog!

animal.description:
The adoption fee for dogs/puppies is $85.00, but we sometimes have specials and/or pets who have had their adoption fee sponsored... call us and let us help you find your next furever friend!!!

This fee includes:
Spay or neuter
Heartworm testing
2 DHLP/PC vaccinations, 3 if very young puppies
Rabies vaccination
Worming and dipping
Microchipping and/or tattoing
References, from your vet and local shelter, animal control agency, or rescue group, are required for all adopters. Our shelter strives to make sure that each animal goes to a permanent, responsible and loving home. Pets are not ready to go home the same day. All pets are spayed or neutered before they are allowed to go home. Please call to check on the availabilty of a specific pet, not all pets listed are at the shelter, some are in foster homes.

animal.description:
Vito is my name, and I love it.  My estimated birthday is: 09/09/2018 As you can see I'm still a youngster and have lots of energy.  I would love a home that is active and likes to play.  I love squeaky toys and playing keep away.  I will give them up though if you really want them.  I would be best with older kids, as young ones may get knocked over by me.  I know the commands sit, stay, come and shake.  I am super smart so I know if you take the time with me, I can learn lots more.  I am sort of dog selective right now.  That means I might like some and not others.  I met a cat, and seemed unsure, so would probably take some work in the home.  Lots of baby steps to get us to like each other 

Meet-Your-Match Canine-ality color is: Orange Busy Bee!!
For safety's sake, we are looking for homes with physical fenced in areas.
Please fill out our online adoption survey at www.mackenzies.info

animal.description:
Star is a beautiful 8 months old puppy. We think she is a pointer Mix, maybe  a german shorthaired pointer with a bit of something else that makes her unique. This puppy is very shy with new people and situations but she is doing wonderful in her current foster home. She loves to cuddle, loves her people and all dogs and cats around. Very gentle dog. 
She needs a family with a fenced yard and time to take care of her. (Mandatory) She is healthy, all up to date on vaccines, spayed and microchipped.
Star is not fully housebroken yet, still has accidents in the house.

 To adopt or foster, please submit a fully completed application on our website at www.nalasrescue.org/adoption-application.
We are located in Palm City, FL and we adopt mostly in a 30 miles radius. We always do home visit, and personalized meet and greet, to insure that your new companion will be a great match for your family. Please do not apply if you live outside our adoption area (Basically Treasure Coast).

animal.description: Hera is a quiet girl who loves some good scratches! She is initially timid with new people, but once she knows you she will snuggle right up. She will gladly throw a paw on you to let you know she wants pets, or she loves to give you a wet nose kiss. She will tag along on any of your daily routines at the house. Hera would make a great buddy to watch Netflix and nap with! For the most part Hera is low energy, but she gets the occasional zoomies! She is such a great dog to go on walks with. She is not one to pull on the leash, because she is just happy to be out with her person! She also understands some basic commands like 'stay, 'sit, and 'come. She has not made any new dog or cat friends yet, but seems eager to meet other dogs on walks. Hera is looking for humans who are around a good amount during the day, and who will be affectionate. She does best in a crate when left alone. Hera has tested positive for Heartworm, but she will be getting treated, and after a few weeks of rest, she will be the belle of the ball. This nugget of joy is looking for her person full of dipping sauce love! She can't wait to meet you and show you her sweet personality. Come meet Hera, she'd love to be your Netflix pal.

THANK YOU for visiting our Petfinder Listing.  PLEASE DO NOT EMAIL US FROM THIS Petfinder site -- emails from PETFINDER go into our SPAM folder and are deleted.  Please visit this dog's bio page on our main website (LINK BELOW), which will give you a complete description, including pictures and up-to-the-minute status and evaluation on this dog by clicking on the dog's photo.  All dogs listed as AVAILABLE for adoption are AVAILABLE.  Our website is updated daily.

OUR MAIN WEBSITE:  http://www.swgermanshepherdrescue.com/ADOPTABLE_DOGS.HTM  

If you are interested in adopting, please fill out a Prospective Adopter's Questionnaire, found on each of the white dogs' bio pages.  We will be in touch by return email.  No contact is made with a prospective adopter until a questionnaire is submitted.

Out-of-state adoptions to surrounding states are possible; however, an in-person introduction with us and our dogs is mandatory.

We look forward to receiving your Prospective Adopter's Questionnaire and to working with you to find your new family member. Thank you.

Tess is a five-year-old mixed breed that was picked up as a stray. She has definitely had a hard life. I am not sure if a home job was done in cropping her ears, but she is not a pit bull. Possibly a lab/Staffordshire cross, but at the end of the day she’s just a mix breed super sweet dog that needs a loving home to make up for the tragedy that she has seen in  in her life.  Despite her scars and signs of abuse, she is fantastic with humans and seems OK with all the dogs here. Not 100% trusting of them, but definitely not looking to start anything either. I would prefer to see her go to a home as an only dog, and we cherished and spoiled in the way that she deserves, with no worries or fears

animal.description:
***PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT AUSTIN DOG RESCUE REGARDING THIS DOG. PLEASE CONTACT THE PERSON LISTED BELOW IN THE AD FOR MORE INFORMATION***

THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING. ADR is not responsible for the health, temperament, behavior or placement of this dog. Listings are done at the request of the dog's owner and as an outreach and community service in hopes of finding these dogs a loving, stable forever home. Placement decisions are made solely at the discretion of the owner and not Austin Dog Rescue. Owners are required to ask for an adoption fee from adopters.

This is the information that we received from Lyla's current foster:

Lyla's owner can no longer keep her with his job and landlord restrictions, so I am looking to re-home her. I am fostering her while we find her a home.

This sweet girl is looking for a new home. Lyla is a 7-year-old, 75-pound German Shepherd. She is spayed and micro-chipped. She absolutely loves butt scratches and belly rubs. She’s been the best WFH partner throughout the pandemic! 

I would not recommend she go to a home with children or small dogs. She plays well with my more submissive Pitt Bull, but she can get aggressive when feeling territorial, especially with toys. She’s also very protective of her home, so she needs someone who understands her fears and can soothe her appropriately. 

She has TONS of energy, and would be best placed with someone who is very active for runs, walks, and lots of fetch. This girl can run all day!

If you are interested in meeting this super intelligent cutie, please contact Genivieve at: genivieve.glynn@gmail.com

animal.description:
Heidi was rescued, as a tired Mother, along with a litter of her puppies. Naturally they were all adopted into wonderful homes just as soon as they were old enough to leave her. But finding the perfect family for Heidi has been a lot more challenging. 

Given her past, its not hard to imagine that Heidi was petrified of humans when she was rescued. Thanks to her incredibly patient foster family, she has slowly opened up over the last year and is finally learning to trust that not all humans are mean and has infact come to love her temporary family!

Heidi is definitely an inside dog, however she does still largely prefer to spend the majority of her time outside, if she is able so a fenced in yard will be a necessary requirement of her adopter, as well as a patient, calm and understanding demeanor, 

She desperately needs to find that one person who can complete the final phases in healing her broken spirit and capture her guarded heart!

animal.description:
Kenobi | Urgent foster needed!

Sweet cocker spaniel Kenobi is in need of a new foster home ASAP! 

At just 6 years young, poor Kenobi is mostly blind, and he also needs surgery to fix both knees. He came to us in a pretty sad state of neglect with matted fur, double ear infections, and swollen and sore eyes. His current foster parents have showered him with love and diligent care to provide relief for his eyes, but unfortunately circumstances have changed and we now need to find a new foster home to help him finish the road to a pain free and healthy life! 

Kenobi is such a sweet and affectionate boy, and he's doing so well getting around in his halo for blind dogs. He just needs somewhere to crash so he can recover from his upcoming knee surgery. He requires daily eye meds and is an exemplary patient for his caregivers. Contact us today if you have a quiet spot in your home for Kenobi to recover from his knee repairs so he can find his loving forever family!


Southern California adopters only please!
(San Diego area preferred)


Facebook: https://facebook.com/waggingdogrescue/photos_albums

Adoption Application: 
https://waggingdog.org/adopt/

Website: https://waggingdog.org
Email: adoptions@waggingdog.org

animal.description:
Kuzco is a 7 month old cute puppy who is very active, housebroken and crate trained. Named after the emperor in a recent Disney film, he can be a sweetie - but he also likes getting his own way. An experienced home, willing to set limits and invest in training is a must for this boy.

He has just completed an obedience training session and will happily show you all that he has learned. He follows commands and has been well socialized with other dogs and people. He lives in a GSROC foster home and gets along well with the medium and large dogs there.

He will thrive in an experienced home that enjoys the typical GSD personality and will provide him with the structure and training he craves.

He will do best in an adult home or one with older children. This is not the puppy for families with small kids. He is only 7 months old and filled with puppy energy. Sometimes his exuberance gets the best of him that is why we recommend a home with older children. He is active, likes to explore and have a good time. Sitting around as a couch potato is something Kuczo would never dream of doing.

Once Kozco trusts and respects you he will follow the rules, and loves to cuddle with his people. And then he will be ready to get up, get moving and have fun again.

Please remember, adopting a puppy is not everyone's cup of tea. As cute as they are - puppies demand a large investment of time, patience, and training. They are inquisitive, have endless energy and get into just about everything. They dig, chew, and seemingly never stop! Think long and hard about your lifestyle.

If you are not willing to invest the time and training to ensure your puppy matures into the wonderful dog - then please consider an older dog.

Please go to our website and complete an adoption application at:

/https://www.gsroc.org/application/

An adoption counselor will contact you to go over your application and assist you in determining which dog may be best for your particular situation.

animal.description:
Goddess absolutely lives up to her name, in every sense of the word! She epitomizes the ultimate diva from her sassy yet sweet demeanor to the classy and sophisticated way she behaves and draws humans into her heart. She is stunning to look at from her glossy silver coat to her doe like Bambi eyes...Miss Goddess is a Bombshell Pup! 

So its only natural that she would prefer that her family reserve ALL of the attention and "animal love" for her and her alone! As much as she adores humans, Goddess does not get along well with any other animals. 

She doesn't mind sharing her parents with human siblings (since they will surely become instantly enamored with her as well and only serve to offer her MORE love, attention, belly rubs and did we mention, more attention!?) 

Plus she LOVES to play, especially outside and kids are usually really eager to join her there, too!  Even if she cant find anyone to romp around with when she is outside, Goddess also really enjoys sunbathing and relaxing in the warm rays! 

She has an enormous heart and wants to be cuddled and loved as much as she possibly can! Whatever makes Goddess the center of attention is right up her alley but she is also perfectly satisfied to lounge around and nap at her people's feet if they're home and she will patiently be waiting to greet them with bells on, when she has to be left home alone. 

Goddess truly is an exceptional girl and she is just waiting to find the perfect family to appreciate her in all of her glory!

animal.description:
Sam has by far taken my heart he's such an incredible dog! I'm having a hard time giving him up but I know he will find the love he needs with another family. Sam is a big baby and is so incredibly gentle he DOSEN'T have one mean bone in him. He gets along with my two cats and 3 large dogs, but his favorite bud is my little bull terrier. They really love each other so much so I would really like for him to be in a home with another dog! He definitely deserves to have a buddy. Sam is very energetic, so he will need someone who likes to go on runs and adventures and will be willing to take him along. A family with kids that can keep him busy would be great too! I like to say he has an old soul. Once he builds a connection with you, the love he offers is out of this world. Its breaks my heart to even think someone dropped him off on the streets because they no longer wanted him. Sam is fully housetrained and has had no accidents since in my care. He does come with a gnarly scar on his knee from the knee surgery we had to do because he got hit by a car. He still favors it a tad, but its fully works. You can grab it and it doesn't bother him one bit. Sam really is an all around perfect dog. Sam is a great protector and he knows when someone's at the door without them even knocking and he lets me know immediately. I will say hes a bulldozer and will plop his big self in your lap like he's a lap dog. I just really hope whomever is truly interested takes in to consideration what I asked above for Sammy. If Sam sounds like a match, please apply at www.hhfrescue.org.

The adoption fee includes vaccinations, bordetella, deworming, rabies, spay/neuter, microchip, a lifetime registration of the microchip, and sales tax. If adopting a puppy, the rabies and spay/neuter will be done at the same time by our vet once they are 4 months old and billed to us. It is against the law in the State of Texas for a rescue not to be sterilized so we have to make sure it gets completed and that we have record of it.

animal.description:
Willa is a bundle of laughs and a barrell of fun! Where ever she goes...good times tend to follow! From her wild and silly antics to her zoomie laps...this girl is excitement personified! 

Of course, all that fun can be a challenge to rein in at times so the ideal home for her would be someone with an active lifestyle,,,ready to include her in their adventures but also someone with knowledge on dog training or funds to hire a professional trainer.
 
She is a very very sweet girl but will need to be adequately exercised as well as be provided with plenty of enrichment and mental stimulation, in order for her to be truly happy and well adjusted.

Since she is so energetic, she would very likely accidentally knock small children down so a home with older kids, if any will be best for her. 

She does not get along with cats, being that she enjoys chasing them so much but she does get along well with other dogs, provided they are all slowly and properly introduced to each other. While she thoroughly enjoys making friends with new dogs, her over the top and in your face attitude is a bit much for most other dogs at first. However, if all the dogs are given time and plenty of space to get to know each other on their own terms, most dogs end up playing nicely with Willa after all is said and done.

animal.description:
Stunning Miss Kita is 100% of "THE Total Package" that makes up a fantastic dog!

Not only is she adorable and a total sweetheart to boot...She also LOVES other dogs, cats and kids!!! So she could truly be a lovely addition to most any home! 

She is house trained and crate trained and already knows some basic commands as well! 

While Kita does love to romp and play and of course, swoons over a chance at a nice long walk or play date outside,,,she also really loves to snuggle up with her people or a furry sibling and enjoy a nice naptime, day or night! 

As you can see in the before/after photo that's included in her bio, Kita's transformation truly illustrates what rescue is all about. After being graciously spared from a bleak existence of severe neglect, she has truly blossomed into the very idea of what a happy and well adjusted dog should be!! As a rescuer, being able to bridge the gap between a traumatic past and future with limitless possibility is one of life's greatest blessings!  

After having already been with her rescue for over a year, with very little interest at all, Kita's dream come true would be for her to find a family of her very own to love her as much as she will love them!

animal.description:
New to OCDRT from a shelter in PA

Bella is being fostered in Columbus

Bella is around a year old & entered the shelter with a very large wound & tested positive for 2 tick born diseases. She was under a lengthy quarantine and started showing distress like an ACD does with lack of exercise, so OCDRT was asked to take her in. She will be retested with OCDRT's vet before she is released for adoption.

Bella does not seem to know what a house is & has been indifferent to the other dogs, however she is starting to play with them. She met the resident cat and does well with him. She will learn all about crate training, socialization with other dogs & cats, basic obedience, foundation skills, & have her vetting completed. Bella will require an ACD savvy home. Please check back for updates as we learn what type of home Bella will require.

UPDATE 10/1/2020: Bella has been with us for less than two weeks, and has made great progress. She is doing well with house breaking,  crate training and crates herself.  Bella has developed some fundamental manners interacting with her foster humans, and foster sisters.  She no longer is afraid of the kitchen appliances.  We now can walk through a doorway to go outside without bolting through the door.  Bella is typical cattle dog smart.  She walks well on a leash, heels (most of the time), knows sit, leave it (the cat), no, easy (taking treats), and we are working on down, and her recall.  Bella prefers women and doesn't interact much with men. Due to her past a fenced in yard is preferred and ACD experience is required. 

Update 10/25/2020: We had some tests completed at our vet for the tick born diseases, Bella is not symptomatic & tested negative for her PCR so she has been cleared and is not in need of any treatments. She is learning to like attention from her Foster Dad & is doing wonderful with her ACD & cat siblings 

Our website with additional information can be found at: http://www.ocdrescueteam.org/ 

If you would like to sponsor a foster please go to http://www.ocdrescueteam.org/donate we also appreciate donations towards a fosters excessive medical expenses.  

PLEASE READ ALL INFORMATION BELOW - THANK YOU! 

Our adoption fee of $250, goes towards the rescues spaying/neutering, vaccinations, microchip, fecal testing, de-worming, heartworm/tick disease testing and treatment/preventative, any other medical needs are addressed, and all fosters are fed a premium food. Thank You for considering a rescue, that comes to you with all of the routine medical done. 

If interested please email info@ocdrescueteam.org for an adoption application. Please note a foster's needs before filling out an application. Our fosters are in our homes for at least 2 weeks before adoption. We learn their likes/dislikes and these concerns are noted in their bios. 


PLEASE NOTE: This is not a public shelter. This dog is being fostered in a private home until adoption. Prospective adopters who have submitted an accepted application and completed a telephone interview are welcome to schedule an appointment to travel to meet the dog. The dogs are adopted on first come, first serve basis. If approved for adoption, a deposit will hold the dog until a meeting is arranged at the fosters home.

animal.description:
Idgie is a 45-lb. pup who loves other dogs and would do great in a home with older kids. While she likes humans of all sizes, she tends to be very bouncy and jumpy still and may knock over little ones. 

Idgie is a fun-loving mini Houdini who needs a securely fenced yard to play in. Idgie is learning to be a good leash walker and is 99.9% housetrained. :) Her ideal family would be active and interested in continuing to build on her training. 

Her foster mom says she is "100% the sweetest most loving girl," but she needs someone who can understand and manage her prey drive and love her, quirks, and all.

All of our animals are examined by a veterinarian, given age-appropriate vaccinations, dewormed, microchipped, spayed or neutered, heartworm tested, and treated if necessary. Vet references are required and prior to adoption, a home inspection will be conducted.   

Transport options available. An adoption fee applies. 
If interested go to www.pmarinc.org for an application.

home_environment_attributes.other_animals: Idgie can not be in a home with cats or other small animals.

animal.description:
Winston is the sweetest boy you’ll ever meet!  He is loving and playful and really loves having doggie siblings!  He has come such a long way in his short life.  He requires daily seizure meds and occasional checkups and would love to be in a home where someone is with him all day.  He is a determined little guy who will not let anything stand in his way!

You can complete an adoption application on our website at:  
     www.onceuponatailrescue.com
or
     Scroll down on this page & click "More About Us", & then click "Adoption            Application" underneath our bright Pink logo. 

If you want to meet a pup in person, Once Upon a Tail Rescue does adoption events at PetSmart in Covington, LA on most Saturdays with many of our adoptable dogs there. 

Don't forget to complete your application ahead of time, so you don't miss out on the pup you've connected with.  If pre-approved, you have first priority & can usually take home your new best friend the same day!  

*Please note that there is no obligation to adopt by completing an application.*

**All dogs are required to have complete vet services, including shots, rabies, spay/neuter and microchip, which are included in the Adoption Fee. Some dogs may still require completion of these services due to current age, size, breed and/or health. All vet services must be done at the vet clinic used by Once Upon a Tail Rescue.

animal.description:
Vada-Girl is an sassy little lady who loves a great adventure and is happiest when exploring outdoors! She is also very smart and affectionate so when she isn't outside, she's thrilled to bond while learning new tricks (she already knows most basic commands), cuddle up for a nap with her person or stimulate her mind and other senses with enrichment activities!

She will be best suited to a home with older children who will take her on a hike or let her tag along with them on an outing, rather than smaller ones who may be too excited and make her nervous.  

While she does play quite nicely with some other dogs, she is selective when choosing her canine companions so a meet and greet will be needed to determine whether or not she could join an already established pack or not.

animal.description:
Dizzy is one big, happy boy! He weighs in at 65 pounds and we think he is 1-2 years old. He came to us as a transfer from another shelter so unfortunately we have no real history. We did hear that he got into scuffles with other male dogs although since being here at HAL we have not had any issues thus far. He can be selective with males but is currently in a play group with two other male dogs. However we still believe he would do best in a home with another female dog. Dizzy is very friendly, out-going and treat-motivated. He walks well on leash and keeps his kennel clean here. He loves to play ball and with rope toys. He would make a very affectionate, loyal companion and is very tolerant. He would NOT be a dog park dog due to being selective of male dogs in his space. He would be happy in a home where he could play for hours with his people in a fenced back yard.  Long walks would be best if they were not in crowded places, so city life could be problematic. This handsome boy wants to be close to his people and that's what really makes him happy. We recommend that he goes to a home with older kiddos only 10+ since he really does not know his own strength or size. No kitties, please.  Please research POSITIVE training techniques before applying to adopt. We care very much about your application answers and they are reviewed for completeness and the best match.
His adoption fee of $175.00 includes neuter, current vaccines, microchip, vet visit, offer of pet health insurance, and engraved ID tag.

**ADOPTIONS ARE BY APPOINTMENT ONLY WITH AN APPROVED ADOPTION APPLICATION. Please see our website for our adoption application at

https://homeatlasths.org/dog-adoption-application/

and information on the adoption process

animal.description:
Our sweet Remo. This handsome fellow has come a LONG way. He came to us from a shelter in Atlanta, GA having HUGE holes in is shoulders and thighs. He was severely malnourished. He came to Hard Knocks, and after a little TLC and an amazing foster, Remo has learned to walk, run, play, and trust. Remo LOVES to play ball......like.....really loves to play ball. That's all he thinks about day and night. He has to have a tennis ball with him at all times. 

Its so hard to describe sweet Remo digitally. He truly is such a good boy who has been through so much. His perfect home would have to be with someone who is understanding, patient, and respectful of all the trauma Remo has experienced.


Thank you so much for your inquiry. Our sweet Hard Knocker is currently available for adoption. Our process in adopting out our dogs begins with an adoption application. Please complete this form on our website using the following link, https://www.hkrtinc.com/adoption-form. 

Once you have submitted your application, please allow up to 72 hours for a response. Once approved, you will be contacted to set up a meet and greet. Submitting an application does not guarantee an adoption. We do not operate on a first come first serve basis. We want our dogs to find the perfect home. We also want to do our best to find the perfect matched dog for your home. 

If you have any further questions regarding the pup you have inquired about, please feel free to email directly to hkrtrescue@gmail.com.


Thank you so much for your support and for helping us #dowhatsrightnotwhatseasy.
